original_poem:
J'ai jet√© mon coeur un peu √† tout vent,
√† pr√©sent j'ai peur, j'ai peur, je le sens
qu'il ne sache plus battre comme avant,
qu'il ne sache plus ce que √ßa veut dire aimer vraiment.
 J'ai jet√© mon coeur et je m'en repens,
plaisir et bonheur se confondent souvent.
J'ai voulu go√ªter a tout en m√™me temps
et j'ai oubli√© ce que √ßa veut dire aimer vraiment.
 Ved–µvo in tutti il primo amore,
l'amore che m'ha f–µrito un d√¨
ma il mio passato √® vivo ancor, il suo ricordo, il primo s√¨.
Sbagliare √® stato facile giocando con l'amore cos√¨.
 Con questo mio cuore, ho sempre scherzato,
√® un cuore malato che amar pi√π non sa.
Somiglia ad un fiore tra l'erba falciato
che ancor profumato amore dar√† a chi lo vorr√†
e un giorno chiss√† qualcun l'amer√†.
translated_poem:
I threw my heart a bit to the wind,
right now I'm afraid, I'm afraid, I feel
that it no longer knows how to beat as before,
that it no longer knows what true love means.
 I threw away my heart and I'm sorry,
pleasure and happiness are often confused.
I wanted to taste everything at the same time
and I forgot what true love means.
 I saw my first love in everyone,
the love that wounded me one day
but my past is still alive, his first memory, his first yes.
Making mistakes was easy playing with love that way.
 With this heart of mine, I have always played,
it's a sick heart that no longer knows how to love.
It's like a flower among the mown grass
that will still give fragrant love to those who want it
and one day, who knows, someone will love it.

translated_poem:
The Flemish ladies dance in silence
In silence on the chiming Sundays
The Flemish ladies dance in silence
Flemish ladies aren‚Äôt much for chat
If they dance it‚Äôs because they‚Äôre twenty years old
And at twenty one years you must get engaged
Get engaged so you can get married
And get married to have children
That‚Äôs what their parents told them
And the churchwarden and even His Eminence
The Dean who preaches at the convent
And that is why and that is why they dance
The Flemish ladies
The Flemish ladies
The Flem-, the Flem-, the Flemish ladies
 The Flemish ladies dance without flinching
Without flinching on the chiming Sundays
The Flemish ladies dance without flinching
Flemish ladies aren‚Äôt much for flinching
If they dance, it‚Äôs because they‚Äôre thirty years old
And at thirty years old, it‚Äôs good to show
That all is well, that the children are growing
And the hops and the corn in the field
They are the pride of their parents
And of the churchwarden and of His Eminence
The Dean who preaches at the convent
And that is why and that is why they dance
The Flemish ladies
The Flemish ladies
The Flem-, the Flem-, the Flemish ladies
 The Flemish ladies dance without smiling
Without smiling on the chiming Sundays
The Flemish ladies dance without smiling
Flemish ladies aren‚Äôt much for smiling
If they dance, it‚Äôs because they‚Äôre seventy years old
And at seventy years old, it‚Äôs good to show
That all is well, that the grandchildren are growing
And the hops and the corn in the field
All dressed in black like their parents
Like the churchwarden and like His Eminence
The Dean who rambles at the convent
They‚Äôre inheriting and that is why they dance
The Flemish ladies
The Flemish ladies
The Flem-, the Flem-, the Flemish ladies
 The Flemish ladies dance without slacking
Without slacking on the chiming Sundays
The Flemish ladies dance without slacking
Flemish ladies aren‚Äôt much for slacking
If they dance, it‚Äôs because they‚Äôre a nundred1 years old
And at a nundred years old, it‚Äôs good to show
That all is well, that you‚Äôre still nifty on your pins
And have good hops and good corn in the field
They‚Äôre away to rejoin their parents
And the churchwarden and even His Eminence
The Dean who rambles at the convent
And that is why for one last time they dance
The Flemish ladies
The Flemish ladies
The Flem-, the Flem-, the Flemish ladies

The singer is mocking a dialect pronunciation of the word ‚Äòcent‚Äô ‚Äì ‚Äòhundred‚Äô

translated_poem:
Joseph =
What matters to be happy?
Very little, if we wish so
But color never matters
Color never matters
Color never matters
 What matters to be loved?
More or less the person we are
But color never matters
Color never matters
Color never matters
 Appearance-wise, it is the most trivial feature
It is irrelevant
Appearance-wise, it is the most negligible feature
White, yellow, black
 We love you in every color
Of skin, of flag and from elsewhere
Between blue and pink
We're not looking for a middle ground
You're pretty on the inside
 Appearance-wise, it is the most trivial feature
It is irrelevant
Appearance-wise, it is the most negligible feature
White, yellow, black
 We love you in every color
Of skin, of flag and from elsewhere
Between blue and pink
We're not looking for a middle ground
You're pretty on the inside
 Maybe love is what matters
Maybe being surrounded by friends matters
But color never matters
Color never matters
Color never matters
Color never matters

translated_poem:
I know that this time, it's the end
I know that there's nothing more we can do
I know, but I can't believe it
I know that there's no more hope left
 I am scared, so scared alone during the night
I am cold, so cold all alone at night
I cry with hatred at dawn
I hate you moaning out of love
 Oh, but I feel bad, so bad
To think that someone else already
Has you in his arms
Oh, I feel bad, so bad
And yet
For a very long time
I know, I know
 I know that I never knew
I know that I shouldn't have
I know that I've often been wrong
I know that our love is dead
 And I feel bad, so bad
To think that someone else already
Has you in his arms
And I feel so bad, so bad
And yet
For a very long time
I know, I know
 I know that there's nothing more we can do
I know that this time, it's the end
I know I should forget you
I shouldn't cry
I shouldn't scream
 But I love you, I love you
I love you, I love you
I love you, I love you
I love you

Among life

When i see
The danger
To protect you

Yes, in the eyes of your love
I'm the strongest

The blue sky can fall on us
And the earth can crumble away,
None of it matters if you love me,
I don‚Äôt give a damn about the entire world.

I would go do the impossible,

translated_poem:
Before leaving me, have you considered this?
If you leave here, you may be making the mistake of your life
Yes, of your life
You can say that everything I gave to you
Was nothing at all or very little, and yet it was
The best of me
I loved as a man does and you're a woman
Dreaming every day of the best love experience
And who ends up disappointed
 So listen: a little bit of love is better than no love
Even a weak love is better than no love
There's nothing sadder than having a heart deprived of love
You must know that a little bit of love is better than no love
Even a bad love is better than no love
There's nothing sadder than having a heart deprived of love
 A heart deprived of love, like this old man
On a square bench, with his hat in hand and who doesn't know
Where to go tomorrow
Like this street child
Who begs to live and who never lived with a roof over his head
And who doesn't know how he's called
Like this troubled girl
Leaning on a bridge, at the end of the pier, crying
On the raging ocean
 So listen: a little bit of love is better than no love
Even a weak love is better than no love
There's nothing sadder than having a heart deprived of love
You must know that a little bit of love is better than no love
Even a weak love is better than no love
There's nothing sadder than having a heart deprived of love

Even a weak love is better than no love
There's nothing sadder than having a heart deprived of love
You must know that a little bit of love is better than no love
Even a weak love is better than no love
There's nothing sadder than having a heart deprived of love

translated_poem:
If a man is made of mud to a lot of people
To me, he's made of flesh, blood
Muscles, iron, a heart of gold*
And two shoulders to load up the coal
 You load sixteen tons and what do you get?
Another day going towards the coffin
The shovel getting heavier day by day
But who will keep the mine going without you?
 When your mother has already five mouths to feed
Another one, it's no pleasure cruise
So you work like a dog
But your boss keeps saying: ''You're a champion''
 You load sixteen tons and what do you get?
Another day going towards the coffin
The shovel getting heavier day by day
But who will keep the mine going without you?
 When you work yourself to death down there all week long
Sunday finally comes and you can enjoy the sky
And in your white sheets, as soon as you wake up
Your wife's eyes look like sun
 You load sixteen tons and what do you get?
Another day going towards the coffin
The shovel getting heavier day by day
But who will keep the mine going without you?
 You load sixteen tons and what do you get?
Another day going towards the coffin
The shovel getting heavier day by day
But who will keep the mine going without you?

 Angel

translated_poem:
Angel
You have a such sweet-sounding name
It must make all the other names
In this world jealous
 Angel
You know how to make
Those who approach you
Crazy about you
 Your voice through the night
As being in a dream
Is a reminder for the one
Who will be your only love
 Angel
Tell him that your heart
Is in love with him
That you want his happiness
 Angel
 You know that everything changes
Even the softest heart
But your name so sweet
Is your greatest asset
 Angel
You have a such sweet-sounding name
It must make all the other names
In this world jealous
 Angel, Angel

original_poem:
You are the one for me, for me, for me, formidable
You are my love very, very, very, veritable
Et je voudrais pouvoir un jour enfin te le dire
Te l'√©crire
Dans la langue de Shakespeare
My daisy, daisy, daisy, desirable
Je suis malheureux d' avoir si peu de mots
√Ä t'offrir en cadeaux
Darling I love you, love you, darling I want you
Et puis c' est a peu pres tout
You are the one for me, for me, for me, formidable
 You are the one for me, for me, for me, formidable
But how can you
See me, see me, see me, si minable
Je ferais mieux d'aller choisir mon vocabulaire
Pour te plaire
Dans la langue de Moli√®re
Toi, tes eyes, ton nose, tes lips adorables
Tu n'as pas compris tant pis
Ne t'en fais pas et viens-t-en dans mes bras
Darling I love you, love you,
Darling, I want you
Et puis le reste on s'en fout
You are the one for me, for me, for me, formidable
Je me demande meme
Pourquoi je t'aime
Toi qui te moques de moi et de tout
Avec ton air canaille, canaille, canaille
How can I love you
translated_poem:
You're the only one for me, for me, for me, formidable
You are my true love, very, very, very true
And someday I want to be able to tell you
To write it down for you
In the language of Shakespeare
My daisy, daisy, daisy, desirable one
I am unhappy that I have only a few words
To give as a gift to you
My love for you is immeasurable and I want you so badly, my darling
And that's about it
You're the only one for me, for me, for me, formidable
 You're the only one for me, for me, for me, formidable
But how's it possible for you to see me
See me, see me, see me, so pitiful?
I'd do better to go and choose my words wise
To please you
In the language of Moli√®re
You and your adorable nose, lips, and eyes
If you don't understand, that's too bad
Don't worry about it and come into my arms
My darling, I love you, love you
I want you, my darling
And we don't care about anything else
You're the only one for me, for me, for me, formidable
I even wonder
Why I love you
You who don't care about me or anything else
With your mischievous, mischievous, mischievous air
How can I love you?

The evening star sparkles
Make a wish - it's important
especially if you believe in it

translated_poem:
[spoken:]
 Go, summer, go,
you'll never return.
I couldn't forget you because
 [sung:]
 I lived with you the azure days
and they will remain
the most beautiful for me.
 When we met last summer
everything seemed more beautiful to us.
When we met again after the vacation,
how we were changed.
 Time passes,
the time of love,
time passes
and already we forget.
 You took my sixteen years in your arms
and you closed your eyes.
Yesterday I met you in front of my school,
how we have changed.
 Time passes
and perhaps just tomorrow
we'll have lost our innocence
and our childhood dreams.
 ~~~~~
 Time passes
and perhaps just tomorrow
we'll have lost our innocence
and our childhood dreams.

translated_poem:
Gonna be alright!1
The people2 keeps saying in this day3
Gonna be alright
Despite the mutineers, everything will succeed.
 Our confused ennemies stop there4
And we're gonna sing "Alleluiah!"
It's gonna be alright
When Boileau, once from the clergy, spoke
Like a prophet, he predicted it.
 While singing my ditty
Joyfully5 they're gonna say:
"Gonna be alright"
Following the maxims of the gospel
Of the legislator6, everything will be accomplished7
 The one who'll rise, we'll lower them
The one who'll lower themself8, we'll rise them up
True catechism shall teach us
And the awful fanatism will extinguish
 To be, to the law, obedient9
All French shall exert themselves10
It's gonna be alright!
Pierrette and Margot11 are singing the guinguette12
Let us rejoice, for the good time shall come!
 The French people once nonplussed13
The aristocrat says: "Mea culpa!"14
The clergy regrets their possessions15
With justice, the nation shall have it16
 By17 the prudent Lafayette18
Everyone shall be in peace19
Gonna be alright!
By the torches of the august assembly
Gonna be alright!
The people in arms shall always keep themselves
 Truth and false we shall tell apart20
The citizen, for the good, shall support21
Gonna be alright!
When the aristocrat will be protesting
The good citizen will laugh at them22
Without having their soul troubled
Always the stronger will be
 Little ones and tall alike are soldiers in their heart
During the war, no one shall betray.
From the bottom of their heart, all good French shall fight
And when seeing suspicious acts, shall speak boldly.
 Lafayette says: "Come whoever wills!
Without any fear of fire nor flame23
The French shall always vanquish!
Gonna be alright!
 The aristocrats to the rope24
Gonna be alright!
The aristocrats, we shall hang them!
Gonna be alright!
The aristocrats to the rope!
Gonna be alright!
The aristocrats, we shall hang them!
 If we don't hang them
We shall break them
If we don't break them
We shall burn them
Gonna be alright!
Gonna be alright!
We had no more nobles nor priests
Gonna be alright!
Equality will reign everywhere
 The Austrian slave will follow
Gonna be alright!
And their diabolical gang
To the devil will fly away
 Gonna be alright!
The aristocrats to the rope!
Gonna be alright!
The aristocrats, we shall hang them!
And when they will be all hanged
We will put the shovel in their arse25
 Verses improvised during the morning
In the Champ-de-Mars 26 during a downpour
 Gonna be alright!
In spite of aristocrats and rain27
Gonna be alright!
We will get wet, but it shall end
 Gonna be alright!
We'll knot it well enough for it to untie28
Gonna hold alright29
And in two thousand years they shall still remember!
  1.
see main comment below
2.
"peuple" means the people, as in "peoples" (peuples). It's not just the population, the individuals, it's them all taken as a whole, as a political subject, and it often refers specifically to the poorer classes, to the ones who are governed. It's the "people" in "of the people, by the people, for the people" that defines democracy.
3.
meaning today
4.
"en rester l√†" means to keep at a certain stage without going any further. For instance, if people have a kind of duel, and no one is clearly the winner, they can stop and call it a draw, and you can say they "en rester l√†", lit. "stay of it there".
5.
lit. "with pleasure"
6.
the person, fictive or real, who holds the legislative power; nowadays it's typically the parliament
7.
There is an ambiguity here, whether he means the gospel of the legislator, or that everything "of" the legislator will be accomplished. I don't know if this is in purpose or if it's really meant as either of the two meanings.
8.
in French it is not gendered, without being explicitly gender-neutral. I felt that gender-neutral they was adequate here.
9.
Here again, the syntax is inverted, both for poetic purpose and to get the rhyme
10.
They shall exert themselves to be obedient/docile/tame to the law.
11.
I don't know what exactly is behind the choice of these two names
12.
old type of dance
13.
The song uses a now obsolete Latin phrase, "a quia"
14.
"My bad", "my fault"
15.
lit. "all the good (meaning the goods) they have
16.
I'm not entirely sure what this refers to. Could be that they should be vanquished, or that we should get the clergy's goods.
17.
as in, passive voice
18.
great French general of the XVIIIth Century
19.
or "appeased"
20.
lit. "The true from the false we will know"
21.
This sentence makes little sense from modern French lense, because we don't say "soutenir pour" (support for), but maybe it used to be an actual phrasal verb
22.
lit. "laugh at their nose"
23.
"ni feu ni flamme" is a typical phrase in French
24.
The original says "to the lanterne". It means specifically here a street light, to which people can be hanged.
25.
I don't know if there is a reference behind this weirdly specific practice, though indeed it sounds like an efficient "punishment"
26.
large public greenspace in Paris
27.
the original makes popular (but from the slang of the time) and oral-like contractions
28.
clearly referring to the rope on the neck of someone, probably some noble, maybe the King himself
29.
tenir = to last, to stay, to keep in place, in position; speaking of the knot

original_poem:
Comme tout le monde, j'ai mes d√©fauts,
j'ai pas toujours les mots qu'il faut,
mais si tu lis entre les lignes
tu trouveras dans mes chansons
tout ce que je n'ai pas su te dire.
 S√© que perd√≠ la raz√≥n,
fue detr√°s del coraz√≥n.
Y es que a pesar de lo que am√©
como jam√°s hab√≠a amado,
no supe amarte a ti, ya s√©.
 (Tu trouveras...)
Mes blessures et mes faiblesses,
celles que j'avoue qu'√† demi-mot.
(Tu trouveras...)
Mes faux, pas mes maladresses
et de l'amour plus qu'il n'en faut.
(Encontrar√°s...)
Que si te vas o si me dejas
voy a volar muy lejos del dolor,
que perderte, no te miento,
no me cuesta.
 Despu√©s de m√≠ otra quiz√°s,
y como yo, s√≥lo otra m√°s,
y en el espacio que le cedo
dale mi amor y tiempo nuevo,
todo lo que ya no espero.
 Le temps vous endurcit de tout,
des illusions, des mauvais coups.
Si je n'ai pas su te retenir,
sache qu'il y a dans mes chansons
tout c'que j'n'ai pas eu le temps de te dire.
 (Encontrar√°s...)
Es locura, no es tristeza,
lo que me parte en dos la voz.
(Encontrar√°s...)
Cu√°nta herida, qu√© belleza
saber que a√∫n queda mucho amor.
J'ai tellement peur que tu me laisses,
sache que si j'en fais toujours trop
c'est pour qu'un peu tu me restes,
tu me restes.
 (Encontrar√°s...)
Es locura, no es tristeza,
(No es tristeza...)
lo que me parte en dos la voz.
(En dos la voz...)
Cu√°nta herida, qu√© belleza,
(Oh no...)
et de l'amour plus qu'il n'en faut.
J'ai tellement peur que tu me laisses,

No me cuesta.
translated_poem:
Like everyone else, I have my defects,
I don't always have the right words,
but if you read between the lines,
you will find in my songs
everything I didn't know how to tell you.
 I know I lost my reason,
and my heart ran after it.
'Cause even though I loved
as I had never loved,
I didn't know how to love you, I already know it.
 (You will find...)
My wounds and my weaknesses,
those that I only half confess.
(You will find...)
My forgeries, not my blunders,
and more love than necessary.
(You will find...)
That if you go or if you leave me,
I'm going to fly far away from pain
'cause losing you, I'm not lying,
is no problem.
 After me, another one perhaps,
and like me, only one more,
and in the space I'm giving her,
give her new love and time,
everything that I'm no longer waiting for.
 Time hardens everything in you,
your illusions and low hits.
If I didn't know how to retain you,
may you know that in my songs is
everything that I didn't have the time to tell you.
 (You will find...)
It is madness, not sorrow,
what breaks my voice in two.
(You will find...)
So many wounds, so beautiful
to know that there is still so much love left.
I'm very afraid of you leaving me,
may you know that if I'm always doing too much
it is for you to stay with me a bit longer,
to stay with me.
 (You will find...)
It is madness, not sorrow,
(Not sorrow...)
what breaks my voice in two.
(My voice in two...)
So many wounds, so beautiful
(Oh no...)
and more love than necessary.
I'm very afraid of you leaving me,
may you know that if I'm always doing too much
it is for you to stay with me a bit longer.
It's no problem.

translated_poem:
You're smiling
and the next moment
I believe you're forgetting about me
In one hour, everything has changed
and I see
the sun being blocked by a cloud.1
 I hear you
singing like all the violins in the spring
But suddenly, your song becomes sadder
and I see
the sun being blocked by a cloud.1
 It's love, and then it's no longer love
Tears that wreck my joy
It's both hell and heaven in one day
And that's my life with you
 Oooooooooh! I'm out of here
I'm leaving you, and I'm coming back two days later
because I believe that - through loving you -
I can erase that cloud blocking the sun
 It's love, and then it's no longer love
Tears that wreck my joy
It's both hell and heaven in one day
and that's my life with you
 Oooooooooh! I'm out of here
I'm leaving you, and I'm coming back two days later
because I believe that - through loving you -
I can erase that cloud blocking the sun
 Yes, you're smiling, smiling
and the next moment
I believe you're forgetting about me
In one hour, everything has changed
And I see
the sun being blocked by a cloud1
 Hmm! I hear you, I hear you
singing like all the violins in the spring
but suddenly, your song becomes sadder
and I see
the sun being blocked by a cloud.1
Sun, sun, sun
 Yes, I'm out of here
I'm leaving you, and I'm coming back two days later...
  1.
a. b. c. d. Literally "And I see passing a cloud in the sun", referring to the sun being blocked by a cloud.

original_poem:
Another night without you...
Another night...
 Ce que tu fais, ce que tu dis
Tu me transport dans une nouvelle galaxie
Tu as change ma vie ou est le paradis
Je suis soeul aujourd'hui tout la nuit
You walk out the door, I'm lonely
'Cause you're the only one, the one and only
I need you in the heat of the night
Come quick, I wanna hold you tight
 Could you feel, I need you
When you're in my arms, all my dreams come true
When you're gone, I feel weak
It's so hard to be all alone, another night without you
 Let me feel all the warm next to you
Let me feel the passion
All alone I've been waiting for you
Let me feel the passion
 Another night
(Another night)
Can't be without you, baby

translated_poem:
There's gold in the rain
on the skin of the person
who I am when I see you
 There is gold in whatever bonds
us to the earth
This is what I want -
to feel alive
 And the life in my veins
makes me spin, makes me go wild,
and all of this is golden
 Come into my arms...
 In a hotel like this
I cried so much
Over there - at the foot of the oak tree
I cried even more
 On my body, your palm
On your skin,
the aroma
I'm breathing with you
 Gold has fallen from the sky
Oh god, it's such a wonderful desire
when my angel loses his voice because of it
 There is gold in whatever bonds
us to the earth
This is what I want -
to feel alive
 And the life in my veins
makes me spin, makes me go wild
There is gold between my arms
 I am in you...
 Everything is holding us by a thread
in the blink of an eye
 Gold has fallen from the sky...
 Gold has fallen from the sky...
 Gold has fallen from the sky
Oh god, what a wonderful desire
Come my angel, hang on to me
 There is gold in whatever bonds
us to the earth
I want that
 Gold is there...
 Gold has fallen from the sky...

translated_poem:
It was already at school,
We were made competitors
We looked at each other like cats and dogs
We hated the repeaters
A pain in the ass or a pain in the ass
We always pushed each other harder
We fought for good grades
We cried in front of the blackboard
 We could have stayed sisters
It would have saved us time
Neck and neck, I imagine
It wouldn't have taken long
For us to be just as good
Despite the supervisors
And the parents.
 Then, in front of the boys,
The great offensive began.
We made up our minds
Rendezvous on the other side
And a big party lovers or Snow White
It was a race to see who could bring
All the pimply-faced kids at school
To accompany us on the quayside.
 We could have stayed sisters
That would have saved us time.
Arm in arm, I imagine
That we would have, of these beginners
Before life knocked them out,
Could have made men
Not children.
 A little later, it was beauty
That was erected as a barrier
We found ourselves insulted
If we weren't the first.
Our friendships made people smile
We had to fight each other
And all we could say to each other
Was just rubbish or rags.
 We could have stayed sisters
It would have saved us time.
Hand on shoulder, I suppose
We could have looked at each other
To see that we were all quite beautiful
And even those
Who didn't have the time.
 It's all the same in our professions
They pit us against each other
All the better to show
That we're out of our depth
As soon as you stick your head
We're always an exception
Each one on our planet,
How we've gone round and round.
 If we got together, sisters
We wouldn't have wasted our time.
Uniting our voices, I imagine
We'd say twenty times as much
And we'd make things change
And, I suppose, people too
And make things change.
Come on, we are going to dare,
It's high time.

translated_poem:
How good it feels to live
How good it feels to live
To live, to breathe
How good it feels to live
To live
To live
How good it feels to live
To live
 How good it feels to open up the eyes
In a place without past, without future
And to enjoy every second
And every single moment
 How good it feels being able to say
We're lucky to be free
And that we hold the thread of our life
In our hands
As a magician
 Even though one wants to believe that sometimes
Everything is drifting away
That we're often sailing in dangerous waters
 It never lasts long
Because the sail of hope is taut
After cold weather, we enjoy good weather even more
 How good it feels to live
How good it feels to live
Sun and rain on my skin
To live
To live
How good it feels to live
To live
 How good it feels to live
How good it feels to live
Nature and flowers on my skin
To live

How good it feels to live
To live
 Even though we argue each other
We sometimes hurt each other
It proves that we love
And that we're loved
 How good it feels to be reunited
To always start over
To look at the moonlight
Hand in hand
 How good it feels to share everything
Ugly and beautiful things
Yes, to be amazed
At life, which is the most beautiful
Gift of all
 How good it feels to live
How good it feels to live
To live, to breathe
How good it feels to live
To live
To live
How good it feels to live
To live

Ocean and salt on my skin
To live

How good it feels to live
To live

Horizon and hope on my skin
To live
To live
How good it feels to live
To live

How good it feels to live
Sun and rain on my skin
To live
To live

translated_poem:
You're my first love
You'll be my last one
We love each other as before
But it's different now
It's you and me
But it's different now
 One day, our love
Stopped growing newer, finer*
It's like a tired old song
Playing on the radio
A breath of spring
That didn't withstand time
 You're my first love
You'll be my last one
We love each other as before
But it's different now
It's you and me
But it's different now
 Of course, your heart isn't lying
When you say that you love me
But when you're near me
I often can't keep my thoughts from wandering
And I'll never be able to prevent this from happening
 You're my first love
You'll be my last one
We love each other as before
But it's different now
 The romantic gestures we make
Are our familiar ones
But they're meaningless now
I don't think I believe in it anymore
No, it's no more than
Routine for us and that's all
 Yes, you're my first love
You'll be my last one
We love each other as before
But it's different now
It's you and me
But it's different now
 Yes, you're my first love
You'll be my last one
Even if we love each other as before
It's still different now
It's you and me
But it's different now

translated_poem:
[Verse 1: Rakaa Iriscience]
Ghetto birds in my sky, fascist cars on my street
Staring at the Hollywood sign with stars at my feet
Welcome to The Angeles where very sin you want's in reach
The edge of America, Wild West to the beach
From where the palm trees also line the illest blocks
From where the righteous walk the same streets the killers walk
These Cali kids learn that warfare is camouflaged
Skateboarder's brothers bang from beach cruiser handlebars
Street politics and colors so political
Hidden in plain sight, you look, most are visible
Black and Whites, red and blue lights
I'm from where the cops throw gang signs
And claim blocks in true life
But also from where families work hard but make time for fun time
Where we spend our winters on the sand in the sunshine
My life, L.A., let me be free
Worldwide, linked with Vlad, check for CTC!
 [Chorus: Sir Samuel]
What's up, little man?
You who want to do so much
You need to know your history well
Where you come from, you must not forget
Where you go, it's up to you to decide (I repeat that)
What's up, little man?
You who want to do so much
You need to know your history well
Where you come from, you must not forget
Where you go, it's up to you to decide
 [Verse 2: Sir Samuel]
Trilingual at the bottom of my tower, in class I never had the level
I smell the fragrances of maf√© and colombo
When it blows up in Paris, often the suburbs take the blame
Then they show us on the news, we know very well that everything is fake (It's too much)
Where I come from, respect dominates
Not color or the origin of your background
Ra√Ø, couscous, and zouk mix like spices
And when a fight breaks out, in my head it's love and peace
But who are you?
 [Chorus: Sir Samuel]
What's up, little man?
You who want to do so much
You need to know your history well
Where you come from, you must not forget
Where you go, it's up to you to decide (I repeat that)
What's up, little man?
You who want to do so much
You need to know your history well
Where you come from, you must not forget
Where you go, it's up to you to decide
 [Bridge: Sir Samuel]
So, when you know where you come from, you know where you go
After that, it's you who makes your choice
Me, I come from where I am loved
Personally, I made my choice
 [Verse 3: Vlad Dobrescu]
The atmosphere in the Southeast is not very hospitable
We speak heavily and staccato like a machine gun
Feel the effect of the evening, it's like in an oven, there are no colors
Just gray blocks from the communist era and inside them
All the apartments are matchboxes
We light up quickly 'cause it's hard to stay positive between these walls
When you come with the dream to double your income
You need to know they eat alive those who can't keep up
Around here people don't have much of a "come here"
But they do have a "go fuck yourself" and they will give it to you
'Cause there's traffic like in GTA and if they have no reason to give you
A fine, the cops, don't worry, they'll invent something
But no one can beat us at parties
We only know it starts on Friday, not when it will end
It's the place where I was lucky to grow up
Peace to all Romanian land and the globe from Bucharest!

translated_poem:
I could have been a kid
A kiddo who smile
And doesn't care about getting wet
Like from the last rain
 But here, there's no water
Only a sentinel sky
That keeps weighting
On us, like hell
 Me, what i wanted was to play
But not with my life
I watch you shed
Tears we don't have here anymore
 Me, what i wanted was to dance
To make rain falls
And i watch you dig
The earth, but no water wells
 I don't want alms
I don't want to bother
But just some water
To skip stones
To skip stones
 I could have been a kiddo
Who grow up like any other
Without having to examine
A sky that forgets you
 I'm not asking for a stream
Let alone a river
I just want to throw
Bottles in the sea
 Me, what i wanted was to play
But not with my life
I watch you shed
Tears we don't have here anymore
 Me, what i wanted was to dance
To make rain falls
And i watch you dig
The earth, but no water wells

I don't want to bother
But just some water
To skip stones

I don't want to bother
But just some water
To skip stones
To skip stones

I don't want to bother

To skip stones

translated_poem:
I love watching people dance
Ah, I often go back to the bar at Louxor
To watch people dance
I love, I love, I love, I love, I love, I love
 Schoolteachers,
nursery nurses, administrators,
artists,
bakers,

police officers,
farmers
Housewives, nurses,
career advisors

I cut off the sound
Oh, and I cut it back on
I cut off the sound again
Oh, and I cut it back on
And then I cut off the sound again
And, careful, I cut it back on
 I love it
People stop dancing
They wonder who cut off the sound
They start to surround me
And then I feel in danger
So I say to them: "Take me
Do whatever you want to me

I love it, I love it, I love it, I love it, I love it I love it
And I cut off the sound

translated_poem:
A song where somebody cries for someone
 Hey please, I would like
a song where somebody cries for somebody
One that will keep me company
The one I love is gone, the one I love is gone
 Find me a lovely
yet sad melody
So sad that it'll make everyone cry
One that is, of course,
about a love that ends badly
I don't want to cry alone tonight
 Hey please, I would like
a song where somebody cries for somebody
One that will keep me company
The one I love is gone, the one I love is gone
 A tune of that same old sort
No need for melodrama1
One that says the sad words that I have in my head
with the tearful sounds of violins or the piano2
I don't want to cry alone
 So, hey please, I would like
a song where somebody cries for somebody
One that will keep me company
The one I love is gone, the one I love is gone
Please, I would like
a song where somebody cries for somebody
One that will keep me company
The one I love is gone, the one I love is gone
 Hey please, I would like
a song where somebody cries for somebody
One that will keep me company
The one I love is gone...
  1.
Literally "Melodrama it means nothing".
2.
Literally "with sobs in the violins or the piano".

translated_poem:
I'd be lying if I said I didn't mind it
Every time you come home late, I'm not okay
I'd love to change the rules, to change the course of fate
So I'll close my eyes, and you'll be mine
 I won't hold you back
I'll keep my sorrow to myself
 So it's her, so this is really happening
You're going to replace me just like that
Is she pretty? Does she look like me?
As long as she loves you like I do
Your beloved, your beloved
 Promise me I'll always have a little place in your heart
If everything breaks, I'll be there to fix it
Promise you won't forget me in your prayers
You know, honey, I'll always be right behind you
 I won't hold you back
I'll keep my sorrow to myself
 So it's her, so this is really happening
You're going to replace me just like that
Is she pretty? Does she look like me?
As long as she loves you like I do
Your beloved, your beloved
 All this time that goes by and separates us
Tell me if I'm right, tell me if it's too late,
If she's the one you want to be with,
I'll do my best to forgive you
 So it's her, so this is really happening
You're going to replace me just like that
Is she pretty? Does she look like me?
As long as she loves you like I do
Your beloved, your beloved
Your beloved, your beloved

Ah! It'll be fine, it'll be fine, it'll be fine12
Aristocrats to the lamp post !3
Ah! It'll be fine, it'll be fine, it'll be fine
Aristocrats, We'll hang them !
 [Chanting]
Ah-It'll-be-fine
Ah-It'll-be-fine
 [Hook]
Oh!
Ah! It'll be fine !
Mea Culpa !4
Ah! It'll be fine
Mea Culpa !
 [Chanting]
Ah-It'll-be-fine
 [Bridge: Marina Viotti & Joe Duplantier]
Ah! It'll be fine, rejoice
Ah! It'll be fine, good times will come
Ah! It'll be fine, mea culpa
Let's rejoice, good times will come
Without fear for fire or flame!
No!
Ah! It'll be fine !
 [Chanting]
Ah-It'll-be-fine !
Ah-It'll-be-fine
Ah-It'll-be-fine
 [Outro]
Ah! It'll be fine, it'll be fine, it'll be fine
Ah! It'll be fine, it'll be fine, it'll be fine
  1.
√áa Ira ([sa i. Åa]; French: "It'll be fine") is an emblematic song of the French Revolution, first heard in May 1790. It underwent several changes in wording, all of which used the title words as part of the refrain. The song first became popular as a worksong during the preparation for the F√™te de la F√©d√©ration of 1790 and eventually became recognized as an unofficial anthem of revolutionaries.
2.
The title and theme of the refrain were inspired by Benjamin Franklin, who was very popular among the French people following his stay as a representative of the Continental Congress from 1776 to 1785. When asked about the American Revolutionary War, he would reportedly reply, in somewhat broken French, "√áa ira, √ßa ira" ("It'll be fine, it'll all worlk out")
3.
The word, or the slogan "√Ä la lanterne!" (in English: To the Lamp Post!) gained special meaning and status in Paris and France during the early phase of the French Revolution, from the summer of 1789. Lamp posts served as an instrument to mobs to perform extemporised lynchings and executions in the streets of Paris during the revolution when the people of Paris occasionally hanged officials and aristocrats from the lamp posts. The English equivalent would be "String Them Up!" (British) or "Hang 'Em High!"(American)
4.
"It's my fault" in latin

translated_poem:
What did you see in your exile?
His wife said to Spencer,
in Rome, in Vienna,
Pergamo, Calcutta? Nothing! He would say.
If you want to discover the world,
close your eyes, Rosemonde.

translated_poem:
In the big fashion houses
There's those who work as runners
Or as saleswomen and, by nature
There's those who are models
There's those who make bodices
Others who make overcast stitches
As far as me, ladies and gentlemen, my work
Is to bias cut dresses
To properly bias cut a dress, by Jove
There isn't another one like me
 I'm a bias cutter at Paquin
I bias cut from morning to night
Evenings were my joy
I'm not for the eight-hour workday
And working nights doesn't scare me
 I'm a bias cutter at Paquin
I have a fondness for my craft
When my parents don't see me come home
They say, "No need to worry
She's still busy bias cutting"
 When I joined the business
'Twas a revolution
From the beginning, I felt
A strong calling
The first time, as customary
there were some struggles
But after I got the hang of it
I worked on it with enthusiasm
I was growing fond of my work
And I wanted to bias cut everywhere
 I'm a bias cutter at Paquin
I work outside the store
I do some extra bias cutting when it's necessary
I bias cut in cars, in autos
Once I even bias cut in the metro
 With ardor, with enthusiasm
But the doctor who came the other morning
Ordered me lots of syrup
Told me I needa take a rest
Well...
He found that I was bias cutting too much
 Imma settle down real quick
Getting married, what happiness!
With a young man full of worth
Who is a pleater worker
 To settle us comfortable
Since we don't have much money
I'll bias cut sitting on a chair first
And he'll pleat real careful
The key thing is that there's no delay
So they don't say that I'm bias cutting crooked
 I'm a bias cutter at Paquin
My man will pleat in the store
That'll be nice, by Jove
We'll do all the work at home
Helping each other as everyone should
 With ardor, with enthusiasm
We'll share the job
So's not to wear ourselves out
As soon as I finish bias cutting
It'll be his turn to pleat

translated_poem:
In London, the big city,
one is a more alone

A great stroller, a petty retiree,
Jeanne, that is
his profession.

translated_poem:
Tonight, the baby heard
His pa, very moved, say
To Ma in the starry night,
"Darling, your eyes are like stars."
And the little one, in his bed
Like a gentle lullaby
Hums while thinking of his ma
A refrain made of pretty words
 Mama's eyes are stars
That should not be made to cry
The slightest tear would cast a veil
Over the beloved clear gaze
And to preserve the sparkle of her eyes
I will always be good, I want it
Mama's eyes are stars
That have come from the heavens for me
 But the beautiful eyes
Have closed to the light now
Victim of the fierce death
Ma rests on the bed
So, the pa, trembling
Takes her where she rests
And to hide the horrible thing
He gently tells the child,
 "Mama's eyes are stars
That have left us forever
They are up there, in the sky so clear
Shining with all their love
Come on, my little boy, my dear little one
Don't be sad, calm your heavy heart
Mama's eyes are stars
That you will see in the sky up there."
 Alas! The too tender child
Pale and worn by grief
Tortured by a strange illness
Is fixing to join the angels
To his grief-stricken pa
He says, "Don't cry, little pa
May your pain be light."
Adding as he dies,
 "Mama's eyes are stars
That I'll be able to kiss
They are up there, in the sky so clear
And for them, baby was longing
Don't shed any more tears for me
Soothe your heart, calm your agitation
Mama's eyes are stars
I will kiss them for you."

 Il n'est pas costaud

translated_poem:
In Montparnasse, I engage in my vocation
As a model, one really needa make a living
Displaying one's body doesn't imply that you give it away
Until now, I belonged to no one
But as spring gets to heads, I too found myself captivated
And this time, I experienced the sweetest feelings
You say he's just a man
But I love him, and that makes all the difference
 Hes my gigolo
This pale young joe
With eyes full of fire
Does he love me? I got no idea
But he takes me so good
That I'm completely his, body and soul
 He's not muscular
But he's so handsome
That he attracts all women
And I often think,
I wish to have him all to myself
I love him too much, my gigolo
 Dreams fade away; that's why they are dreams
He left; our romance was too short-lived
I wanted to end my life, driven mad by the insult
I was ready to unleash my fury on the unfaithful one
In my despair, I rediscovered his caresses
And I thought, "I can't live without him anymore."
If only he'd return to me
I'd take him back, simply saying
 He's my gigolo
This pale young joe
With eyes full of fire
Does he love me? I got no idea
But he takes me so good
That I'm completely his, body and soul
 He's not muscular
But he's so handsome
That he attracts all women
And I often think,
I wish to have him all to myself
I love him too much, my gigolo

translated_poem:
Lost, in winter gardens,
Looking for glances
Of love or from big brothers
Bored of uncovering the mysteries
Of a happiness that goes away
And is always playing
Indifferent for too long
And I'm joining my silence
 My heart is going far away far away far away
My dream is going far away far away far away
Holding my head with my hands
My heart is going far away far away far away
My life is going far away far away far away
Don't ask me anything
I'm already somewhere else, I'm already tomorrow
You're looking for me far away far away far away
You're calling me from far away far away
But I'm already far away
 Lost, in dust nests,
Looking for the light
Our eyes need
Bored of luxury and misery, of pleasures and hells we're living daily
 Way too much indifference
And I'm joining my silence, far away
 My heart is going far away far away
My dream is going far away far away far away
Holding my head with my hands
My heart is going far away far far away
My life is going far away far away far away
Don't ask me anything
I'm already somewhere else
I'm already tomorrow
You're looking for me far away far away far away
You're calling me from far away far away far away
But I'm already far away
 (Far away far away far away)
 I'm already far away
 (Far away far away far away)
 I'm already far away
 (Far away far away far away)

translated_poem:
No, never has a love ever been as grand
Never has a love been as strong
Never a love, no, never a love
Was ever happier
And ever more wonderful as ours
 The life we live
Resembles nothing but those battles
Cats and dogs sometimes engage in
Even if at night, we find peace in each other's hands
A new storm finally breaks in the morning
 And yet, never has a love been as grand
Never has a love been as strong
Never a love, no, never a love
Was ever happier
Truly, never has a love been as grand
And every day it grows stronger
Never a love, no, never a love
Was ever happier
And was ever more wonderful as ours
 Seeing us both wanting to impose our own rules
They say that one day, it will break between you and me
Yet, everytime we decided to end it
All it took was a smile to keep us together
 No, never has a love ever been as grand
Never has a love been as strong
Never a love, no, never a love
Was ever happier
No, never has a love ever been as grand
Never has a love been as strong
Never a love, no, never a love
Was ever happier
No, never has a love ever been as grand
Never has a love been as strong
Never a love..

translated_poem:
I can see sorrow sparkling through your eyes
You've got your own problems, I've got mine
He left you and oh my God
You've got your own problems, I've got mine
One always cries just after
But one eventually forgets
 You cry because he doesn't want to be with you anymore
You've got your problems, I've got mine
Whereas me, I love you
And you've got your own problems, I've got mine
 But why after giving so much love
One isn't loved back?
It's hard, so hard to love
Without being loved
 Please, stay beside me tonight
You've got your own problems, I've got mine
You're sad and you're the only one I have
You've got your own problems, I've got mine
Wind gathers leaves
Once these ones have fallen
 And if one day, everything were to change for us
That over time you'll finally love me
What's yours will be ours
And your problems will be mine
And your problems will be mine
And your problems will be mine

translated_poem:
I saw that in your eyes tears shone
You have your troubles and I have mine
He's left you, you feel lost alone
You have your troubles and I have mine
At first it's the time for crying, but then
Forgetting does come in the end
 You're crying because he doesn't want you
You have your troubles and I have mine
And on the other hand, I love you
You have your troubles and I have mine
 So much love, and yet, why should
It never come to any good?
It's hard, so hard to fall in love without
Love in return
 Stay with me tonight, oh, please
You have your troubles and I have mine
You're sad, and there's no one for me
You have your troubles and I have mine
It's only when leaves fall they find
They're brought together by the wind
 And if, one day, things change for us
If ever love comes to your mind
What's yours will belong to both of us
And all your troubles will be mine
And all your troubles will be mine
And all your troubles will be mine

translated_poem:
I don't like girls like you
I don't like girls who can't love
You have nothing in place of the heart
You know, you're made from the stone
Or the wood, I don't know
You have nothing in place of the heart
I know that your eyes are watery
Only because of rain or wind
But never because you're sad
Yes, and on Earth, nothing exists
But you, around you
No, nothing, nothing, nothing
On Earth, people crying and laughing
Leaves you completely indifferent
You can't hear or see anything
Whether someone thinks about you
Day and night, it means nothing to you
No, nothing, nothing, nothing
And one day, if someone cries
Or suffers
To you, it's not a big deal
And to have a guy crazy in love with you
But a guy is nothing to you
No, nothing, nothing, nothing
I've known lots of girls
They made me suffer a lot
Suffer a lot, suffer a lot
I don't like girls like you
I don't like girls who can't love
You have nothing in place of the heart
You know, you're made from the stone
Or the wood, I don't know
You have nothing in place of the heart
I know that your eyes are watery
Only because of rain or wind
But never because you're sad
Yes, and on Earth, nothing exists
But you, around you
No, nothing, nothing, nothing
On Earth, people crying and laughing
Leaves you completely indifferent
You can't hear or see anything
Whether someone thinks about you
Day and night, it means nothing to you
No, nothing, nothing, nothing
And one day, if someone cries
Or suffers
To you, it's not a big deal

original_poem:

translated_poem:
It's a shitshow! 1
 All all all all appears so cynical
A sign that the click of dough2 fucks us without stopping
Why all this panic
Attempting to taint this world that appears so ludic
We manipulate ourselves based out of image
The puking3 of consumption ravages all the households
The housewife lurks, loiters. wanders,
through the shelves in search of new odours
of images of brands that make us out of sorts
More colours for less flavour
And the style, food of the culture
Eliminate values to view the future
 Say what, say what!
Bigquick
 Why then did we cast 4 Grosquick5 on the boat
To give back the gouache to the brand
A swindler, bastard, who unveils gossip
Face, makeup, the way I take you hostage
Quicky6 is like a mirage
He wreaked havoc7 in our subconscious
The patrimony of childhood
Yet, all, all, all, all appears so cynical
And so much, much much importance to design
To the profile that parades the tune is significant8
It's not halfway9 for you as it is for me
 Say what say what !
My people my people fake
Bigquick
 Nesquick
Now I critique this fucking policy
That gets involved in a system where the ideas are always the same
There is no one to think
To have the balls to innovate formulas to dupe
And there resides the basis for dismissal of Grosquick
Dismissed by a bastard, this Quicky brat
Who has done a fuckup10 on the packs of Nesquick
 My people my people fake...
 [It's up] to you to take the helm11 when the demand declares you obsolete
To the abuse, out of request
Put your mask on again12 , you redress yourself and go back
Count, count how many stars end up tramps13
Baldo14 hits the bottle of Valstar15
Even Bigquick goes through the trash16 of Quick!
  1.
"dawa" is slang for "bordel" which means shitshow
2.
"fric"= cash, dough, bread
3.
"b√®-g√©re" is verlan of "gerber" which means puking, or vomiting
4.
verlan of "jett√©"
5.
Grosquick/Groquick was the mascot for Nesquik commercials in France during the 80's https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yi7ih7alc1k
6.
Quicky is the mascot rabbit for Nesquick https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quicky
7.
"faire des ravages" = to wreak havoc
8.
"de taille" means of size, significant, big
9.
"mita mita"possibly Spanish slang for halfway/half
10.
"foutre la foire" = to do a fuckup/to fuckup
11.
"tenir la barre"= to take the helm lit. "to hold the bar"
12.
"renquiller" =slang "to put back on/again"; re+enquiller
13.
"clouchard" = homeless, tramp, vagrant
14.
Baldo is a character from an Italian comic that was popular in France https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baldo_(Italian_comics)
15.
Valstar is a brand of pale ale lager beer that was brewed and sold in France. It is referenced in many French songs, but the beer has been discontinued since 2012
16.
"faire les poubelles" = to dumpster dive/ to go through trash

translated_poem:
I have a friend, Vicky
Her real name is Suzie
People call her Sue
 I call her Vie
Vie
 One day, south
The next day, north
The far north
I love it
 One day, it's everything
The next day, it's nothing
It doesn't go well
It goes well
 I have a friend, Vicky
Her real name is Suzie
People call her Sue
I call her Vie
Vie
 I have a friend, Vicky
Her real name is Suzie
People call her Sue
But I call her Vie
It means life
 She blows fire
She blows ice
That's how it is
You have to make do with it
 Although, since yesterday
Nothing
We should have taken the train
And I only have one smoke left
And I'm nervous
I can't tell you how nervous I am

translated_poem:
I know, you wear jewelry
I have nothing, I know
But that jealous look
That suits me well, it's true
I'm not afraid of you
I have got no secrets
I know, he never has a penny,
But I love him just the way he is
I followed him everywhere
Even in the mud, it's true
I would come on my knees
If he asked me to
 Give him back to me, give him back to me
I only have him, he only has me
For you, it's just an adventure
For me, he's my heaven, my wrench
Give him back to me, give him back to me
Because one morning he will come back
To cry on my shoulder
When you have lost the role
Give him back to me...
 I know he will tell you the words
He invented for me
And will put on a brave face
Even when it's cold
But don't dream too much
One day, he'll walk away
 I know, you think you know everything
You didn't understand anything
About those foggy mornings
All those rainy skies
It's not your story
But he was my husband
 Give him back to me, give him back to me
I only have him, he only has me
For you, it's just an adventure
For me, he's my heaven, my wrench
Give him back to me, give him back to me
Because one morning he will come back
To cry on my shoulder
When you have lost the role
Give him back to me...
 Give him back to me, give him back to me
Because one morning he will come back
To cry on my shoulder
When you have lost the role
Give him back to me, give him back to me...

translated_poem:
Willpower
You must have the willpower to hang on
Tooth and nail without being afraid of getting hurt
The willpower to never lose faith, and to think "Some have made it,
Why not me,
Why not me?"
 Willpower
You must have the willpower to persevere
Despite the hope that's agonizing
As soon as it is born
Despite the impossible chance to imprison
Despite the voices advising you to quit
The willpower to push away anything that can distract you from
The path you have set for yourself
 Willpower
You must have the willpower to go straight ahead
Under the affronts and blows that you receive
The willpower over yourself to have the greatest of all powers
The will to want...

translated_poem:
"Simone, it's me
for my parents, my sisters, and my friends
I'm going to Versailles, to Versailles"
 La Seine flows today, too.
The flower-selling girl knows,
That after winter,
Blooming spring will come.
To call forth that day,
I go, undeterred by the storm,
A small flower blooming in Paris,
I am Simone.
 "Simone, it's me
for happiness, hope, and love
I'm going to Versailles, to Versailles"
 La Seine flows without ceasing.
The flower-selling girl sings,
To forget her painful fate,
And live strongly.
To call forth happiness,
I go, with throbbing blood,
Cheeks dyed with a lovely flower,
I am Simone.
 "Simone, it's me
for the celebration, friendship, and liberty
I'm going to Versailles, to Versailles"
 Floating dreams on the Seine,
The flower-selling girl waits,
For a star of hope,
To light up beyond the clouds.
To call everyone,
I go, in a maiden's heart,
A pure flower blooming for tomorrow,
I am Simone.

translated_poem:
Nothing can stop happiness
It will always prevail
It plays tricks on misfortune
It is strong like a giant
 Nothing can stop happiness
It is wild and invisible
But those who have it in their hearts
Are always seen with a smile
 I bet
You will have it soon
It will change everything, give you wings
And you will fly away
 Nothing can stop happiness
And when we see it leave
If it goes take a walk elsewhere
It's to come back to us better
 Nothing can stop happiness
No, nothing will prevent it
It reaches your heart
But you have to believe in it
 I bet
You will have it soon
It will change everything
Give you wings
And you will fly away
 Nothing can stop happiness
It will always prevail
It plays tricks on misfortune
It is strong like a giant
 Nothing can stop happiness
It is wild and invisible
But those who have it in their hearts
Are always seen with a smile
 It brings sunshine
One morning, to our tears
It chooses
A man, a woman
 Nothing can stop happiness
It will always prevail
It plays tricks on misfortune
It is strong like a giant
 La la la la...

translated_poem:
Christians, have courage!
 Jesus the Saviour is born!
The works of the evil one1
are ruined forever
When the evil one sings about
such troubling charms as if they were marvellous2
stop giving it attention:3
Jesus is born:
Glory in the Highest!
 Hear ye this news
that an angel has brought!
Hear ye, loyal souls!
And open up your hearts.
The Virgin Mary is in the stable.
Surrounded in her arms
is the Divine Child, worthy of adoration.4
Jesus is born:
Glory in the Highest!
 And now the Three Wise Men,
who are lost in the Middle East,
decipher this message
written in the sky:
They are enamoured by this new star.
Over yonder they will follow
that travelling star:
Jesus is born:
Glory in the Highest!
 Jesus makes them believe
that the star in the night
that never stops
will guide them towards Him.
In the radiant night
they're already on their way
Their souls become filled with joy5
Jesus is born:
Glory in the Highest!
 For the Child resting
in a little cradle,
they humbly leave
tributes and gifts
Like them, with delighted souls,
let us Christians follow in their footsteps6
His love invites us.
 Jesus is born:
Glory in the Highest!
  1.
Probably refers to the Devil
2.
Literally "When it [the evil one] sings marvel towards these troubling charms".
3.
Literally "don't give it your ears anymore".
4.
Or "adorable" in the religious sense, not as in cuteness.
5.
Literally reads "They go the joyous soul".
6.
As "ses" is not capitalized here, it is assumed that it is referring to the footsteps of the Three Wise Men and not Jesus.

translated_poem:
Life, life, life, life
Life, life, life, life
 And here's life
(Life, life)
The good life just itching to begin1
The world invites us
(And here's life)
to new dawns
and brings us brighter days to come
and the sun that dazzles us
The lively atmosphere charms us
and fills us with joy and liveliness

Life, life, life, life
 And here's life
(Life, life)
The good life that flows through our veins
Let's put aside our worries
(And here's life)
Let the sovereign joy
make our hearts pound
at a dazzling pace2
and make everyone wish
to have a blast and to celebrate life
 Life, life, life, life
Life, life, life, life
 And here's life
(Life, life)
The good life that's like a carnival
No time for boredom
(And here's life)
It runs, it leads us,
bringing us its colours at every moment
Rainbow with thousands of flavours
 Life, life, life, life
Life, life, life, life
 And here's life
(Life, life)
The good life that flows with serenity
Let's take up the challenge
to sing an ode to the joy of life

2.

translated_poem:
In my bedroom, where it's cold
One meter fifty by three
Five dollars a night, maybe
Five dollars a night, maybe
I have a narrow bed
And a wooden window
In my bedroom, where it's cold
The window looks out to a wall
Above, it's not the sky
Below, it's not the yard
Afar, it's not the sea
It's not the sea
Should I stay or should I leave?
Should I leave everything behind?
Should I stay or should I leave?
Should I leave everything behind?
I stare at the corners of the room
I listen to the whispers
It's the home of the losers1
The damn2 home of the heartless
The noises start at night
The noises of buried feelings
The heavy steps of drunks
The discrete ones of junkies
The weird druggies3
The failures and the zeros
The failures, the zeros
Should I leave or should I stay?
Should I leave everything behind?
On my door, a crucifix
Where is dying a Jesus Christ
In my room, I pray
Please take me far away!
And I sometimes dream at night
That I wakeup elsewhere
I open the door one morning
It's an immense garden
A women in dream comes
Visit me every night
"Don't let me down"
She tells me, without pity
Who she is, I do not know
She who will calm my screams
She who will rock me to sleep
Every time I'll fall down
Every time I'll fall down
Every time I'll fall down
Every time I'll fall down
Should I stay or should I leave?
Should I leave everything behind?
Hey (Should I leave or should I stay?), hey
Should I leave or should I stay?
Should I stay? Should I go or should I stay?
Should I go or should I stay?4
  1.
Literally, it says the country. But the meaning is more like it's the ultimate losers, the ultimate heartless. So home renders it fairly well
2.
Idem.
3.
It's a further clarification of the previous line
4.
The choice of translating the above by "Should I leave" instead of "Should I go ", given that Jean himself chose to translate it to "Should i go" might be surprising to some, but Jean has rather poor English, and his own translation is questionable

translated_poem:
Edgar was a real drunk
Writing all day
Not songs
But stories where the assassin
Would go scot-free
The victim, a good man
 One night, Edgar in a craze
Of the worst kind, taken
Despite the honors and the prizes
By alcohol, was indignified
 Running from an alley to the next
His vest, in tatters
In mud, he satisfies his hunger
In vermin, he lies
 To drink! To drink! For master Edgar
To drink! To drink! For the genius!
 Beware! The madmen in slumber
In a decrepit manor
Playing with his rigid1 hands
An awful Chopin waltz
 Of a woman, he was in love
How to convince her that blue
Isn't the color of her eyes
But rather that of the hideous demons
Viscous2
 To drink! To drink! For master Edgar
To drink! To drink! For the genius!
It's been a while since my last drink
To the last drop, my last drink
 He was found, one of these days
Where he had just received the title
Of the country's young hope
In a canal, he was grey
 Victim of delirium tremens
We brought the vagabond
Rave his immense genius
At the hospital, where he died
Where he died
 To drink! To drink! For master Edgar
To drink! To drink! For the genius!
  1.
"anguleux", speaking of the fingers, could also mean pointy instead of rigid. The lyrics are ambiguous in that regards. I'm unsure which I should have chosen.
2.
Viscous could have been translated by slimy, I guess, but viscous also works.

translated_poem:
The day was dawning, a train was waiting for her
To go toward her freedom
She didn't know, but she hoped that a better life was waiting for her
 It's unforgettable, neither the hardships,
nor the shared joys
It's unforgettable all those paths
she had taken, with her son
Everything she was hiding from him, he knew
And he, in his own way, did his best to help her:
 Sing, it's your fado,
sing, it's my gift
It's images of your life mixing with my life
It's unforgettable, and I sing
 Even a too gray sky made her sing
The sun she had left
Tthe songs of men under the olive trees
And the voices of women saying:
 Sing, it's your fado,
sing, it's my gift
It's images of your life
mixing with my life
It's unforgettable,
and I sing
 It's unforgettable, neither the hardships,
nor the shared joys
It's unforgettable all those paths
she had taken, with her son.
Everything she was hiding from him, he knew
And he, in his own way, did his best to help her
 Lai, lai, lai, lai, lai...
 It's images of your life mixing with my life
It's unforgettable, and I sing
 Sing, it's your fado,
sing, it's my gift
It's images of your life
mixing with my life
It's unforgettable,
and I sing
 Lai, lai, lai, lai, lai...
 It's images of your life
mixing with my life
It's unforgettable,
and I sing.
 Sing, it's your fado,
sing, it's my gift
It's images of your life
mixing with my life
It's unforgettable...

translated_poem:
The forbidden territories
Sprinkled with eternal snow
One must have gotten lost there one day
To know and be able to say
That hell is very close to heaven
One must have gone down there
And from the abysses to the peaks
From the heights to drunkenness
From the depths
I know my strengths
I know my fears
 Wanting to see everything and live
Is stronger than me
To love what kills me
Is stronger than me
This shadow that follows me
Is stronger than me
The love you give me
Is stronger than me
 The great infinite spaces
The essential evidence
One must have been there one day
 To know what artificial paradises do to us
One must return there
 And from the deserts to the cities
From solitude to the pleasure
Of being many
I know my strengths
I know my fears
 Wanting to see everything and live
Is stronger than me
To love what kills me
Is stronger than me
This shadow that follows me follow
It's stronger than me
The love you give me
It's stronger than me

original_poem:

translated_poem:
In former times, when I was fighting
On the roads to glory
 From the heights of the castle
Where I contemplated our vast fief
I remember the winter sun
Pale, and licking the cold stone
 At the break of dawn
Embracing the belfry with a striking glow
When the sun was overtaken by the darkness
Throwing the world into an ash-black
 A thousand torches in the obscurity
And the swords were purified
By the breath of winter
 And the hopes of men were consumed
By the incandescence of war
 As the arrows lodged themselves in the shields *
And the drawbridge fell in a deafening crash
 A thousand torches in the obscurity
And the swords were purified
 The bugle rang the attack, and the crash of steel
Broke the winter stillness
 Until the last breath
My blade sliced flesh
Until the last breath
The Earth shook before me
  *.
"Pavois" is a type of medieval shield

translated_poem:
When a steamer passes
When a train whistles
When a plane takes-off to the skies
I imagine all those departures
All that people who have to leave
Who separate
Who tear apart
 When a steamer passes
When a train whistles
When a plane takes-off to the skies
I see again that sad morning
When leaving you said
Next summer I'll be back
 And since that day under a scorching sun
Miserably I wait for you
Already three summers have returned
I'h here, as i've promised you
But where are you?
But where are you?
But where are you?
 When a steamer passes
When a train whistles
When a plane takes-off to the skies
Bitterly I tell myself
That if they didn't exist
Maybe then
You'd be here
 When a steamer passes
When a train whistles
When a plane takes-off to the skies
I'm hoping again
I'm still hoping
 That steamers, trains and planes
That took you away
Will bring you back
 When a steamer passes
When a train whistles
When a plane takes-off to the skies...

Et que tout est perdu

(Oh oui que quelqu'un me dise) Et dis-moi que je r√™ve
Rassure-moi, et redis moi :
Que tu m'aimes (que tu m‚Äôaimes)

Si tu m'abandonnes, ma vie est morte
Tu sais que je n'ai pas d'autres amies que toi

 Pourquoi faut-il √† chaque fois s'accrocher
√Ä ce qui n'est plus rien d√©j√†
Oh, car fou je suis de ne pas r√©aliser
Que tu ne veux plus de moi

translated_poem:
I'm not sleeping, I can hear
The next-door neighbours talking
They say it's not going well anymore
Between us and that you want to leave me
 Oh yeah, wake me up
And tell me it's a dream (it's a dream)
Please tell me that
You love me again (you love me again)
 They say things aren't the way they used to be between us
And that everyone knows it, except me
I hide under the pillow to not hear anything
But words are clear
 Through these very thin walls, I can hear the neighbours
Saying ''She doesn't like him anymore'' (doesn't like him anymore)
They say that your heart belongs to another man
And that I've lost everything
 Oh yeah, wake me up
And tell me it's a dream (it's a dream)
Please tell me that
You love me again (you love me again)
 Before you, I had never experienced anything
If you leave me, I'm dead
You know that I don't have other friends than you
Where to go, far from your door?
 Why does one have to cling to
What is gone already?
Oh, because how crazy I am to not realise
That you don't want me anymore
I really try not to cry
And I don't want to believe that I've been replaced
And if it has never been a dream before
Tell me I'm dreaming now
 Oh yeah, wake me up
And tell me it's a dream (it's a dream)
Please tell me that
You love me again (you love me again)
 Oh yeah, wake me up
(You have to tell me) And tell me
I'm dreaming

translated_poem:
When a boat passes
When a train blows
When a plane flies through the sky
I imagine the departures
All the people who need to leave
Who go their separate ways
Who tear each other apart
 When a boat passes
When a train blows
When a plane flies through the sky
I remember feeling bad this morning
When leaving, you said
''I'll come back next summer''
 And since this day, I've been waiting
Miserably under the burning sun
There have been 3 summers since*
I have kept my word, I'm here
But where are you?
But where are you?
But where are you?
 When a boat passes
When a train blows
When a plane flies through the sky
I say resentfully:
''If they didn't exist, maybe
You would
be here''
 When a boat passes
When a train blows
When a plane flies through the sky
I'm still hoping
I keep hoping
 That boats, trains and planes
Which took you
Will take you back
 When a boat passes
When a train blows
When a plane flies through the sky

translated_poem:
She leaned, her forehead against the jukebox
At the bottom of this coffee shop at the train station
I was coming from the street, from the rain and the fog
I was taking a hot drink on the at the counter
She put a 1 franc coin in the jukebox
And even with all that noise, I recognised myself
I was waiting for her to smile, but just a few steps away
Listening to the song, she was sobbing quietly
 Why crying?
Listening to a summer hit
Months go by and we forget
Sorrow is gone
Why crying?
Listening to a summer hit
You'll find someone who'll love you
 She was leaning, her forehead against the jukebox
I was lowering my head to avoid eye contact with her
I was waiting for the song to end at the counter
Playing with my spoon in my black coffee
But she was already inserting a coin into the jukebox
And I was feeling guilty and desperate
If only I had known that a girl could cry
This song, yeah, I would never have sung it
 Why crying?
Listening to a summer hit
Months go by and we forget
Sorrow is gone
Why crying?
Listening to a summer hit
You'll find someone who'll love you
 Why crying?
Listening to a summer hit
Months go by and we forget
Yes, someone who'll love you

translated_poem:
Who still dreams of America?
That undemocratic shopping mall
Everything is so different nowadays
 Can anyone even keep dreaming
When everything around us is terrifying
Everything is so different nowadays
While waiting very patiently
For the end of the world
 What freedom when we are doomed
After all those years of guilt
Let's finally act without fear of repercussions
Goodbye boss, we'll see each other on vacations
Everything is so different nowadays
While waiting very patiently
For the end of the world
 Everything is so different nowadays
While waiting very patiently
For the end of the world
For the end of us
 We are the new dinosaurs
We'll end up in a museum, with a decor
And on the sign, in large print
"Man having a drink outside
Patiently waiting for the end of his time"

I think of you

You know we've left each other
But nothing erases you
I kiss you a bit on the side
I love you instead

But I would like to tell you I love you

A bit more often

A bit more often
A bit more often

translated_poem:
Black creatures are born and grow
in celestial dungeons
 Inquisitor, acclaimed in glory
By gold and by jewels of ash
Flamboyant nightmare
Tyrant of the immaculate tower
 Usurper of all thrones
Desecrator of all dreams
 The brilliance that once inhabited the genius of Man
Has just wilted on the ramparts
Of heaven's citadel
 Inquisitor, acclaimed in glory
By gold and by jewels of ash
Flamboyant nightmare, like a dream
Tyrant of the immaculate tower
 The yoke of the tyrant will be broken
By the black crowd
Of surging blasphemers
Defenders against the false light
 A day will come where the ashes of what's sacred
will fertilize the mortified Earth
The mutilated angels will hurl themselves
From the peak of white towers
And perhaps we then will see
the splendor of the early days reappear
Advancing over hills and valleys
like a rain of salvation
 Your reign falls into age-old trenches
Where the brightness of day rots and the flame of the sun drowns
 I dream of a sky that will no longer bear your sign
Where the stars will be free to send the light of what they are
 Inquisitor, acclaimed in glory
By gold and by jewels of ash
Flamboyant nightmare, like a dream
Tyrant of the immaculate tower
 The time has come let our nobility shine
To dethrone you...
 Inquisitor, acclaimed in glory
By gold and by jewels of ash
Flamboyant nightmare, like a dream
Tyrant of the immaculate tower

translated_poem:
It was out in the country
Between my life and the sea
We forgot about Paris
My job and his business
 There are vacation days
When it rains like in winter
It didn't matter
Underneath a sweater

The house of that summer
Tell me if they are happy
Like we both were

Those sun-drenched lunches
At the bottom of a travel bag
My photos are already old

Did the marketing for us
We walked back from the beach
Barefoot and a little wild
 We didn‚Äôt receive letters
We didn't send any
Maybe we forgot
To close the shutters
 Tell me who rented
The house of that summer
Tell me if they are happy
Like we both were
 Give me back that scenery
Those sun-drenched lunches
At the bottom of a travel bag
My photos are already old
 Tell me who rented
The house of that summer
Oh, tell me if they are happy
Like we both were

translated_poem:
In the eyes of the man who loves us
We could see the sun right through to his heart
The moment love protects us
We're never scared again
No matter what happens
 In the eyes of the man who loves us
We have so many smiles to discover
In the eyes of the man who loves us
We never stop seeing love grow
 Better than a wood fire warms us
It can snow a thousand years
When we love, we're always close to spring
And we've finished being poor
And one day, we've understood everything
and we play in the Things of Life...
 In the eyes of the man who loves us
We could see the sun right through to his heart
The moment love protects us
We're never scared again
No matter what happens
 In the eyes of the man who loves us
We have so many smiles to discover
In the eyes of the man who loves us
We never stop seeing love grow
 The moment that you're happy
We can guess a little about your childhood
We see stars dancing in your eyes
The tenderness in you is immense
And comes adding itself to love
When we love, we get engaged again every day
 In the eyes of the man who loves us
We could see the sun right through to his heart
The moment love protects us
We're never scared again
No matter what happens
 In the eyes of the man who loves us
We have so many smiles to discover
In the eyes of the man who loves us
We never stop seeing love grow...
 Lai Lai Lai Lai Lai Lai...
Lai Lai Lai Lai Lai Lai...
 In the eyes of the man who loves us
We have so many smiles to discover
In the eyes of the man who loves us...

translated_poem:
Straightforward and decisive
Smiling, with a straight face
These are the knights of the sky
Proud and courteous in tournaments
Like the knights of old
These are the knights of the sky
From Singapore to Alaska
And from Paris to Panama
These are the knights of the sky
Wearing the badge of golden wings
On chest and arm
These are the knights of the sky
 From chief petty officer to commander
If they are so proud of their ribbons
It's because they've won them over
Winning hearts at the same time.
 Their look is frank and decisive
With a smile on their face and a straight face
These are the knights of the sky.
When a boy sees them
He likes to say out loud
‚ÄòHere come the knights of the sky.
But sometimes when it's a girl
Then, whispering softly:
‚ÄòHere come the knights of the sky.‚Äô.
She blushes, lowering her eyes
Feeling that her heart is beating
Here come the knights of heaven.
 Before we hear them coming like madmen
Their speed is so great that they're already upon us
When they pass, we want to run up and embrace them.
On earth or in space, they've already gone by
Greeting you, even on occasion
With a cannon shot against the sound barrier.
 (Looking frank and decisive)
(Smiling and looking straight ahead)
Here come the knights of heaven
(Proud and courteous in tournaments)
(As were those of old)
Here are the knights of the sky
(From Singapore to Alaska)
(And from Paname to Panama)
Here are the knights of the sky
(Wearing the badge of golden wings)
(On chest and arm)
Here come the knights of the sky
 From chief petty officer to commander
If they are so proud of their ribbons
It's because they've won them over
Winning hearts at the same time.
 Their look is frank and decisive
With a smile on their face and a straight face
These are the knights of the sky.
When a boy sees them
He likes to say out loud
‚ÄòHere come the knights of the sky.
But sometimes when it's a girl
Then, whispering softly:
‚ÄòHere come the knights of the sky‚Äô.
She blushes, lowering her eyes
Feeling that her heart is beating
Here come the knights of heaven.
Knights of heaven

To endure the pain and hold your tears
For things we no longer want
For a happiness whose price we know
We don't always know our life
 Even for love
Even by chance
No one is safe from its star (destination)
 For this journey, we don't know
How many days have we not finished
Coming back in the middle of the night
For a life we don't choose
 Even for love
Even by chance
No one is safe from its star (destination)
 Crying for someone we look for and those who run away from us
Fighting like crazy for subsistence
Ask yourself, why and by whom?
To live a life we would have chosen
 Even for love
Even by chance
No one is safe from its star (destination)

translated_poem:
Never had a crush on a parking meter
Unlike those colleagues who've never left parking attendance
 Sherlock Holmes in a skirt Like Thomson and Thompson,
I solve problems
In front o' dumbfounded inspectors
 Meter Maid Marie is the charm and the law
Want some mystery assignment? ... Here you go!
It was tough, and suddenly it's a cinch
Miss Detective passed by!
 Meter Maid Marie is like Attila
Where she passes, anguish never grows again
You mustn't falter, you mustn't freak out... Must not!
Meter Maid Marie passed by!
 Parking meter... Horror
 Catching cars dead to rights is not my thrill or my kick
My true nature is between the Pink Panther and James Bond
 I've never fallen for having a meter as an associate
I knew early on that parking attendance don't bring happiness
 Meter Maid Marie is the charm, and the law
Want some mystery assignment? ... Here you go!
It was tough, and suddenly, it's a cinch
Miss Detective passed by!
 Meter Maid Marie is like Attila
Where she passes, anguish never grows again
You mustn't falter, you mustn't freak out... Must not!
Meter Maid Marie's gonna pass by!
 Parking meter... Horror Parking meter... Horror Parking meter... Horror
 Meter Maid Marie is the charm and the law
Want some mystery assignment? ... Here you go!
It was tough, and suddenly, it's a cinch
Miss Detective passed by!
 Meter Maid Marie is like Attila
Where she passes, anxiety never grows again
You mustn't falter, you mustn't freak out... Must not!
Meter Maid Marie's gonna pass by!
