translated_poem:
The gypsy said to the girl:
 "No matter the price of love
For you, I will finish my days
Behind bars
I will pillage the people in town
To gift you a dress of satin
You will no longer say that I am a vagabond,
Worthless...
My hands, now so rough,
Will be as soft as the wood
Of the guitar that plays for you
Before your door..."
 The gypsy said to the girl:
 "No matter the price of love
For you, I will finish my days
Behind bars
I will kill those who dare to look at you
When the soft sunlight of the morning
Glides over the valley of your hips
And lingers there...
And then, I will say: "I love you"
Like we say the name of Jesus
I will shout it in the streets
Like a blasphemy..."
 The gypsy said to the girl:
 "No matter the price of love
For you, I will finish my days
Behind bars
Around you, I will create a shadow
To be the only one to see you
To be alone under your gaze
And let it disarm me...
And when death comes to break
The chains forged by love
For you, I will finish my days
Under the earth..."

translated_poem:
Far from me, you're bored
And sometimes you're afraid
That absence and time
Will erase all our joys.
If at night you think
That I'm going to forget you
Don't worry, I don't want
Anyone but you.
 Yes, it's true, the boys
Who hang around me
Do try sometimes
To keep me away from you.
But you see, it's no use
For my heart belongs to you.
Don't worry, I don't want
Anyone but you.
 What they have to offer
Doesn't interest me.
I prefer, yes later,
To discover everything with you.
 If today we are
Both separated
It's only you, only you that I'm waiting for
To be by my side
To be happy at last
And to live with me.
Don't worry, I don't want
Anyone but you
 To have happiness at last
And to live with me.
Don't worry, I don't want
Anyone but you
Anybody but you
Anyone but you.

translated_poem:
On my island, where I was born
In December every year
That festive time, all eyes are on you
Papa Calypso
You‚Äôre the guy with gentle eyes
You exist here with us too
Father Christmas we call you
Papa Calypso
 For the young and for the old
For the rich and the beggars too
You‚Äôve always got just the thing
Papa Calypso
All together now
 Waiting for you on the road
We recognize you from afar
Cloak and tunic, beard of white
Papa Calypso
But when the festivities reach their end
You say goodbye until next year
You leave us far, far too soon
Papa Calypso
 For the big and for the small
For the black and for the white
You‚Äôve always got just the thing
Papa Calypso
All together now
 In our church made of bamboo
We pray down on our knees
That the Virgin Mary will protect you
Papa Calypso
But, old one-off that you are,
You come back for the Carnival
The middle of Lent brings us back
Papa Calypso
 For the girls and for the boys
For the jesters and the kings
You‚Äôve always got just the thing
Papa Calypso
All together now
 What is it you‚Äôve asked for from Papa Calypso
An electric train
A football
A racing bike
A CD player
A little sister
A skateboard
A snowman
A big dog
 For the young and for the old
For the rich and the beggars too
For the big and for the small
For the black and for the white
For the girls and for the boys
For the jesters and the kings
For the ugly and the pretty
For the skinny and the fat
You‚Äôve always got just the thing
Papa Calypso

translated_poem:
Of course, there is good in people
I'm telling you, you have to look for a long time
I promise, life can sometimes be fun
You will see, many times
You will not understand a thing
Even from your sweetest friends
I promise, you will be fine if you lie
 My eyes are bigger than my heart
I can't get scared
My eyes aren't pretending
 If she often calls you an idiot
She may be right
You don't seem very nice
 But of course, there is good in people
But I'm telling you, you have to look for a long time
I promise, life can sometimes be fun
My eyes are bigger than my heart
I can't get scared
My eyes aren't pretending
 I'm telling you, people are liars
Like the ones telling about your sister and me
Like you, they are scared
 That we don't care about others, that's not true
We say that to hide
I promise, we have to hide well
 Gods, fables and colors
Flags tearing hearts apart
At our borders, we cry
 But of course, there is good in people
But I'm telling you, you have to look for a long time
Life can sometimes be fun
My eyes are bigger than my heart
I can't get scared
My eyes aren't pretending
 Stranded, alone in your world
Crushed by tears and shame
Take my hand, climb back up
 So what, she's blond and she's pretty
Her eyes are blue like the sky
You live well without her
 I'm telling you, there is everything we need in our veins
Love, joy, the devil and hate
You're better off without her
 And of course, there is good in people
But I'm telling you, you have to look for a long time
Life can sometimes be fun
My eyes are bigger than my heart
I can't get scared
My eyes aren't pretending
 My eyes are bigger than my heart
I can't get scared
My eyes aren't pretending

And the days pass and move slowly
But the years run through our hands and then escape away
Fast, prey to events

The winters pass, the springs pass
Nothing will ever be able to break this oath
I will weave necklaces of affection for you

We will return to this beach
We will again walk on the sand

Under the same sun
in the middle of the same sky
Together
Together
We will return
One day we will return
 We will return to this beach
Hear the waves once again
Confide in our lovestruck hearts
the romantic song from the sea
Together
Together
Under the same sun
in the middle of the same sky
Together
Together
We will return
One day we will return
Together...

translated_poem:
On Saturdays
Without bothering with makeup or getting dressed up fancy
We rush off with our strong, burly companions to a musette dance
Where we meet up just between dudes and genuine dames of the night
Two by two, we spin around and around, humming along to the sound of the accordion
 What licks fox-trot,
And even the shimmy,
The English steps
The Scottish, and everything else that follows?
It's the java, the old mazurka dance
From Old Sebasto
I'm your broad
I'm your gal,
He's my pimp.
 Hug me close
Hold on tight,
I'll follow you and do everything you want.
When you take me in your arms
I feel in my heart like I'm in freefall,
I like your cap,
Your two sideburns
And your bit of smoke
 But on Saint Germain Boulevard,
High society folks
have no principles.
As soon as lowlifes do something good,
they have to steal it from them.
Nowadays, the upper class
tries in vain to copy our guys
And the high-cƒ∫ass bawds in the parlors
sing to their wealthy johns, strutting around...
 What licks fox-trot,
And even the shimmy,
The English steps
The Scottish, and everything else that follows?
It's the java, the old mazurka dance
From Old Sebasto
I'm your broad
I'm your gal,
He's my pimp.
 Hug me close
Hold on tight,
I'll follow you and do everything you want.
When you take me in your arms
I feel in my heart like I'm in freefall,
I like your cap,
Your two sideburns
And your bit of smoke.

original_poem:
L'√©ternelle envie d'encore, incertaine et sans remord

L'√©go√Øsme √† fait de moi son esclave, son roi

Dans le feu de nos gestes au pass√©

Il m'oppresse, me d√©vore et me tient

Contre mon stress je lutterai en vain
translated_poem:
The eternal need of more, uncertain and without remorse
Who hits me and who twists me, is an obscene weapon
But I always have trouble staying in place
The attention is lacking and my tensions freeze you
 In the flow of our words that tinges us
In the ring of our soul that puts us out
 And the evil braids itself
It stands up, it adores me, retains me
And my mistakes hurt me
Against my stress, I will fight in vain
 With time it worsens itself, in my psyche it emerges itself
Egoism made of me its slave, its king
But I always have had a hard time letting go
To take the time to observe you
 In the little that remains to us to dream
In the fire of our gestures to the past
 And the evil braids itself
It oppresses me, devours me, and holds me
And my mistakes do not cease
Against my stress, I will fight in vain

translated_poem:
A ticket here and there in the wind

But I can also play James Bond or Maigret

original_poem:
Voil√† l'hiver bien √©tabli.

 Et moi la Belle au Bois Dormant,

Et les voyages, et les naufrages,
 En me montrant le soleil dehors !
Je me r√©veille en criant tr√®s fort :

 Voil√†, tu te penches sur moi

translated_poem:
I find 1winter well-established.
I find, my heart is all frozen.
Spring's gone away:
four snow horses,
with muffled footsteps, make a merry-go-round. 2
 I find that in the middle of my dream,
I find that an image rises:
it's you in a white costume
bringing back spring
on the beautiful days 3
Of our love, 4
showing me the sun outside!
I wake up yelling really loud:
Winter is dead! Winter is dead!
 And I Sleeping Beauty,
and I who's waiting for spring,
my life will start again with the summer's sky
And the trips, and the shipwrecks,
 Showing me the sun outside!
I wake up yelling really loud:
Winter is dead! Winter is dead!
 I find, you lean over me
and then you kiss me and smile.
Caress my hair,
It's raining blue minutes. 5
I go back to sleep.
Winter is dead. Winter is dead.
  1.
The "find" in "I find" is literal, so it does not signify an opinion. This was the best way I could translate "voil√†" without rephrasing.
2.
I'll be honest, it's hard to translate this. I understand it as parading, though "man√®ge" is merry-go-round, as well as a horse-training exercise and a horse-training place. I don't want to remove the wordplay, and I think that merry-go-round can be interpreted as the same things as the original.
3.
"les beau jours," literally "the beautiful days", often means "the good days".
4.
I think this is the same sentence as the previous line and shouldn't be capitalized, but I still follow the original transcript's formatting.
5.
I think it's the same sentence as the previous line, too.

translated_poem:
The idea...
Let's strip the flesh off our puppets,
our dolls, and other toys
In the time of a quick breath
that satisfies us
Wound!
Those grandiose, ferocious monkeys
dance in a circle
I've drunk the mothers' milk
in big gulps
I've seen the bitter bells
melt; macabre, they monopolize
our era, like a sincere man
I am a perfect, molded, domesticated being
I can't walk, nor can I remember who you are
I won't talk to any of you anymore; words suddenly eviscerate me
The smell slits my throat, and silence belongs to me
It slits my throat in silence
The void oozes, jasmine, even into our vaginas
I've dreamt so little, thought so little
My head turned towards the sky
I was surprised to find my eyes tearing up, getting salty
The betrayed ones shall be well-kept
Now we are slaves!
Human cyst offers to uterine world
necrotic ashes
Preparing each corpse's mouth
Every stump into slaves
Guests of moments,
devoured by jealous elegies,
seized by plaintive heresies
The being of a moment thinks of its reckless life
Amniotic fields hasten the frenetic urge
to have a brush with selfishness, to feel it
Philistines, our laughter turns into echoes
Our steps are heavy and faint
Imagine your skin: the sun appears much crueler
We close our eyes

Freedom and justice for everyone
And today it is the day
Also to divide everything equally
Between each of the inhabitants
The fields and the grounds
 United by the heart
Let us depart to the four ways
The path to our destiny
Hand in hand, shoulder to shoulder
We swear on our honor and say:
One for all, all for one!
 Freedom! Justice! Trust!
(One for all, all for one!)
Freedom! Peace! Honor!
(One for all, all for one!)
Goodness! Strength! Unity!
(One for all, all for one!)
 I !

translated_poem:
We had just broken up
Lovers as much as we were friends
And you gave me a call
to tell me it's over
You don't know how to say why
you don't love me anymore
And I'm alone in front of you
feeling lost
 Our last song together
that we're singing right now
Our last song together
It's our way of telling each other "Farewell"
 You've buried the past
Our love doesn't count anymore
All the pictures have been torn up
You've thrown my heart out onto the streets
You're going down another road
and I shout your name
I wish that you'd listen to me
but your heart says "No"
 Our last song together
that we're singing right now
Our last song together
It's our way of telling each other "Farewell"
 Our last song together
that we're singing right now
Our last song together
It's our way of telling each other "Farewell"

that we're singing right now

It's our way of telling each other "Farewell"

translated_poem:
How many more ambushes and traps along the way?
Don't wanna be a super hero, only a super human
I move on with no fear of tomorrow
Hope in my heart and future in my hands
 I took out the flag, white and pure like the dove
All of us together we could unite and change the world
Just one day of peace so we can stop the bombs
Just one rainy day to hide my falling tears
 I know every lane in Paris even with the eyes closed
I wanna become the Prince of the cities like Michel Berger1
Focused on the blind spots, I'm doing such a good job
I stroll a low rider, I'm just like Snoop Dogg
 I fall down and get up again, I saw the thunder fall onto my dreams
I am neither the good nor the bad student, getting better to join Eden
The failures that made me grow up, the sceptics I proved wrong
The ambitions, the hopes, I'm gonna tell you my story
 Gonna tell you my story
The ambitions, the hopes, ever standing, you gotta keep the faith2
Oh, City of Lights, can you feel the warmth in our heart?
Through my scars you can guess my route
 A child from the street, from the universe
We repaint the neighbourhood3, hiding the misery
I have a walk around my area4, doing a patrol
My building5 is among the seven wonders of the world
 How many more ambushes and traps along the way?
Don't wanna be a super hero, only a super human
I move on with no fear of tomorrow
Hope in my heart and future in my hands
 You can become the Prince of the city
Becoming the King and then the Emperor
Life is hard6 and I pay my mistakes
Life is hard, so I armoured my heart
 How many more ambushes and traps along the way?
Don't wanna be a super hero, only a super human
I move on with no fear of tomorrow
Whenever...you...want
  1.
a reference to his song "Prince des villes"
2.
literally "believe in it"
3.
lit. "popular neighbourhood", which is similar to working-class districts; nowadays, it is most often associated with those in the suburbs, where a lot of direct or indirect immigrants live
4.
"zone" typically refers to one in a 'neighbourhood'
5.
"one's building", in French, even more so in rap, typically refers to a block of flats, especially in a suburbian area
6.
subject and verb inverted in the song

 Adieu l‚Äôenfance

 Ton existence

 Adieu l‚Äôenfance

translated_poem:
You used to call me Papou
Above all you called me
Hanging around my neck.
When life scared you
I was there to build you
The most beautiful future.
Did I ever reach it?
 Those were the blessed days
Of playgrounds
And the streets of Paris
That you discovered
In our starry eyes.
Life burned like it does today
But without the nostalgia.
 Farewell to childhood
And the innocence
Of those distant years
Of that lovely time gone
Where is the carefree spirit
Of your ten years
That will never return.
 It's always cruel
The time that flies
Nothing is less eternal
Than the dawn of life.
But in your little woman's heart
your memories are a flame
Like a lighthouse in the night.
 Farewell to childhood
And innocence
Of those distant years,
Of those lovely times gone by,
The carefree days
Of your ten years
That will never return.
 Your existence
Clearly
Has embellished mine
And given meaning to my life
But, unlucky for you
Your beautiful childhood
Is gone forever.
 Farewell to childhood
And innocence
Of those distant years,
Of that lovely time gone,
The carefree days
Of your ten years
That will never return.

translated_poem:
They tell me that America is freedom
If you want the good life, it's the ideal country
You're all forgetting about the 14th of July1
Heads up - I am French
 If you want to sleep on a pile of money2
all you have to do is follow the signs for the roundabout
Furthermore, be very disciplined
And heads up, I am French
 It's the most fantastic country without a doubt
They can rope horses like we hook fish3
For an American, it's all routine
OK, but I am French
 They tell me that America is freedom
There are clubs for gentlemen and others for ladies
For White, Black, and Japanese people
Heads up, I am French
 They tell me that love isn't complicated
All you need is a quarter of an hour, and voila - you're married
It takes even less time to get divorced
But heads up, I am French
 It's the most fantastic country without a doubt
And dancing to the violin in the middle of Wyoming
is all routine for an American
OK, but I am French
 They tell me that America is freedom
But walking all alone on Broadway at night isn't worth it
Harlem also isn't recommended
Heads up, I am French
 And here's some good champagne from California
and some wine fit for the most refined palate
Some mint sauce to go with your chicken
But heads up, I am French
 It's the most fantastic country without a doubt
People will kill you to buy a gram of morphine4
For an American, it's all routine
OK, but I am French
 They tell me that America is freedom
If you want the good life, it's the ideal country
You're all forgetting about the 14th of July1
Hey, heads up, I am French
 It's the country of folklore and good music
Sing some English and you'll see that you're swingin' it
True, but I'd rather sing for my lady neighbour
and sing for every Frenchman
  1.
a. b. Bastille Day - France's national holiday - is celebrated on July 14 ever year
2.
Literally "mattress of dollars"
3.
Literally "We catch horses like we fish with lines".
4.
Literally "We'll kill you to get get a gram of morphine"

I thought to have found in her my asylum, my remedy
She saw in me only a simple student formed to her model1
I keep today serious sequelae2of it, I bit the dust
She has little by little burned my wings, I am no longer the same

At her request I had to change skin, I have played a role
 But I like so much the last of her lips that I have accepted the rules
She had slowly emptied me of my vital essence3 , I have suffered a long time
 At her request I lost my ego, I had to learn to be someone else
At her request I had to change skin, I have played a role

translated_poem:
There is a small nest where I love to cuddle up
A small, cozy nest where I love to fall asleep
A charming little nest nestled in the hollow of your shoulder
Where I dream, intoxicated by the hair that brushes against me
To the treasures that only you gently give me
It is my reason for being and my strength to live
Only it can ease my sorrows here on earth
The sweet little nest where I love to cuddle up
 There is a small nest where I love to cuddle up
Wishing that the nights could never end
And when the sun comes knocking at the window
I cuss it softly for daring to show
Because with the pale dawn, things will come back
The worries that the night could still hide
How long the day would be without the sweet memory
Of the sweet little nest where I love to cuddle up
 There is a small nest where I love to cuddle up
But, under the weight of the years, weary, I feel myself getting along
Let me still, at the decline of my life
Gently rest my sore head
Feeling the divine caress of your two arms
My gloomy distress will disappear in an instant
From then on, I will not see my hair turn white
Hiding in the sweet nest where I love to cuddle up
 There is a small nest where I love to cuddle up
But I feel that Death is watching me and will come
Ah! Do not go away, stay by my side
I would so much like, in this last hour
Of the separation, the ultimate retreat
To still rest my head in the hollow of your shoulder
So I can finally fall asleep forever
In the sweet little nest where I would like to die.

translated_poem:
Before going to sleep
I think back to my faulty actions
To the nonsense we said when drunk
To our old friendships that were ruined because we were
Too proud to talk to each other
 Before going to sleep
I wonder if I should take a leak
I wonder if I should change jobs
If I should run away on an island, who would miss me?
Tomorrow, I'll get the tickets
 Before going to sleep
I ask myself "should we break up?"
They're behind us, our best years
The most passionate ones, we'll never get them back
The feelings of the past
 Before going to sleep
I think back to the girls who left me
Seeing them undress
My ego is quite happy because I notice
I forgot about some of them
 Before going to sleep
I think back to an old fight
To everything I could have said if I hadn't stuttered
To everything I could have done to her
If I were a bit more muscular
 Before going to sleep
I think about the junk I bought
That I didn't need at all
With all this wasted money, I could have lived
At least a year without working
 Before going to sleep
I think back to the people I hurt
I wonder if they forgave me and I can only regret
Before going to sleep
My mind is full of worries
 Before going to sleep
I think back to the blunt I smoked
Ten years ago, it left me with weird after-effects in my mind
That will never heal
 Before going to sleep
I try to imagine what the love of my life will look like
Before realizing that, like an idiot,
I let you go
 Before going to sleep
I'm filled with the bitter taste of the past
Coming back to burn my gums, keeping me awake late at night
 I just want to rest

translated_poem:
A choice before the gods
Love or eternity
To surrender their hearts
Broken so thoroughly
Or to live for eternity
In the vast deep
With loneliness the only company
They behold how mortal love entwines
 But that's the price to pay
O'love
Stars will always shine
But with pain
Though separated
Hearts cling on
That's the price to pay
Yet lovers endure forevermore
 Love is the privilege of mortals
A gift the gods covet in vain
For they are bound by wisdom and reason
While mortals own but madness and passion
 But that's the price to pay
O'love
Stars will always shine
But with pain
Each separation
Yearns for another encounter
That's the price to pay
Yet lovers endure forevermore

translated_poem:
I had dreamed of finding a man
A stylish and distinguished boy
But I'm fallen for the pan of
A truly twisted and poorly balanced one
He's no Apollo, my man
He's not built like a Hercules
And even though he's full of flaws
It's him that I got under my skin
 Like he is, I like him, he's got an effect on me
And I love him
He's a real weakling, as tall as a basset hound
But I love him
He's unsteady as far as intellect
But I don't care
If he looks abnormal
In the bargain, he's mute
His eyes are crooked
It's a fact, like he is
I like him!
 He's V shaped, but his shoulders
Are stuffed with cardboard
When he's naked, it looks funny
You can only see half of him
He doesn't have a single hair on his head
But he has plenty on his legs
And he's so lazy that the one that's grown in his palm
Is not hair, but horsehair
 Like he is, I like him, he's got an effect on me
And I love him
He's a real weakling, as tall as a basset hound
But I love him
He's unsteady as far as intellect
But I don't care
If he looks abnormal
In the bargain, he's mute
His eyes are crooked
It's a fact, like he is
I like him!
 (And I love him)
(And I love him)
 But I don't care, like he is, I like him

translated_poem:
Ryo Saeba, Ryo Saeba
 A shadow slips by in the night
It's a murderer on the loose
and like a demon, he smiles
His crime remains unpunished
 A car suddenly appears
The brakes are slammed and tires screech
A gunshot rings out1
Justice has a name - it's Ryo2
 In the heat of the night
evil is always punished
 No danger astounds him
He's fond of tough challenges
and justice is his passion
Ryo Saeba fears nobody
 Once gunshots ring out
He swirls like a lightning bolt
especially if the girl is cute
Ryo Saeba fears nobody
 Ryo Saeba, Ryo Saeba
 Like a hunter, he follows his prey
so that justice and the law
prevail, and he is ready to give
his whole life without hesitation
 When his silhouette appears
the bad guys begin to tremble
They know they'll never be able to
escape this upholder of the law
 In the heat of the night
evil is always punished...
 No danger astounds him
He's fond of tough challenges
and justice is his passion
Ryo Saeba fears nobody
 Once gunshots ring out
He swirls like a lightning bolt
especially if the girl is cute
Ryo Saeba fears nobody
  1.
Literally "A car that suddenly appears / A break, squealing tires / A gunshot that rings out"
2.
Literally "Justice is called Nicky".

Under the black bridge on the Saint-Cloud road
She stands there, morning and night
The old floozy with withered eyes
There's too much light in the midst of Paris
Now, she works in the outer edges
In Renault and Citro√´n cars

You don't need to be a high-class bawd

The clients are easily tricked
Naturally, that's where you hide
When it no longer works on Rochechouart Boulevard
And that's why, under the black bridge, those without business always have hope
 Under the black bridge, it's wonderful
There's young gals for old gentlemen
They say, "Psst! I'm fourteen. Stop and enjoy!"
But one can guess from their charms

 Under the black bridge on the Saint-Cloud road
You don't need to be a high-class bawd
You can't see anything, absolutely nothing
The clients are easily tricked
Naturally, that's where you hide
To show what can no longer be seen
And that's why, under the black bridge, those without love always have hope

It's the old pimp from Menilmontant
Who, approaching with a sneer, offers the trick
And what takes the cake is that the car often stops for a long time
 Under the black bridge on the Saint-Cloud road
You don't need to be a fancy silver fox
You can't see anything, absolutely nothing
The clients are easily tricked
Naturally, that's where you hide
When the henfolk, alas, desert you
And that's why, under the black bridge
All those without a cent still have hope

A day will come, I will cast a spell on you
To savour your tears

2.

translated_poem:
There's those who talk to you about America
They got visions of cinema
They tell you, "What a magnificent country,
Our Paris is nothing compared to it"
These tall tales make one less timid
In short, you leave one day, during a moment of despair...
It makes one more person that, with an empty stomach,
Will search for a dollar in New York
In the midst of beggars, outcasts,
Of immigrants with broken hearts
He'll think, regretting Paris:
 Where's my Moulin of Place Blanche?
My smoke shop and my local cafe?
Every day was like Sunday for me!
Where are my friends, my buddies?
Where are all my old musette dances?
Their javas to the sound of the accordion?
Where are all my meals without cake
With a two-bit cone of fries?
Where the heck are they?
 Others believing they can win even more
Dream even more beautiful golden dreams
Why risk such a long journey
Since Paris is full of suckers?
You build a colossal business
With the money of the good folks
But one day, crack... comes the big scandal:
Mister will sleep tonight in a cell!
And tomorrow they'll take him
For ten years in Noum√©a
One more who will say:
 Where's my Moulin of Place Blanche?
My smoke shop and my local cafe?
Every day was like Sunday for me!
Where are my friends, my buddies?
Where are all my old musette dances?
Their javas to the sound of the accordion?
Where are all my meals without cake
With a two-bit cone of fries?
Where the heck are they?
 But Montmartre seems to be disappearing
For alas, from season to season
From Abbesses to the Place du Tertre,
Our old houses are being demolished
On the vacant lots of the hill
Large banks will soon be born,
Where will you then tumble,
Y'all, the poor kids in Poulbot?
Regretting the old times
We'll sing, thinking of Salis,
Montmartre, your "De Profundis!"
 Where's my Moulin of Place Blanche?
My smoke shop and my local cafe?
Every day was like Sunday for me!
Where are my friends, my buddies?
Where are all my old musette dances?
Their javas to the sound of the accordion?
Where are all my meals without cake
With a two-bit cone of fries?
Where the heck are they?

translated_poem:
The air is soft, the sky is celebrating
The street is full of lovers
The sparrows, eternal poets
Send joyful triplets
Spring will sing its love song
We feel the sting of desire
And hearts, empty of hope
Go where pleasure is sold
 It's a sleazy hotel
Where the gals leer
With a caressing air
At the passers-by
A seedy house
Where sometimes sleep
Guys with heavy hearts, without love
 You, whose heart remains sincere
Despite the grief and tears
Do you believe that in this misery
You'll be able to find happiness?
Born under an unlucky star
You dream of some beauty
It's here that love settles
Go, you'll be able to buy it...
 It's a sleazy hotel
Where the gals leer
With a caressing air
At the passers-by
A seedy house
Where sometimes sleep
Guys with heavy hearts, without love
 He is gone, the poor wretch
Under the porch, he disappeared
Less crazy than me, me who hopes
The return of a lost spring
Why mock this poor man,
Blame his one-night whim
While my heart is, in the end
Just an empty house of hope...
 It's a sleazy hotel
Where I often look
At a sad, abandoned past
Longingly
A seedy house,
Heartbreaking and wild,
Where forever sleeps
My love

 Les filles qui la nuit s'offrent au coin des rues
Connaissent de belles histoires
Qu'elles disent parfois m√™lant aux phrases crues

 Les filles qui la nuit s'offrent au coin des rues
Connaissent de belles histoires
Qu'elles disent parfois m√™lant aux phrases crues
Des chers souvenirs que garde leur m√©moire

translated_poem:
Gals who offer themselves at night on street corners
Have lived through touching and remarkable experiences
That they sometimes tell, mixing with coarse expressions
The precious memories they hold onto in their minds
But with a voice so solemn, moving, and determined
That you can't help but believe
The gals who offer themselves at night on street corners
 One, clasping her hands, reminisces about her youth
Spent by the ocean
Another recalls a better day when she was spoiled
This one talks about a child
And they all humbly strip and reveal their most difficult and sweetest moments
 Gals who offer themselves at night on street corners
Have lived through touching and remarkable experiences
That they sometimes tell, mixing with coarse expressions
The precious memories they hold onto in their minds
But with a voice so solemn, moving, and determined
That you can't help but believe
The gals who offer themselves at night on street corners
 They had to carry, on their fragile shoulders
A burden that was often too heavy
To endure the worst and saddest roles
Without ever rebelling
And yet, as soon as hope touches them
They all still believe in love
 Gals who offer themselves at night on street corners
Have lived through touching and remarkable experiences
That they sometimes tell, mixing with coarse expressions
The precious memories they hold onto in their minds
But with a voice so solemn, moving, and determined
That you can't help but believe
The gals who offer themselves at night on street corners

original_poem:

 √âtonne-moi, branche-moi, √©lectrocute-moi

 Tes petits tours de passe-passe sont pas tr√®s efficaces
Tu n'es qu'un orgueilleux qui se prend pour un dieu !
Ta folie des grandeurs n'est pas √† la hauteur

 Zabacadabra ! Grand-m√®re t'attrapera

translated_poem:
I have to admit that your little tricks are amusing
I bet there's a rabbit under your hat!
But today I see you losing your bad act today!
Go on, clown, show me your cards!
 You want to make me go back to hell
But as for your blitzkrieg, I'll reverberate it
Your delusions of grandeur are not up to task
You're nothing but an amateur
 You think you're a tiger, but I'll coax you
Using maths, I'll make kitties obey me1
Your delusions of grandeur are not up to task
You're nothing but an amateur
 What dread awaits when I lift my pinky finger!
What terror awaits when I crush all of you with a quick squish of my thumb!
If you're set on being unbeaten, you're going to have to start mourning!
We'll duel to the death2
 Surprise me, plug me in, electrocute me
At the bottom of the barrel pierced with knives!
I'll save my skin, it won't be a piece of cake!
But I'll do it, my darling!
 Your little tricks aren't very effective
You're nothing but an arrogant person who thinks he's a god!
Your delusions of grandeur are not up to task
You're nothing but an amateur
 Zabacadabra, Grandma's going to get you
And abracadabra, I'm bigger than the Himalayas
You can't quiver in front of me
without your pyjama bottoms dropping off!
And if you break your machine in a moment of panic
then when you get to the cashier, don't keep on telling me nonstop:
"I'm lost and I'm worried!
I don't understand! It bugs me!
I'm in a bad mood now!"3
  1.
Literally "I make the tomcats obey"
2.
Literally "Our duel continues until the casket", referring to them fighting to the death.
3.
The punctuation and grammar used in these four last lines make it difficult to translate without additional context. In this scene, Jafar is shown boxing Genie into a crate. In the French version, the lyrics seem to imply that this crate handles a broken machine and is being returned to the store or being sent to a repair shop. These four lines seem to be Jafar telling Genie what to say when he arrives at the cashier. "N'√™tre pas dans son assiette" - an expression that means one is not in a good mood or feeling out of it - literally means "to not be in one's plate", which is fitting as the scene ends with Genie's face in a spinning plate.

translated_poem:
It's raining at the fair
Everything's in distress
Shooting and swings
And wooden horse carousels
And I hear the story
Of a slightly crazy guy
Who, in the dark night
Tells me in a soft tone
 I'm the son of the fish woman
My aunt was a bearded woman
My grandpa was a trunk man
My brother is a lion tamer!
Ah! Ah!
And my cousin runs a bawdy house
Near Tarbes
He owns two near Toulon
Where they play the accordion
You see, they all got a good situation
But me, I'm just the son of the fish woman
 I love and I'm foolish
What a terrible love
I love the woman without a head
And one day, I told her
Listen to me, my soul
Don't be stubborn
But the strange lady
Quickly responded to me
 You're only the son of the fish woman
Your aunt was a bearded woman
Your grandpa was a trunk man
Your brother is a lion tamer!
Ah! Ah!
I want a guy who's got dough
To do whatever I want
I want a house, mink coats
Hats, fancy slips
Come back when you got a good situation
But now you're just the son of the fish woman
 Since then, I deteriorate
I do all kinds of jobs
Sword swallower
Dancer and pork butcher
But I struggle in vain
Nothing succeeds for me
My life is bitter
Because I'm always...
 I'm the son of the fish woman
My aunt was a bearded woman
My grandpa was a trunk man
My brother is a lion tamer!
Ah! Ah!
And my cousin runs a bawdy house
Near Tarbes
He owns two near Toulon
Where they play the accordion
You see, they all got a good situation
But me, I'm just the son of the fish woman

translated_poem:
It's all mapped out, it's all mapped out already
It's been too long since I've slept at night
You don't deserve my tears anymore
You're ice-cold, your body's ice-cold
Just tell me it's all over
Then I'll drop my weapons
 Oh, say it
Say it to me, say it to me, say it to me, say it again
Go ahead, say it to me, say it to me, say it to me, say it again
Say it to me, say it to me, say it to me, say it to me again
Go ahead, say it to me, say it to me, say it to me, say it again
 You're not doing it on purpose, I know that
I've got nothing to lose
So tell me what you wanna do
'Cause I won't lock you up, no
We loved each other
We didn't need anything, the fire was there
And your heart danced in my arms
Now my kiss doesn't even make you shiver
 It's all mapped out, it's all mapped out already
It's been too long since I've slept at night
You don't deserve my tears anymore
 Ice-cold, your heart's ice-cold
Say it to me, say it to me if it's all over
And I'll drop my weapons
 Oh, say it
Say it to me, say it to me, say it to me, say it again
Ah just tell me, just tell me, just tell me, just telll me
I'm going to rip you out of my chest, I know it's going to hurt to forget you
Go ahead, say it to me, say it to me, say it to me, say it again
 I don't want anything else from you, I'm turning my back on you
Our story's over for me
I'm making my own way
No matter what fate
 Ice-cold, your heart's ice-cold
Say it to me, say it to me if it's all over
And I'll drop my weapons

Ah just tell me, just tell me, just tell me, just telll me

original_poem:

Pour moi, √ßa c'est d'la p'tit' bi√®re
Tous ces mecs √† biceps ne m'ont jamais fait peur
Leurs soi-disant combats, c'est du chiqu√©
Ils passent leurs temps √† s' caresser
Si y en a un dans la salle aujourd'hui
Qu'il vienne ici
Il s'ra servi
 C'est moi la m√¥m' catch-catch !
Voyez mes gros biscotteaux, Costauds !
Avec √ßa j'ai l'air vache,
Et un' pair' de pectoraux
D'taureau !
J'ai un' poign' de fer, un c≈ìur en acier
La gueule en or et les deux pieds nick'l√©s
J'fais les pieds au mur comme un √©chalas
Le grand √©cart, et je crache √† quinz' pas
Je bois du gros qui tache
C'est moi la m√¥m' catch-catch
 Un jour, dans une bagarre
Avec deux affranchis dans l'quartier d'l'Arsenal
J'ai cogn√© sans crier gare
Le premier en est mort, l'autre est √† l'h√¥pital
Les flics sont arriv√©s naturell'ment
Bien apr√®s coup, c'est plus prudent
Ton nom, me dit le commissaire au "quart"
J'lui dis y a qu'toi pour pas l'savoir
 C'est moi la m√¥m' catch-catch !

translated_poem:
There's been a lot of fuss around
About wrestlers, pro wrestlers, boxers, heartbreakers,
To me, that's just small potatoes
All them guys with biceps have never scared me
Their so-called fights are an act
They spend their time caressing each other
If there's one in the room today
Let him come here
I'll take care of him!
 I'm the catch-catch gal!
Check out my big biceps, strong!
With that, I look tough
And a pair pectorals like a bull
To boot!
I have an iron grip, a heart of steel
A golden mouth and two lucky feet
I put my feet up on the wall like a beanpole
Do the splits, and spit fifteen feet away
I drink rough red wine that leaves stains
I'm the catch-catch gal!
 One day in a fight
With two goodfellas in the Arsenal district
I hit without warning
The first one died, the other is in the hospital.
The pigs arrived, naturally,
Well after the fact‚Äîit's more prudent
"Your name?" said the commissioner at the station
I told him, "Only you don't know."
 I'm the catch-catch gal!
Check out my big biceps, strong!
With that, I look tough
And a pair pectorals like a bull
To boot!
I have an iron grip, a heart of steel
A golden mouth and two tattooed feet
I put my feet up on the wall like a beanpole
Do the splits, and spit fifteen feet away
I drink rough red wine that leaves stains
I'm the catch-catch gal!
 I have an iron grip, a heart of steel
A golden mouth, and two tattooed feet
I put my feet up on the wall like a scarecrow
Do the splits, and spit fifteen feet away
I drink rough red wine that leaves stains
I'm the catch-catch gal!

translated_poem:
[Lucheni]
Otherwise, everything is going very well
Fran√ßois-Joseph is finally listening to her
But the queen, on the chessborad
Always ends up the winner1
 Sophie, who's finally pushed aside
Starts to fear derailment
She leans on the faithful
For a last stand
 [Sophie]
I am outraged
The monarchie is shot
My son doesn't care about my voice
Elisabeth is taking him from me
The question is: Her or us?
 [Gr√ºne]
That one has what it takes to make someone crazy
 [Rauscher]
We need to act
 [Schwartzenberg]
And very quickly
 [Tous]
Before Elisabeth discredits us
 [Schwarzenberg]
It's intolerable,
How she protects Hungary
She fires up this rebel from Andrassy
 [Kempen]
Among her closest friends are found the worst liberals
 [Schwazenberg]
I predict that
We're all going to finish on the scaffold
 [Sophie, Gr√ºne, Schwarzenberg, Rauscher]
It's her or us
That one has what it takes to make someone crazy
We need to act, and very quickly
Before Elisabeth discredits us
 [H√ºbener (at the same time)]
Her influence is growing, she's now giving to the Grant
 [Kempen (at the same time)]
Instead of Goethe or Schiller she reads Heine
 [Gr√ºne]
Ah, well, I understand the Emperor.
 [Sophie]
Yes?
 [Gr√ºne]
He remains a man.
She is really very, very beautiful
 [Sophie]
Yes, but she's not the only one.
 [Schwarzenberg]
Oh, you think
 [Gr√ºne]
Could this be a plan
 [Rauscher]
What's the idea
 [Sophie]
It's time to be a bit handy
 [H√ºbner]
And a woman
 [All]
By a woman
 [Sophie]
We have to liberate our emperor
 [H√ºbner]
He must understand
That his wife is not the only woman in the world
 [Gr√ºne]
I think that it's time
That he amuses himself elsewhere
 [Schwarzenberg]
Soon, it must be
That we give him this little gift
 [Gr√ºne]
I will find him the most efficient of temptresses
 [Rauscher]
From a moral point of view, I have to protest energetically against this proposition. But from a political standpoint I find it excellent.
 [Sophie]
In sum
 [All]
It's her or us
That one has what it takes to make someone crazy
We need to act, and very quickly
Before Elisabeth discredits us
 [Sophie]
Gr√ºne, I'm counting on your discretion
 [Gr√ºne]
Don't worry, your Highness, there's sufficient choice in Madam Wolf's Lounge2
 [All]
It's her or us
That lady has what it takes to make us crazy
We need to act
  1.
"Winner" here is masculine, probably becuase Sophie is "The only man at Court (See the song "D'un d√©vouement sans faille")
2.
'Lounge' here also contains the meaning of salon/show/sitting room/saloon

translated_poem:
I know what's the solution : To go to Paris, to rent on the 7th floor
The living room will be small, we'd feel so alone in this world in the mornings
Post it notes on the fridge, something that you found funny, the other day at work
I'll be down, I won't be late, I'll back in an hour, I love you, take care, kisses
And like a cinema star, I'd write down, in rented books
Every little phrase that you'd shout, so that I'd leave it on the fridge
 And from up high, France would be like a movie
And we'd be prettier than ever
And from up high, France would be like a movie
And we'd be prettier than ever
 Let's Go? Let's Go?
Let's Go? Let's Go?
Let's Go? Let's Go?
Let's Go?
 Our only fear would be to reach the appointment
That we'd have booked in a new bistrot
The pre-previous weekend
I'm telling you I'm suffering, I can't pronounce half of the menu
Kiss me, tonight is for you, really, I have no idea what you're talking about
Like a cinema star, Ratatouille, and wines, and scent of cinnamon
 And from up high, France would be like a movie
And we'd be prettier than ever
And from up high, France would be like a movie
And we'd be prettier than ever
 Let's Go? Let's Go?
Let's Go? Let's Go?
Let's Go? Let's Go?
Let's Go?
 But our movie
Never reaches France
We never left

original_poem:
Pr√®s de Paris, au bord de la Seine,
Sont d‚Ä≤ gais endroits o√π l'on se prom√®ne
On met ses beaux atours
Faut √™tre chic quand viennent les beaux jours
Et puis peut-on jamais savoir
Ce qui s‚Ä≤ passera le soir ?
En s' balladant, on voit une guinguette
O√π dans la semaine les rouliers s'arr√™tent
On y entend un orchestre poussif
Un accord√©on plaintif
 C‚Ä≤est Un petit bal musette
C‚Ä≤est un tr√®s gentil caboulot
O√π dansent les midinettes
Chaque dimanche, au bord de l'eau
Un vieux saxo nostalgique
Soupire encore une java
Toujours sur cette musique
On tourne, on tourne √† petit pas !
On s‚Ä≤ balance sur l'escarpolette
Et √ßa fait crier les fillettes !
Dans le petit bal musette
Dans le tr√®s gentil caboulot
Un peu partout, l‚Ä≤amour guette
On est si bien au bord de l'eau!
 Toute la journ√©e, les gars, les fillettes
Boivent, en dansant, des tas de canettes
Comme le soleil est chaud
De jolis petits coins de peau
Se font voir soudain sans pudeur
Pardon, c‚Ä≤est la chaleur !
Sous la tonnelle, on voit la patronne
C'est, sans mentir, une jolie personne
Qui, loin des yeux de son mari jaloux,
Au violon donne rendez-vous!
 C'est Un petit bal musette
C‚Ä≤est un tr√®s gentil caboulot
O√π dansent les midinettes
Chaque dimanche au bord de l‚Ä≤eau !
On accompagne les danses
D'un refrain qui vient des faubourgs
Et l‚Ä≤on transpire en cadence
Tout √ßa, c'est d‚Ä≤ la faute √† l'amour !
Sous l‚Ä≤≈ìil d'un agent redoutable
On peut s' biser √† chaque table
Dans le petit bal musette
Dans le tr√®s gentil caboulot
Dans tous les coins l‚Ä≤amour guette
On est si bien au bord de l‚Ä≤eau!
 Lorsque s'allument les lampes √©lectriques,
Arrivent en trombe des nu√©es de moustiques
Afin de les chasser
Les gar√ßons toujours empress√©s

translated_poem:
Near Paris, on the bank of the Seine River,
There's joyful places where one can walk around
You put on your best attire
You have to be stylish when the fair days come
And can you ever know
What will happen at night?
While a-strolling, you see a guinguette
Where during the week the carters stop
There, you can hear a wheezy band
A plaintive accordion
 It's a little musette dance
A very likely little bar
Where the young gals dance
Every Sunday, by the water's edge
An old nostalgic sax
Still sighs for a java
Always to this music
We turn, and we turn with small steps!
We swing on the swing
And it makes the young gals scream!
In the little musette dance
In the very likely little bar
Love is lurking everyplace
We're so good by the water's edge!
 All day, the guys and the young gals
Drink, while a-dancing, lots of cans
As the sun is hot
Pretty little skin patches
Suddenly shamelessly show
Sorry, it's due to the heat!
Under the arbor, one sees the patronne
She's, without lying, one pretty person
Who, away from her jealous husband's eyes
Has rendezvous with the violinist!
 It's a little musette dance
A very likely little bar
Where the young gals dance
Every Sunday, by the water's edge
We accompany the dances
With a refrain that comes from the suburbs
And one sweats in rhythm
All this is the fault of love!
Under the watchful eye of a fearsome officer
One can kiss at each table
In the little musette dance
In the very likely little bar
Love is lurking everyplace
We're so good by the water's edge!
 When the electric lamps come on
Swarms of mosquitoes come a-rushing in
In order to chase them away
The boys, always eager, explore charming places That didn't expect that much!
And you can hear the little moans of birds
You must keep the virtue which is faltering, so the band plays more softly
And goes out complete
 It's a little musette dance
A very likely little bar
Where the young gals dance
But finally, the night arrives
Every Sunday, by the water's edge
You have to go home
And all along the bank
We go, a-singing a thousand songs!
We get lost in the dark night
It's so good to dream under the moon!
It's a little musette dance
It's a very likely little bar
And much later, we regret
The hours of love by the water's edge!

translated_poem:
Get out, get out
I don't know why I made you get in
 Get out, get out
You promised me you would stop
 Get out, get out
It was a stupid mistake, I promise you
 Get out, get out
It's time for you to stop yourself
 Get out, get out
Get out, get out
 Get out, get out
I will leave your bag at the next stoplight
 Get out, get out
I should have listened to myself a bit more
 Get out, get out
You promised me you would stop
 Get out, get out
People like you, I saw tons of them
 Get out, get out (4x)

original_poem:
Je n' suis pas une femme trop chiqu√©e

 Lui me prend mes sous

 Pendant que moi je m'explique au boulot
Tous les jours, entre deux ap√©ros

Une belote ou m√™me un zanzibar
C'est moi qui tire les marrons du feu
Pour lui, les marrons, les noirs, les bleus
Il n'est pas √† un pr√®s

 Lui me prend mes sous

Me martyrise

Sans rien que j' dise

Pour un voyou

translated_poem:
I'm not a fancy woman
I don't hang out with distinguished folks
I know pretty well that I'm a po' gal from nothing
That everybody deems as a dog
I don't have any family or relations
I can't have any pretensions
Yet, like all flowers need a tutor
I got my man, and that's all my happiness
 He takes my money
He beats up on me
Tortures me
Day and night
Without me saying anything
Too bad, it's him
He, he's somebody
It hurts, but it makes me feel good
That sounds stupid
To a thug
But for me, he's everything
 While I work my butt off on the job
Every day, between two drinks
He goes to a small bar
To play a game of pool
A belote or even a zanzibar
I'm the one who does all the work
He does all the clouting and walloping
Since he's a real man
One more or less punch is six and two threes to him
Boy, does he ever rearrange my face!
 He takes my money
He beats up on me
Tortures me
Day and night
Without me saying anything
Too bad, it's him
He, he's somebody
It hurts, but it makes me feel good
That sounds stupid
To a thug
But for me, he's everything

original_poem:

√ßa sert √† rien, tu perds ton temps.

 Sans rien t'expliquer, elle est partie.

c'√©tait la plus jolie.
 Et tu cherches √† comprendre,
√ßa sert √† rien, tu perds ton temps.
Elle √©tait belle et tendre,
tu l'aimais dans son vieux pull-over blanc.
 Dans la nuit d'un dernier hiver,
le souvenir de ses yeux clairs.
 Il y a trop longtemps que c'est fini
et tu te bats contre l'oubli.
 Et tu cherches √† comprendre,
√ßa sert √† rien, tu perds ton temps.
Elle √©tait belle et tendre,
tu l'aimais dans son vieux pull-over blanc.(2x)
translated_poem:
She's been gone for a long time now
I can no longer count the years on my fingers
She looked like a little girl
We loved her almost as much as you
 And you try to understand
That's pointless, you're wasting your time
She was beautiful, gentle
You loved to see her with her old white pullover
 She left without explanation
She left you alone in your dirty sheets
Out of love, she told you
That the last night
Was the greatest
 And you try to understand
That's pointless, you're wasting your time
She was beautiful, gentle
You loved to see her with her old white pullover
 In the night of one last winter
You've got the image of her light eyes
 It's been too long since it ended
And you're fighting to forget it
 And you try to understand
That's pointless, you're wasting your time
She was beautiful, gentle
You loved to see her with her old white pullover x2

translated_poem:
There's lots of broads
That act prim and proper
As soon as a man tries and approach them
They needa be alone in ladies' compartments
They're afraid of inhaling smoke
But I'm not that fussy
I got my true love, a goodfella
With him, there's no need to stand on ceremony
We're in love with each other and that's all that matters
 He's not a short or weak man
A weakling, a nobody
He's a real man
I love his flat nose
His lead-covered gold jaw
In his pale complexion
He can take my money
He can beat up on me
Without me complaining
He got big muscles
But he's the one I got under my skin
He's the man that I need
 Sometimes, I have some adventures
And I've met men from all walks of life
I'm a little curious by nature
But he's still the one that I love most
 He doesn't shave, and his hairs prick me
And when he kisses me, he smells like tobacco
But he does things to me that make me attached to him
And I swoon when I'm in his arms
 He's not a short or weak man
A weakling, a nobody
He's a real man
I love his flat nose
His lead-covered gold jaw
In his pale complexion
He can take my money
He can beat up on me
Without me complaining
He got big muscles
But he's the one I got under my skin
He's the man that I need
 When my man picks up a broad from high society
If he got a run-in with her hubby
To pull out his knife from his pocket
He's the first to act, the one who calls the tune
 He got a stomach tattoo
Under the tattoo, there's a question mark.
This will allow him, 'cause he fools around
To also have a bit of adventure
 He's not a short or weak man
A weakling, a nobody
He's a real man
I love his flat nose
His scar spread all over
His pale complexion
He can take my money
He can beat up on me
Without me complaining
He got big muscles
He's the king of the tough guys
He's the man that I need

 Y'a des tas d'ambitieux qui s‚Ä≤acharn‚Ä≤nt √† la peine

translated_poem:
There's many citizens who love nature
But who can't afford to travel
They only know about it through literature
The shore where orange trees bloom
They dream of going to the heaths in Brittany
To the rip-off inns
Without realizing that there's a real land of milk and honey
Just a stone's throw from Paris...
 On skid row
Better than on a throne
We're happier than kings!
We apply
The real Republic
Living without constraints or laws...
There's no rich folks
But everybody's got their own place
And their little yard just the same
With three pots geraniums and a share of sunshine...
On skid row!
 We don't have palaces made of Carrara marble
With gilding on the balcony...
We live in a hut made of cigar boxes
And a roof made of cardboard!
There's no need to showboat in your car
To have a chick fall into your arms!
Love is cheaper and a lot easier
Than with motion picture stars...
 On skid row
There's no yellow sand
No parasols or azure sea...
We invite ourselves
To chow down on french fries
With a glass of pure wine!
In the breeze
You can do as you please
Take a nap buck naked in the sun...
Just like nudists in Beausoleil or Nice
On skid row!
 There's dogs that bicker through the fences
Geese, pigeons, ducks...
Chicks boldly venture out
But not like the ones on the boulevards!
Scientists who want to study our customs
Would be obligated to acknowledge
That the sidewalk frog and the asphalt fish
Can't adapt to our environment!
 On skid row
Of course, the fauna
Isn't like that in all countries...
We hunt
Hunting rats, fleas, and mice
Instead of pheasants and partridges!
We practice
Track and field events
And porcuquine* sports at the same time...
We have swings to pull and wooden horses to ride...
On skid row!
 There's many ambitious folks who work hard
To pull down three hundred thousand francs
So they can buy a castle in Touraine later on
They must not be in the know!
All you got to do is come like that, just one Sunday
With planks and tools
And build your own villa Les Pervenches
Or your li'l chalet √áa m'suffit!
 On skid row
It's the yellow peril
Tykes crop up all over the lot like Chinese!
We forget
Hydrotherapy
When we get our water from the roof!
We got to get used to it
And among the women on skid row
They whisper, pointing fingers
At those who don't got
two kids at once every year
On skid row!

translated_poem:
Sandwiches are excellent
Sandwiches are good
I love all sandwiches
I never have too many of them
I eat them for supper
And for my lunch
If I had a lot of them
I would eat them all in one go
 I travel in this big country
A vagabonde singer
If you want to listen to me, I have a lot of songs
I don't want money, (you) don't have to pay me
But if you give me a sandwich
I will always be happy
 Sandwiches are excellent
Sandwiches are good
I love all sandwiches
I never have too many of them
I eat them for supper
And for my lunch
If I had a lot of them
I would eat them all in one go
 I went to England
To visit the queen
Her sandwiches were so small
That I was always hungry
I asked for other ones, with a gentil "Please"
She gave me the smallest one
And afterwards, she kicked me out
 Sandwiches are excellent
Sandwiches are good
I love all sandwiches
I never have too many of them
I eat them for supper
And for my lunch
If I had a lot of them
I would eat them all in one go
 A day, I saw a handsome boy
The most handsome in the world
All the girls in my village
Wanted to be his girlfriend
They offered him all the stars
The moon and the sun
I gave him a sandwich
And he married me
 Sandwiches are excellent
Sandwiches are good
I love all sandwiches
I never have too many of them
I eat them for supper
And for my lunch
If I had a lot of them
I would eat them all in one go
 Sandwiches are excellent
Sandwiches are good
I love all sandwiches
I never have too many of them
I eat them for supper
And for my lunch
If I had a lot of them
I would eat them all in one go

original_poem:

 Pour trouver l'issue je ferais l'effort

 Mais tous ces combats m'√©puisent

Les tentations se dessinent
 Pour trouver l'issue je ferais l'effort
D'√©carter les diables de mon corps

Dirige mes pas √† travers le mal
 Je m'enterre
Quand la toile
Se resserre et que mon coeur s'emballe
Mon corps s'enflamme
De la lave coule dans mes vaines
Le temps s'arr√™te
translated_poem:
The hours pass and I escape the shadow
At any moment I do not breathe
Followed by perfidious spirits
I will perish if I cease running
If I cease running
 To find the exit I will make the effort
Of removing the demons from my body
I will cease waiting that my star
Directs my steps through the evil
 But all these combats exhaust me
In my back, I feel penetrating, the claws
And delicately I slip
The fever and the temptations take shape
The temptations take shape

translated_poem:
Every Sunday and often Saturdays
We meet up at the musette dance
It's what brings us joy in life
And gives it a festive feel
 The tango, the rumba, especially the java
We both never miss one
Before the last round
We always hear
Everyone whispering to each other
 The last of the last
Come, darling, dance it in my arms
It's on its tune
That our day ends
 The musician suddenly plays a beat
It seems like she's playing just for us
 The last of the last
Before we part, let's dance it
The last of the last
It's always the best of javas
 In our love, there are ups and downs
And it's not always just smiles
The only way, when things don't go well
Between us, I will say
 With one last kiss
We can save everything
We can win back the unfaithful one
Go for it with all your heart
It's your happiness
That calls us for the java
 The last of the last
Come, darling, dance it in my arms
It's on its tune
That our day ends
 The musician suddenly plays a beat
It seems like she's playing just for us
 The last of the last
Before we part, let's dance it
The last of the last
It's always the best of javas

 The last of the last
Before we part, let's dance it
The last of the last
It's always the best of javas

translated_poem:
Between us, the rays of the heavenly light where the oxalis grows intrude
Our hearts remain sealed
 Going to your grave
Do you know who I've run into?
A certain Miss Rathle
Why does her name conjure up
Mysteries and dramas?
Without knowing, I fantasize,
Why not, a destiny
That would be tied to you
 Her mother, Marie-Camille
Rests at her side
She outlived her girl
38 more years
Of the two, I know nothing
But the silent conversation
In front of your sealed stone
Inspires me to make up stories
 Between us, the rays of the heavenly light where the oxalis grows intrude
Our hearts remain sealed
 To your right, that face
Near asphyxiation
The head twisted off
Trying to breathe
Oxygen in the face of death
Once the park is closed
Watches over her from above
Sounds from the beyond
A slight nod
I turn my heels
Unheard "goodbye"
Who knows if you
Hear me without my knowledge?
I will search for your shadow
Among the living
And among the debris
 Between us, the rays of the heavenly light where the oxalis grows intrude
Our hearts remain sealed
 Take one is over
Bid adieu to your old sister
Under cover
Going sober,
Over and out
 [Here, it's music hidden at the very end of the piece.]

That's it... you listened to my music?
- Yes, I listened!
- My music is boring (laughter)
I don't think you like it
- Yes, I do!
[Alphabet in English]
- Mom, it's over! Over!

If you were not here with me

The happiness that fills me
When I'm in your arms

Que de la publicit√© comme ces bruits de clochers ?
Et ta mort d√©sesp√©rante, l'avais-tu choisie ?
Voulais-tu frapper les hommes pour qu'ils sortent enfin de l'ennui ?
 Deux mille ans apr√®s
Non, rien n'a chang√©
On montre du doigt
On montre du doigt
Je ne doute pas
Mais ne comprends pas
Ne nous oublie pas
Ne nous oublie pas
 J√©sus
Toi qui voulais parler de paix
Dis-moi, dis-moi, dis-moi pourquoi

J√©sus
Deux mille ans apr√®s

Je ne comprends pas

Je ne comprends pas

translated_poem:
Even if you're not listening, I have to talk to you
Why did you seem to let go of the world
Israel in the year zero - how obscure1
Why did you choose a desert to come and preach?
You forgive everything - even Mary Magdalene - in order to love2
Why do I need to love out of duty and not when I want?
 Two thousand years later
No, nothing has changed
We point our fingers
We point our fingers
I don't doubt
But I don't understand
Don't forget about us
Don't forget about us
 "Jesus Christ, Jesus Christ
The world was unknown to us
Jesus Christ, Jesus Christ
Finally you came"
 Jesus Christ Superstar
Did you come too early or too late?
Jesus Christ Superstar
Did you come too early or too late?
 You are the greatest among the greats
Say, what do you think?
Buddha or even Muhammad - who do you prefer?
Did they do what they did or was it just
all hype like the sound of these bells?
And your tragic death, did you choose it?
Did you want to hit the men so that they finally came out of boredom?
 Two thousand years later
No, nothing has changed
We point our fingers
We point our fingers
I don't doubt
but I don't understand
Don't forget about us
Don't forget about us
 Jesus
You who wanted to talk about peace
Tell me, tell me, tell me why
do you let men tear themselves apart?
Jesus
Two thousand years later
 Yes, tell me why
I don't understand
Why hasn't anything changed
Did you do well
by opening yourself so much?
After two thousand years and so many innocent people, why cry now?3
Oh yes, Jesus
Don't forget about us
Yet you know that we don't want you
I don't understand
I don't understand
Two thousand years after
Nothing has changed
Oh, I think of you
Don't forget about us
  1.
Literally "it's the darkness". "Obscurit√©" literally means darkness, but figuratively it can refer to a lack of knowledge/understanding or a situation that is unremarkable.
It may be Judas calling Israel in 0AD an unremarkable period, or it may be him not understanding why Jesus chose that era. (Note: 0AD was not the birth year of Jesus despite popular belief.)
2.
"You forgive all, Mary Magdalene, to love (singular pronoun, e.g. he/she/it)". It seems to refer to how Jesus is all-loving and forgiving, even towards Mary Magdalene.
3.
Literally "Why cry two thousand years after so many innocent people?"

original_poem:

Et depuis je vais partout o√π l'on boit
Dans toutes les maisons o√π l'on soupe
Je sors tous les soirs, esp√©rant le voir
Et le champagne emplit ma coupe
 Quand je suis grise, j'dis des b√™tises

Comme les copines, je me morphine
√áa me rend tout rigolo
Je prends de la coco
√áa trouble mon cerveau
L'esprit s'envole
Et mon chagrin
S'enfuit au loin

 Hier au soir comme tous les soirs pr√©c√©dents
Je sablais encore le champagne
Lorsque j'aper√ßus mon ancien amant
Avec sa nouvelle compagne
L'orchestre jouait un brillant tango
Dans ses bras il tenait sa belle
Et moi sur la table, j'ai pris un couteau

 Oui j'√©tais grise, j'ai fait une b√™tise
J'ai tu√© mon gigolo
D'vant les copines, comme une coquine
Dans l'c≈ìur j'lui ai mis mon couteau

translated_poem:
I had a lover for a few months
I loved him wholesouledly
But he walked away without knowing why
He broke my woman's heart
And since then, I go everywhere where there is drinking
In all the joints where people sup
I go out every night, hoping to see him
And champagne fills my glass
 When I'm tipsy, I say silly things
I entertain the gigolos
Like my gal friends, I do morphine
It makes me very funny
I do coke
It confuses my brain
My mind flies away
And my sorrow
Runs away in the distance
I go crazy
 Last night, like all previous nights,
I was still quaffing champagne
When I saw my ex-lover
With his new partner
The band played a brilliant tango
He held his lovely in his arms
And me, on the table, I grabbed a knife
And my revenge was cruel
 Yes, I was tipsy, and I committed a foolish act
I killed my gigolo
In front of my gal friends, like a naughty girl
In his heart, I put my knife
Give me some coke
To disturb my brain
My mind flies away
Toward the Lord
My beloved
Made me crazy

original_poem:

A LA D√âRIVE
Aveugl√©ment, je pardonnais.

translated_poem:
When I met him/her, I understood
That he/she was somebody too trendy
But what can you do, the heart was taken
My brand new heart was in captivity
He/She made me what he/she wanted
His/Her own thing for his/her fancy
And I had nothing left but one goal
To love him/her despite his/her vices
Then unconsciously
Without knowing how...
 I felt myself DRIFTING AWAY
When he/I took ahold of me/her
Nothing else existed
The desire, always stronger, intoxicated me
Under his/her kisses, I felt myself drifting away nice and softly
I don't know where
DRIFTING AWAY
Blindly, I forgave
His/Her mean words and insults
To keep him/her, I would've done anything.
To prevent this breakup
He/She left, do we know what it feels like
To lose the man/woman that one loves
How many tears and regrets
We must still live
Unknowingly
(Miserably)
Without knowing how...
 I'd like to be able to leave
DRIFTING AWAY
Drown my love
In the course of days
That would lead me, nice and softly, to other shores
In a clear sky, washed of everything, I will go there
I don't know where
DRIFTING AWAY

On se caresse, on se cajole
On se comprend, on se console
Mais au bout du compte

Qu'on est toujours tout seul au monde
 Mais au bout du compte
On se rend compte
Qu'on est toujours tout seul au monde
Toujours tout seul au monde
translated_poem:
We sleep next to each other
We live together
We caress each other, we cuddle
Understand and comfort each other
But at the end
We realise
That we're always alone in the world
 We dance together
We chase each other
We hate each other, we tear each other apart
We destroy each other, we want each other
But at the end
We realise
That we're always alone in the world
 We sleep next to each other
We live all together
We caress each other, we cuddle
Understand and comfort each other
But at the end
We realise
That we're always alone in the world
 But at the end
We realise
That we're always alone in the world
Always alone in the world

translated_poem:
Hey, did you happen to see
The most beautiful girl in the world today?
And if you did
Oh, was she crying, crying?
 Hey, if you happen across the girl that walked out on me
Tell her I'm in pain
And I need her so bad
Oh, tell her that I love her
 Hey, did you happen to see the most beautiful girl in the world today?
And if you did, was she crying, crying?
 At the first light of day
The sun couldn't find a slight indentation on her pillow
That she'd just left
 What have I done, and what have I said?
Words that we throw and forget
But that become wounds
And everything stops in front of a wall
 So hey, did you happen to see
The most beautiful girl in the world today?
And if you did
Oh, was she crying, crying?
 Hey, if you happen across the girl that walked out on me
Tell her I'm in pain
And I need her so bad
Oh, tell her that I love her
 Hey, did you happen to see
The most beautiful girl in the world today?
And if you did
Oh, was she crying, crying?
 Hey, did you happen to see
The most beautiful girl in the world today?
And if you did
Oh, was she crying, crying?

Hey you, wake up!
It's time for the amazing

original_poem:
O√π sont tous mes amants,

Tous ceux que j'aime, qui m'ont aim√©e,

 Je vois passer du brouillard sur mes yeux,

Luttant quand m√™me, supr√™me effort,

translated_poem:
Where are all my lovers
All those who loved me so bad
Back when I was beautiful?
Goodbye to the unfaithful ones
 I don't know where they are
At other rendezvous
But my heart hasn't aged
Where are all my lovers?
 In sadness and the returning night
I'm alone, isolated, unsupported
Without any restraints, but without love
My heart is heavy like a wreck
 I, who once knew happiness
On party nights and with suitors
I'm a slave to memories
And that makes me suffer.
 Where are all my lovers
All those who loved me so bad
Back when I was beautiful?
Goodbye to the unfaithful ones
 The night ends and morning comes
The dew weeps with all my sorrows
All those I love, who loved me
In the bleak day are erased
 I see fog passing before my eyes
All those puppets I see, they are them
Struggling still, making a supreme effort,
I believe I'm still embracing them.
 Where are all my lovers
All those who loved me so bad
Back when I was beautiful?
Goodbye to the unfaithful ones
 Where are all my lovers
All those who loved me so bad
But my heart hasn't aged
Where are all my lovers?

original_poem:
{Refrain:}

Quoiqu'on la danse les yeux dans les yeux

Comme elle au monde
Il n'y en a pas deux
C'est la java bleue

translated_poem:
This is the blue java
The loveliest of javas
The one that bewitches
When we dance eye to eye
To the cheerful rhythm
When bodies merge
There's no other like it
In the world
This is the blue java
 At the musette dance
A sweet-filled melody
That turns heads
That makes hearts skip a beat
When we dance with small steps
Holding our loved one in our arms
We whisper to her with a shiver
While listening to the accordion play
 This is the blue java
The loveliest of javas
The one that bewitches
When we dance eye to eye
To the cheerful rhythm
When bodies merge
There's no other like it
In the world
This is the blue java
 My love, under my embrace
I want to hold you tighter
To better hold onto the impression
And the warmth of your body
So many promises and vows
We make in a moment of wildness
Because we know we won't always keep
These vows filled with love
 This is the blue java
The loveliest of javas
The one that bewitches
When we dance eye to eye
To the cheerful rhythm
When bodies merge
There's no other like it
In the world
This is the blue java

original_poem:

 L'hiver viendra et mon seul bien,

translated_poem:
I was born near a gutter where cats hung around
In a tiny attic that could be anyplace
In Montparnasse
T'was on the rooftops that I first saw the world
T'was there for the first time that
I spread my wings!
My deceased folks, like everybody else,
Who, besides, really liked their drinks
At dinnertime in our hovel
Often left me without anythin'
Mouth open
Like a sparrow!
 At the age when all the other kids
Go to school to fill their brains
With good grammar,
In the alleys, we'd play with a bunch of bad brats
In the corners, we'd play
Mama and Papa
Of course, these innocent li'l games
Don't exactly promote
Good manners
At fifteen, all confident
I'd tease all the gigolos
With an impudent look
Like a sparrow!
 The first one who wanted my virtue
Didn't needa try very hard
To lay siege to me
All he hadda do was open his arms
And my love fell right in
Like in a trap
If I had a twisted mind
My heart, on the contrary, was pure as snow
We'd wake up to kisses
We'd echo our love to everyone
Singin' about love
Like two sparrows!
 Did he make a mistake ditching me?
I found solace in a fate
That is ours
With a little guy who knew a thing or two
But who was lazy and
Sold me to others
One gets used to not seeing
The gray dust of the sidewalk
Where they wallow
So, on the Parisian pavement
You search for food in the gutter
With a happy heart
Like sparrows!
 Winter will come, and my only possession
This poor body that I can already feel
Is already worn out
Will fall on the brutal pavement
I'll think on a hospital bed
On a night of anxiety
No worse than most
Despite everything, I would've preferred
Instead of this cuss,
A man who would've loved me with love
To end my days with him
In a warm nest
Like a sparrow!

original_poem:

La vall√©e est en fleur, et les bois embaum√©s

Tandis que le soleil, roi du splendide √©t√©
Verse tranquillement sa puissante clart√©,

Et l√†, nos longs regards perdus au bord des cieux,
Allant des pr√©s fleuris dans l'√©ther spacieux,

O√π les vents de midi, sous leurs lentes haleines

 Et moi, je suis des leurs ! Epris d'azur et d'air,

L√†, dans l'herbe cach√©, seul avec mes pensers

 Po√®mes et Paysages
Po√®me LXVIII
translated_poem:
Here they've returned, the days you like,
The long blue and clear days under cloudless skies.
The valley is in bloom; and the embalmed woods
Open on the turfs their balsamic shade.
While the sun, king of the splendid summer,
Quietly pours its powerful clarity,
At the foot of this large oak with superb branches,
Friend, let's sit in the freshness of the herbs.
And there, our long looks lost at the edge of heaven,
Ranging from flowery meadows in the spacious ether,
Together contemplate these beautiful hillsides, these plains
Where the midday winds, under their slow breath,
Make, from the ripering wheats, the harvests wave.
With me contemplate these calm horizons,
This transparent azure that the black swallow
Fills with joyful cries and crosses with a wing stroke.
And over there those ruminating and recumbent oxen,
And further these hamlets from which the steeples rise,
And this deserted castle, this crumbling turrets
Animated by the flight of the white turtledoves,
And this peaceful river with a nonchalant detour,
And these shady ravines, fresh pasture shelter,
And all this landscape, happy and peaceful,
Where a magnificent sun pours out with afloat of gold !
 O July suns ! o light ! o splendours !
Radiant firmament ! serene dephts !
Powerful months that pour so much burning sapts
In the veins of man and the veins of plants,
Months which are creator ! beautiful months ! I like and bless you.
By you the woods, loaded with leaves and nests,
Are filled with songs, lukewarmeness and aromas,
The trees, in the azure opening their wide domes,
Swing on our foreheads, with the incense of flowers
The voices of the warbler and the whistling blackbirds.
Everything is happy; everything sings, o radiant season !
Because everything longs and drinks your glorious flamme.
By you comes life, and your warm clarity
Ripens for the happiness and for the voluptuousness
The Virgin, this divine flower which ignores herself
In the glens of Eden, seren and still pure,
Under your rays, dreaming her maternal dream,
In the shade of palms trees, Eve conceived Abel.
Abel in his children keeps remembrance of it.
Also, when your fecund power burns in the sky,
O mother of the long days, luminous season !
Forgetting evrything, Cain, the shadow, the betrayal,
The child race of Abel, girl of the light,
Loving race and faithful to its first goodness;
With the wave and the flower, with the nightingale
What sings in the air or blooms in the ground
Goes away saying everywhere in front of your blonde clarity
"How happy the good hearts are to be in the world" !
 And I, I am one of them ! Azure and air lover;
When your star shines to me in the clear firmament
Before noon, I come running, under the tree where you welcome me,
Salute in the woods, the youth of the leaves !
There, in the grass hidden, alone with my thoughts
I quickly forgot the bad days spent.
Under the lustrous branchlets where your clarity trickles;
I drink in peace my share of universal life.
The senses wrapped from your lukewarm networks;
I listen around me to my brothers the birds.
With the grass and the insect, with the wave and the breeze,
Friendly dreamer, my spirit fraternizes.
Veild from golden shadow and eyes ajar;
The soul full of chords, I medidate verses.
But if, as today, my beloved dough
Has wanted to follow me to the wood, under the high branchlet;
If my lovely friend with velvety looks
Has wanted all one day, pensive by my side,
Forgetting the city and life and our chains,
Drink with me the peace that falls from the great oaks,
On the mosses sitting, my forehead on her knees,
Plunging my long glances into her so sweet looks,
Ah ! I no longer dream of verses !... Under her smile
Sings deep within my soul an ineffable lyre,
And from the trees, the flowers, the graces of the summer,
My eye sees, my heart feels only its beauty !
And in her dark hair slipping a shy finger,
I place there quivering some beautiful damp lily,
And, mute at her feet and her hand on my hand,
I vaguely remove jasmin stems,
And their lively scent inebriates me, and on our soul
Like a lukerwarm wind passes a breath of flamme.
 O July flame ! suns of voluptuousness !
Flavor of the kisses caught in the secluded wood !
O sweaty hair and under loved hands
Spreading on my forehead in fragrant clusters !
Flowers under the forest, penetrating scent,
Trees bathed of fire, hours of limp ardour,
Hours where on our soul, drunk from loneliness,
The calm of the great woods reigns with fullness,
Tranquility of the air, mysterious sighs,
Mute dialogue from the eyes speaking to the eyes,
Long silences cut from sweeter words,
Only the fresh murmurs of water among the mosses,
O memories gathered at the foot of the holm oaks,
You live in my heart, you will live in my verses.
 A Elle
 Po√®mes et Paysages
Po√®me LXVIII

original_poem:

translated_poem:
Rain falls down my neck
I am running to our date
The sun sleeps in the middle of August
But anyway, we don't care about that
 I slip under your umbrella
You put your hand over there, over here
And in the hollow of my shoulder
Our skins brush against each other
 We're listening to the splashing
Without a word, feeling captivated
What a stroke of luck, this grey morning
Deep down, I thank the rain
 We stay under your umbrella
You put your hand over there, over here
And in the hollow of my shoulder
Our skins brush against each other
 The rain, barely stopped
The sun comes to ruin it all
You smile and then, you tell me
It also works as a sunshade
 We stay under your umbrella
You put your hand over there, over here
And in the hollow of my shoulder
Our skins brush against each other

translated_poem:
Hey, have you met
The most beautiful girl in the world today?
If you have
Oh, is she crying, is she crying?
 Hey, if you've came across the girl who left me
Be sure to tell her that I'm sad
And that I need her so much
Oh, be sure to tell her that I love her
 Hey, have you met
The most beautiful girl in the world today?
If you have
Oh, is she crying, is she crying?
 When came the first rays of sunshine*
The sun couldn't show
A single hollow on the pillow
She went out from
 What have I done? What did I say?
Words that we regret and forget
But turning into scars
And everything stops in front of a wall
 Hey, have you met
The most beautiful girl in the world today?
If you have
Oh, is she crying, is she crying?
 Hey, if you've came across the girl who left me
Be sure to tell her that I'm sad
And that I need her so much
Oh, be sure to tell her that I love her
 Hey, have you met
The most beautiful girl in the world today?
If you have
Oh, is she crying, is she crying?
 Hey, have you met
The most beautiful girl in the world today?
If you have
Oh, is she crying, is she crying?

translated_poem:
The life of a man is always a hard path
And I'll need a girl
In my heart and in my home
Who tells me: ''Be careful''
 It's sad to always be alone
Facing uncertainty every day
I feel so often surrounded
Not knowing what I should believe
 The life of a man is always a hard path
And I'll need a girl
In my heart and in my home
Who tells me: ''Be careful''
 Before leaving, to sing far from home
I would like someone
Saying to me tenderly while kissing me:
''Please, be careful''
 The life of a man is always a hard path
And I'll need a girl
In my heart and in my home
Who tells me: ''Be careful'' x4

original_poem:

 C'est aujourd'hui dimanche
Et j'allais voir maman

L√†-bas elle m'attend

 La marchande √©mue, doucement lui dit :

 C'est aujourd'hui dimanche

Voici des roses blanches

 Et quand tu t'en iras
