translated_poem:
Today is Sunday
Here you go, my pretty mama
Here are white roses
You who love them so bad
 When I grow up
I'll buy from the merchant
All of his white roses
For you, pretty mama
 Last spring, a cruel fate
Struck the blonde factory worker
She took sick, and the tyke Saw his mother leave for the hospital
 One April morning, among the strollers
Having not a red cent in his pocket
Trembling terribly on a market, the poor kid
Stole some flowers stealthily
 The merchant caught him
Lowering his head, he said to her:
 Today is Sunday
And I was gonna see my ma
I took them white roses That she loves so bad
 She's waiting for me
On her li'l white bed over there
I took them white roses For my pretty ma
 The moved merchant gently said to him,
Take them, I'll give them to you
She kissed him and the child left
Radiant for being forgiven
 Then he ran to the hospital
To give the flowers to his ma
But when she saw him, a nurse
Whispered to him, you no longer have a ma
 And the tyke kneeling said,
In front of the little white bed:
 Today is Sunday, here you go, my pretty mama
Here are white roses
You who loved them so bad
 And when you leave
To the big yard, over there
You'll take all of them white roses with ya

√áa n¬¥ peut pas durer bien longtemps

 Pauvre petite Fleur de mis√®re

translated_poem:
She was an abandoned tyke
Taken in by some bohemians
Poor child, tender withered flower
Beaten and treated like a dog
For already many weeks
She left fearing the blows
Dancing at the carnivals
In order to earn some money
But her mocking laugh
Often hid tears
 They called her Flower of Misery
Little angel with big deep eyes
In a trailer, at the fence
She was the plaything of the vagabonds
Sometimes, in her bitter hours
She thought of the li'l children
Rocked, cherished by their mas
They called her Flower of Misery
 However, a clown, a jester
Met her on his way
Taking the place of her parents
In her misfortune, he extended a hand
But soon, as she became a woman
Gently, without him knowing
Love slipped into his soul
And without meaning to, his heart spoke
Near her, while rocking her
He said softly
 My pretty li'l Flower of Misery
It's over, I don't want to see you cry anymore
Forget the fleeting sorrows
Let's think only of loving each other
I want, by sincere love
To drive away your worries, your anguish.
I'll never love anybody else but you
My pretty li'l Flower of Misery
 But a life of misfortune for all its worth
Cannot last very long
For the cemetery, she made the long journey
On a likely spring morning
On the grave of the po' little dear
The clown, away from the surrounding gaze
Left there a bouquet of violets
A bouquet worth two sous, bouquet of love,
Cussing her death, he whispered softly
 Poor li'l Flower of Misery
I dreamed of happy days for you
But you see, happiness on earth
Isn't meant for the dirt poor...
In a final prayer
Receive these flowers, your sisters
That bouquet is my whole heart.
Goodbye, my li'l Flower of Misery

translated_poem:
I'm writing you tonight, like I do every year
I hung up.my stocking in the chimney"
Yet, dear Santa, you'll be surprised
When you read my letter up in your sky
Because I don't want picture books
Nor big dolls or drums
Toys are nice, and I'm well behaved
But I don't want them, my heart's so heavy
 I'm in too much pain to play
Every day, I cry quietly
Because for more than a week
Dear Pa's gone away
Mama's sad and barely talks
I don't know why, though
You can do anything, say for him to come back
Dear Santa, bring my papa back!
 One evening, Dear Pa was mad
Mama was speaking to him like she was praying
He wasn't listening and left
I was too little to stop him
Now Mama sighs constantly
Everything's become so sad in our home
I don't sing anymore, I can't laugh anymore
And I don't like to play with my toys anymore
 I'm in too much pain to play
Every day, I cry quietly
Oh, how full the house would be
If Dear Pa was here
I would lean my cheek against his
Mama would hold us in her arms
You can do anything‚Äîsay for him to come back
Dear Santa, bring my papa back!

translated_poem:
Hey mister, a cigarette
A cig, that doesn't mean a thing
If you like me, we'll have a wee chat
You're nice, you look like a brick
If you'd be ugly, it would be the same
I'd tell you that you're handsome anyways
To get‚Äîyou can well guess the reason,
What I'm asking from you‚Äîa cig, a smoke
Not English ones, nor gold tips
That's just fake tobacco
 Some scaferlati that we clasp with our fingers
And that we roll
It's strong, it's bitter like wood
It gets you drunk
It's good and it leaves you with a taste
Almost shady
Of blood, love, and disgust
In the mouth
 Mister doctor, is my wound serious?
Yes, I understand, there's no more hope
The guilty one, I don't know, I swear to you
It's the profession, the street, streetwalking
The guilty ones, ah, I can tell you
It's the men with their love
It's the heart that lets itself be seduced
The poverty that lasts night and day
And then I don't care, here, give me
Before dying one last time
 Some scaferlati that i roll with my poor fingers
It's good, it's strong, it rises in me
It gets me drunk
I feel that my soul will leave
Less shy
In the smoke
that I'll breathe out

translated_poem:
If I could no longer have eyes
No longer see yours that attract me
I believe that it'd be best
I'd be less in agony
 Ah, your eyes, I need to see them
look at me, full of tenderness
When I know that before this evening
They'll see another love!
 If I could no longer have eyes
No longer see your lips smile...
Their lies, which are white,
Are the worst torture for me
 No longer see where have landed
The kisses of venal loves
You like to intoxicate yourself
In sickening orgies with!
 If I could no longer have eyes
No longer see your male beauty
Your marvelous victorious air
And your forehead so pure and pale!
 That's why i was attracted to you
Why you captivated me
And if I didn't see you anymore
I guess I would be saved
 If I could no longer have eyes
I'd no longer be under your spell
Which is sweet and odious to me
And has made me shed so many tears!
 I know too well that nobody can see you
Without immediately being your prey
And that, proud of your power,
You crush the hearts you take
 If I could no longer have eyes
I could live by your side without seeing
White ice frost fall on your hair
When you get on in years
 And I would go to the grave
Keeping the charming illusion
That you were always young and handsome
And that I was your only love

translated_poem:
Sometimes women wear
The pants in their home
This fact, I think, has been observed
Within the bounds of matrimony
But when she is a-pedaling
In pants, like a zouave
This matter seems more serious to me
And I say to myself when I see her:
 Swish-swish, swish-swish,
By her petticoat, the woman
Swish-swish, swish-swish, Disturbs the soul of the man
Swish-swish, swish-swish, The woman certainly
Seduces, especially
By her likely rustling
 A woman who has looks like a boy
Was never very attractive
It's the swish of her petticoat
That makes her especially exciting
When the man hears the swishing sound
It's amazing all he dares
Suddenly he wakes up and smells the roses
He electrifies himself and gets wild
 Swish-swish, swish-swish,
By her petticoat, the woman
Swish-swish, swish-swish, Disturbs the soul of the man
Swish-swish, swish-swish, The woman certainly
Seduces, especially
By her likely rustling
 You'll tell me, in pants
One is much better on a bicycle
But I say that without the swishing sound
A woman is not complete
When you see her lift up her skirt
Her petticoat enchants you
Her swishing sound is like a sound of wings
That flutters by and caresses you
 Swish-swish, swish-swish,
By her petticoat, the woman
Swish-swish, swish-swish, Disturbs the soul of the man
Swish-swish, swish-swish, The woman certainly
Seduces, especially
By her likely rustling

translated_poem:
A bird flies, taking away all my dreams,
Then I sing, then I sing
As soon as a new bird rises in the blue sky,
For other dreams to return with her.
As soon as a new bird rises in the blue sky,
For other dreams to return with her.
 Then I sing about summer, love and joy.
Then I sing, and my sorrow vanishes.
 My love suddenly goes away my days are torn apart,
Then I sing, then I sing
From the moment my heart won't let me smile,
When you're not with me on my road.
From the moment my heart won't let me smile,
When you're not with me on my road.
 Then I sing about summer, love and joy.
Then I sing, and my sorrow vanishes.
 If troubles populate your life
Then sing with me, and hope will return.
 My horizon is all gray, the days are gloomy.
Then I sing, then I sing
And for no reason the world turns pink,
Until the sun continue to shine in my life.
And for no reason the world turns pink,
Until the sun continue to shine in my life.
 Then I sing about summer, love and joy.
Then I sing, and my sorrow vanishes.
Then I sing, if nothing works for you,
In troubled times, sing with me!
Then I sing of summer, love and joy,
Then I sing, so sing with me as well!
La la la la la la...

Et comme le printemps leur sourit,
√Ä la campagne elles vont tout de suite
Chercher un beau petit coin fleuri.
 Dans une auberge, en pleine verdure,
Elles d√©jeunent sur le bord de l'eau
Puis valsent au son d'un phono
En chantant pour marquer la mesure :
          On n'a pas tous les jours vingt ans,
        √áa nous arrive une fois seulement,
        C'est le plus beau jour de la vie.
        Alors on peut faire des folies.
          L'occasion il faut la saisir
        Payons-nous un petit peu de plaisir ?
        Nous n'en ferons pas toujours autant,
        On n'a pas tous les jours vingt ans !
 Tous les amoureux de ces demoiselles
Sont venus le soir √† leur tour,
Et l'on entend sous les tonnelles
Chanter quelques duos d'amour !
 Passant par l√†, pr√™tant l'oreille,
Un bon vieux s'arr√™te en chemin...
√Ä sa femme, en prenant sa main,
Lui dit : "souviens-toi ma bonne vieille.."
          On n'a pas tous les jours vingt ans,
        √áa nous arrive une fois seulement,
        Et quand vient l'heure de la vieillesse,
        On appr√©cie mieux la jeunesse.
          De ce beau temps si vite pass√©
        On n'en profite jamais assez...

translated_poem:
The sewing workshop is celebrating
Work's forgotten for a moment
'Cause it's today that Marinette
Has just turned twenty
 Runners, trainee seamstresses, and new hires
Have all brought cakes
And Marinette, treating them to port
Says, joyfully, raising her glass:
 We don't turn twenty every day
It only happens to us once
Sadly, that day goes by too fast!
That's why we've got to live it up
 If the boss looks disapprovingly at us
We'll say:
"We have to laugh a tad!
Too bad if you're not happy
We don't turn twenty every day"
 The boss gives these young ones the day
And since spring is smiling at them
They immediately head out to the country
To find a likely little flowery spot
 In a tavern, surrounded by greenery
They have lunch by the water's edge
Then they waltz to the sound of a phono
Singing to mark the beat:
 We don't turn twenty every day
It only happens to us once
It's the most beautiful day in life
So we can be foolish
 We must snag the opportunity
Let's treat ourselves to a little pleasure
We won't always do this
We don't turn twenty every day!
 All the lovers of these young ladies
Came in the evening in turn
And you can hear under the trellises
A few love duets being sung!
 Passing by, listening intently
An old fellow stops on his way...
Taking his wife's hand,
He says to her:
"Remember, my dear old lady..."
 We don't turn twenty every day
It only happens to us once
And when old age comes
We appreciate youth more
 Of this beautiful, quickly passing time
We never make the most of it enough...
And later we say, sadly:
 "We don't turn twenty every day!"

translated_poem:
Monica...(x3)
 I remember
A guesthouse,
Well-hidden somewhere in the valley,
I remember
A beautiful-smelling tablecloth,
The fresh linen from the house.
 I remember
A bouquet of withered flowers,
A girl with an apron.
She had beautiful blonde locks,
And each of us called her
By her first name.
 Each of us was thinking of Monica,
Each of us was dreaming of Monica
And our love was going to Monica
Who loved us, but gave us nothing tangible.
 I was studying in my room,
But all the time I was thinking
About Monica.
Often she was smiling at me,
Because she like me more,
Monica.
 But one day I had to leave,
And on her cheek I felt
A teardrop.
But all that is in the past now,
And yet I never forgot
Anything.
 (x3):
Each of us was thinking of Monica,
Each of us was dreaming of Monica
And our love was going to Monica
Who loved us, but gave us nothing tangible.

original_poem:

Burning burning burning bright

 Dites-lui que je suis comme elle
Que j'aime toujours les chansons
Qui parlent d'amour et d'hirondelles
De chagrin, de vent, de frissons
Dites-lui que je pense √† elle
Quand on me parle de magnolias
Quand j'entends ces musiques nouvelles
Qui r√©sonnent comm' des bruits de combats
 Your girl is crying in the night
Is she wrong, is she right
Je ne sais plus comment faire
 Elle est si forte qu'elle se brise
Elle √©tait fi√®re elle est soumise
Comme un amour qui l√¢che prise
Qui casse et ne plie pas
Tu lui ressembles
Quand elle tremble
Et dans ta voix
J'entends parfois
Un peu sa voix
Elle te ressemble
Quand elle tremble
Quand elle pleure
L√† dans le c≈ìur
Des arbres en fleurs.
 Dites-lui que j'ai peur pour elle
Dans les sous-sols quand il fait noir
Quand j'entends ces musiques nouvelles
O√π s'en vient crier le d√©sespoir
Dites-lui que je pense √† elle
Dans un grand champ de magnolias
Et que si toutes les fleurs sont belles
Je me br√ªle souvent souvent les doigts
Des magnolias par centaines
Des magnolias comme autrefois
Je ne sais plus comment faire
Les magnolias sont toujours l√†
Elle ressemble √† toutes les filles
Quand elles aiment comme √ßa
Qu'elles soient m√©chantes ou timides
Pauvres violettes ou magnolias
Elle aime les grands ciels humides
Et les d√©serts o√π il fait froid
Parfois elle pleure quand j'arrive
Et elle rit quand elle s'en va
Si tu t'en vas dans la temp√™te
Si tu t'en vas tu la verras
Dites-lui que je suis comme elle
Que j'aime toujours les chansons
Qui parlent d'amour et d'hirondelles...
translated_poem:
Your girl is crying in the night
Is she wrong or is she right
There's nothing I can do
Your girl is shining in the night
Burning burning burning bright
I don't know what to do
 Tell her that I'm just like her
That I still love those sweet songs
That speak of love and swallow flight
Of heartache, wind, and tender touches
Tell her that she comes to mind
When I hear talk of magnolias
When the new kind of music plays
Roaring like the sound of battle
 Your girl is crying in the night
Is she wrong, is she right
I don't know what to do
 She's so strong that she can break
She was proud, now she's bowed down
Like a love that finally gives way
That snaps when it can no longer bend
You look like her
When she trembles
And in your voice
I sometimes hear
Her voice a bit
She looks like you
When she trembles
When she cries
There in the heart
Of the trees in bloom
 Tell her I'm afraid for her
In basements when all is dark
When the new kind of music plays
Where despair cries out loud
Tell her that she's in my mind
In a vast field of magnolias
And even if all flowers are lovely
I have often, often gotten hurt
Among magnolias by the hundreds
Magnolias like in other days
I don't know what to do
The magnolias are always there
She resembles all the girls
Who fall in love the same way
Whether they're sharp-tongued or shy
Unfortunate violets or magnolias
She loves wide skies full of rain
And deserts where the air is cold
Sometimes she cries when I arrive
And laughs when she's leaving me
If you go away into the storm
If you go you will see her
Tell her that I'm just like her
That I still love the sweet songs
That speak of love and swallow flight...

 Mes amis, j‚Äôai retrouv√©
Aujourd‚Äôhui, ma libert√©

translated_poem:
None of you is in my place
You say, one day there'll be no trace
But that's so simple, easy to say
It's me who has to walk the way
 My friends, today it's come to be
I'm once more set at liberty
But tell me, what's the good of finally being free
When all you have after release
Is only empty memories?
 There's space for two in our old bed
One pillow has the mark of a head
In the place where she should be
There's an absence I can always see
 My friends, today it's come to be
I'm once more set at liberty
But I still love her, and I keep her memory
My broken heart will never mend
Imprisoned still until life's end
 My friends, today it's come to be
I'm once more set at liberty
But tell me, what's the good of finally being free
When all you have after release
Is only empty memories?
 My friends, today it's come to be
I'm once more set at liberty
But I still love her, and I keep her memory
My broken heart will never mend
Imprisoned still until life's end
 My friends, today it's come to be
I'm once more set at liberty
But tell me, what's the good of finally being free
When all you have after release
Is only empty memories?

translated_poem:
Eric, don't tell me you're forgetful
You're rather extraordinary
Don't listen to those who come by
And talk pointlessly
 My name is Eric
I am crazy, crazy, crazy Zazou 1
I've the clothing, clothing, clothing of the mad
They criticise me when I don't do as they want me to
Twelve-tone, people don't like it when it's a lot
Well, I like it in my skin
I don't speak nicely, so I'm bothersome
 Eric, don't tell me you're forgetful
You're rather extraordinary
Don't listen to those who come by
And talk pointlessly
Resist, and do things the way you want
If they were to go outside
Don't listen to their monologues, those useless vultures
 Uncover me, uncover yourself
Of all their ideas that you could go without
Uncover me, uncover yourself
Of all their ideas, made to erase us
 Uncover me, uncover yourself
Of all their ideas that you could go without
Uncover me, uncover yourself
Of all their ideas, made to erase us
 Eric, don't tell me you're forgetful
You're rather extraordinary
Don't listen to those who come by
And talk pointlessly
  1.
'Zazou' could be a potential reference to a youth subculture with WW2 origins in 1940s France. They had bleached long hair, baggy clothing, wide-shoulder coats and shorter skirts and they were often found in jazz venues, all of which was prohibited under Nazi-ruled France. I'm not 100% if the song is based upon this idea however

original_poem:

Une pauvre fille aux grands yeux rougis

 Elle aimait les fleurs, les roses surtout

        Voici des roses blanches

          Va, quand je serai grand
        J'ach√®terai au marchand
        Toutes ses roses blanches
        Pour toi, jolie maman.
 Au printemps dernier, le destin brutal
Vint frapper la blonde ouvri√®re
Elle tomba malade et pour l'h√¥pital
Le gamin vit partir sa m√®re

Sur un march√©, tout tremblant le pauvre mioche
Furtivement vola des fleurs

        Et j'allais voir maman

        L√†-bas elle m'attend

 La marchande √©mue, doucement lui dit :

 Puis √† l'h√¥pital il vint en courant

translated_poem:
He was a kid, a Parisian tyke
His only family was his ma
A po' gal with big eyes, reddened
From sadness and poverty
 She loved flowers, especially roses
And every Sunday, the dear tad
Brought her beautiful white roses
Instead of buying toys
 Hugging her good and tender,
He said as he gave them to her:
 "Today is Sunday
Here you go, my pretty mama
Here are white roses
You who love them so bad
 When I grow up
I'll buy from the merchant
All of his white roses
For you, pretty mama"
 Last spring, a cruel fate
Struck the blonde factory worker
She took sick, and the tyke saw his mother leave for the hospital
 One April morning, among the strollers
Having not a red cent in his pocket
Trembling terribly on a market
The po' kid stole some flowers stealthily
 The merchant caught him
Lowering his head, he said to her:
 "Today is Sunday
√Änd I was gonna see my ma
I took them white roses That she loves so bad
 She's waiting for me
On her li'l white bed, over there
I took them white roses For my pretty ma"
 The moved merchant gently said to him,
"Take them, I'll give them to you"
She kissed him and the child left,
Radiant for being forgiven
 Then he ran to the hospital
To give the flowers to his ma
But when she saw him, a nurse
Whispered to him "You no longer have a ma"
And the tyke kneeling said,
In front of the little white bed:
 "Today is Sunday
Here you go, my pretty mama
Here are white roses
You who loved them so bad
 And when you leave
To the big yard, over there
You'll take all of them White roses with ya"

translated_poem:
Darkest of slumbers
Hits the life of mine:
Go sleep, fine ambers,

translated_poem:
Regardless of what happens, every day
Your gray limousine
Drops you off at the office
At nine o'clock sharp
You enter, with a stern face,
A large glass building
Where buzz
Thousands of telephones
 At night, you sleep without dreams
Thanks to tranquilizers
You can sign your checks
And prepare your balance sheets
Do a little charity
To keep a clear conscience
But above all
You tend to everything
 Hey
Wake on up, Mr. Businessman
It's time
Look at yourself, Mr. Businessman
Your hair is white
 Is this how you waste your life?
Will you have time to visit with your children?
Can you spare an hour in the week
To see how they have grown?
You only know about flowers because your wife
Receives some, sometimes wrapped in cellophane
 Your anger is terrible
But even more so, your calmness
Every month, you do
An electrocardiogram
You have morals
And you can tell right from wrong
Yeah, but for that
You call your lawyers
 Your wife has fur coats
And all her jewelry is real
But you keep the receipts
That you pass off as expenses
Your secretary is stunning
You really want her
But no way
It would cause complications
 You don't dare enjoy earthly pleasures
But one day you will be the dead
The richest one in the cemetery
Hey
Wake on up, Mr. Businessman
It's time
Look at yourself, Mr. Businessman
You're one hundred years old
 Hey, hey, hey
 Hey
Look at yourself, Mr. Businessman
You're one thousand
Wake on up, Mr. Businessman
It's time‚Äîit's still time
 Hey, hey, hey
 Hey
Wake on up, Mr. Businessman
You're one thousand

translated_poem:
If I had a hammer
I'd strike during the day
I'd strike during the night
I'd put all my heart into it
I would build a farm
A barn and a fence
And there, I'd put my father,
My mother, my brothers and my sister
Oh oh, that would be happiness
 If I had a bell
I'd ring it during the day
I'd ring it during the night
I'd put all my heart into it
For the work at dawn
And at night for supper
I would call my father
My mother, my brothers and my sisters
Oh oh, that would be happiness
 If I would have a song
I'd sing it during the day
I'd sing it during the night
I'd put all my heart into it
While turning over the dirt
To lighten our burdens
I'd sing it to my father
My mother, my brothers and my sisters
Oh oh, that would be happiness
 If I had a hammer
And if I had a bell
And if I had a song to sing
I'd be the happiest of men
I would want nothing else
Than a hammer, a bell and a song
For the love of my father
My mother, my brothers and my sisters
Oh oh, that would be happiness
 It's the hammer of courage
It's the bell of freedom
But the song is for my father
My mother, my brothers and my sisters
 Oh oh, for me that's happiness
That is true happiness
That is true happiness
If I had a hammer
If I had a hammer
If I had a hammer

translated_poem:
Just give a chance to our love
Let's forget the bad times and move on
Let's forget our problems
Let's start anew like we used to be
I love you, you're still the same

I was wild, but that was in the past
So come on back to me

Let me talk about your return
Tomorrow, if you're willing to listen to me
We'll have finished crying
So give a chance to our love

Let's start anew like we used to be

Let's forget the bad times and move on...

translated_poem:
In orphanages
There's bells that ring
But don't sing
And tall trees
That stretch their arms so high
But birds don't nest there
 In orphanages
There's also dolls that talk
But them dolls have never said: "Papa... Mama..."
In orphanages
There's walls
As high as the Himalayas
Bars as thick as sequoias
And doors as heavy as three-masted ships
 In orphanages
There's also
Some dolls that dream
But them dolls have never said: "Papa... Mama..."
In orphanages
There's windows where you can't draw
Lawns where you can't walk
And rocks you can't throw
 But in orphanages
There's also
Some dolls that die
Yet them dolls have never said: "Papa... Mama..."
In orphanages,
Like in prisons,
There's white beds with numbers
And dolls lying down that scream in their sleep
shouting, "Papa... Mama..."
 There's tears on the dolls' pillows
For dolls all know how to cry
Oh! Dreams pass by closed eyes
For dolls all know how to dream
Oh! They look up at the sky with crossed hands
As dolls all know how to pray
Them poor dolls could love
And know how to love... to be loved...

translated_poem:
You've got to understand
I would have loved to stay
It's hard for me, too
But love must not stop me
For, you see, I'm not
A lover but a singer
And tomorrow I've got to be elsewhere
 I know I'm wrong
But I can't help it
And I'll regret leaving you all my life
I'll never find happiness like that again
But as far as time will take me:
 When I sing a love song
I'll sing it for you
When I write a love song
It'll only speak of you
Thousands of hearts will hear me
In so many cities and so many times
And thousands of eyes will see me
But they'll only see you
 Don't listen to people who talk about me
About this unhappy loon who loves music more than you
I won't bear it even if you don't love me anymore
Even if you regret knowing me one day
 When I sing a love song
I'll sing it for you
When I write a love song
It'll only speak of you
Thousands of hearts will hear me
In so many cities and so many times
And thousands of eyes will see me
But they'll only see you

translated_poem:
[Female Singer:]
When Life goes how I like it to,
I jump, I laugh, I'm never blue!
But if life sometimes does go wrong,
I don't change my mood, I sing the same song!
 You say, tomorrow, if it's sunny out,
In the park you'll romp about,
You say, when it's your birthday,
It will be grand, come what may!
But if your wish doesn't come true
You get upset and you turn blue,
But please know if not for chance,
Then life would be one dreary dance!
 When Life goes how I want it to,
I jump, I laugh, I'm never blue!
But if life sometimes does go wrong,
I don't change my mood, I sing the same song!

translated_poem:
When I was just a wee little tad, full of health and joy
One day, when I was real good, my daddy brung me something
A marvelous toy,
with big green eyes
I held it in my arms
but when I set it down...
 It went "zip" when it rolled
And "bop" when it turned
And "whirr" when it walked
I never knew just what it was
And I guess I never will
 The first time I turned it over
I had a big surprise
For right on its belly
Were too big golden buttons
I pushed one and then the other, and then pulled them both
But when I set it down again, my eyes nearly popped out of my head
 It marched like a soldier, then suddenly sat down
It marched under a chair and suddenly disappeared under the bed
I started crying and my daddy laughed hearty
For when I turned around, I saw the toy was behind me
 Well, the years have gone by too quick, and yesterday, as it happens,
I found this marvelous toy in the attic
I called my little boy and gave it to him
It was old and rusty, but when we set it down
 It went "zip" when it rolled
And "bop" when it turned
And "whirr" when it walked
I never knew just what it was
And I guess I never will
I never knew just what it was
And I guess I never will

translated_poem:
For bringing our love into the world
And destroying it in a second
Thanks, thanks a lot!
We never really had a fight, you always knew how to keep quiet
Thanks, thanks a lot!
 No one's ever walked out on me
I always leave first
And I was so sure of you
And today you're leaving!
 For bringing our love into the world
And destroying it in a second
Thanks, thanks a lot!
For your sighs and your silences
For your look full of indifference
Thanks, thanks a lot!
Thanks! Thanks!
 You broke something in me
My whole life is called into question
Thanks, thanks a lot!
You stole my most tender words
And now you want to give them back to me
Thanks, thanks a lot!
 I saw your eyes change
I saw your body get colder
And then you pretended
So today, go away!
 You broke something in me
My whole life is called into question
Thanks, thanks for everything!
 Yes, I think that deep down, I'm very lucky
You had taken on too much importance
Thanks, thanks a lot!
 Yes, for bringing our love into the world
And destroying it in a second
Thanks, thanks a lot!
We never really had a fight
You always knew how to keep quiet
Thanks, thanks a lot!

translated_poem:
To skip school
I would do anything
To skip school
I would even...
 Walk around the house
In my PJs, to catch a cold
Eat a slice of bread with tar
To get a stomach ache
 Do my compulsory service
Cross the English Channel in a swim ring
Tickle a panther
Pee on a policeman
 To skip school
I would do anything
To skip school
I would even...
 Become a magician
To make myself disappear
Pray that the Martians
Abduct me to their planet
 Take my little sister hostage
Finish my brussels sprouts
Eat colored pencils
To vomit rainbows
 To skip school
I would do anything
To skip school
I would even...
 Unarmed against a gladiator
I would be ready to fight
Imitate stuntmen
Hope to end up in a plaster cast
 Swallow two hundred slugs
To scare off the teachers
Blow up the classroom
With a dynamite
 To skip school
I would do anything
To skip school
I would even...
To skip school
I would do anything
To skip school
I would even...
 For me, it is worse than jail
And when he invented it
The naughty Charlemagne
Should have stayed in bed
 Don't count on me, guys!
It's great, but go without me
Yes, I had that crazy idea
One day, to start skipping school
 We don't want to go
We would rather stay in bed
Hands up, naughty bunny
The teacher in a bikini
 We don't want to go
We would rather stay in bed
The notebooks on fire
The teacher on the pyre
 Live in the toilet
Taunt a bear into a duel
Swallow a clarinet
Or repaint the Eiffel Tower
 Drink expired coke
To get pimples
Eat butter all day long
End up as big as a truck
 Sing Lorie songs in latin
Take a six-month-long nap
Eat the dog's food
Learn the directory in Chinese
 Breathe once every other time
Wash up with bleach
Stop blinking forever
Torture Santa Claus
 To skip school
I would do anything
To skip school
I would even...
To skip school
I would do anything
To skip school
I would even go...
 There!

translated_poem:
Long ago in the days of kings
It was in London on a cold morning
On an old bridge, an old woman cried
About the fate of her son Geordie
 Oh, my Geordie will be hanged tomorrow at dawn
Will be hanged with a golden chain
He will die for having loved
Loved the king's daughter
 For nights and days,
I walked a long time
I don't remember how many days
To get to the court of London
To plead the case of my Geordie
 Oh, my Geordie never stole or killed
He is so young, he is a child
Take my life, I'm an old woman
But spare that of my Geordie
 The judge looked over his shoulder
He said: Brave lady, I'm sorry
He said: Brave lady, you should leave
Because I can't do anything for your Geordie
 Oh, my Geordie will be hanged tomorrow at dawn
Will be hanged with a golden chain
He will die for having loved
Loved the king's daughter

translated_poem:
She is there, silent, sitting in an armchair in the dead of night
Her eyes fixed on her hands,
I know that she's thinking of him
That she wishes I were far away to be out of this place
In another bed
I want to tell her that I have understood for a long time now
But I'm afraid that's precisely what she's waiting for
That she might take advantage of a single word to leave me on the spot
 So I put on a stone face
I don't talk about anything
I wait, unhappy in my corner
For her besottedness to pass
 One has to know to pretend not to know
And pretend to believe it's still possible
When, what is your whole life
Is already halfway over
You have to know to pretend not to know
Not give anything away in a look
You have to know how to gain time
By letting others pretend
To give yourself a little hope
You have to know to pretend not to know
 I understand that I no longer have the impulses that used to amaze her
That I don't even take the time to talk to her anymore
That I make love to her too much without thinking about loving her
Without looking at her
In a way, the other man
Makes her feel like a woman again
He knows how to make her forget that time condemns her
That the most beautiful of flowers wilts one fine morning
 Should we take a trip like nothing has happened?
A hotel, a beach
And maybe, who knows...
 Yes, one has to know to pretend not to know
And pretend to believe it's still possible
When, what is your whole life
Is already halfway over
You have to know to pretend not to know
Not give anything away in a look
You have to know how to gain time
By letting others pretend
To give yourself a little hope
You have to know to pretend not to know
 One has to know to pretend not to know
And pretend to believe it's still possible
When, what is your whole life
Is already halfway over
You have to know to pretend not to know
Not give anything away in a look
You have to know how to gain time
By letting others pretend...

The only opportunity to buy a commemorative token of the event

Sisi, really mothering, who is babying Prince Rodolphe
And this, how charming
Christmas with the family
On the edge of some golf courses

The lovebirds, who are in love like never before

Our Elisabeth praying in the palace chapel

From the imperial journeys?

But what she was

She was often hated
100 years after her death
Her life would be kept, the
Kitsch!
Kitsch!
Kitsch!

She was proving to Sophie
That she had all the powers
And also no fucks to give
Once the war was won
Goodbye son

A bank account in Switzerland
 But her legend doesn't matter
From now what subsists
The high and the shitty
The real, the fake, the sad, the
Kitsch!

Kitsch!
 Kitsch!

translated_poem:
[Lucheni]
The same year, in front of Bad Ischl. The Emperor of Austria meets Helene, our princess1 of petty nobility. Why? The mothers decided it, they arranged a meeting, far from Vienna, at the foot of the Alps, ah, why not?1
 Summer in Bad Ischl is paradise on earth

Sophie has explained to her sister what she must do
But it all turns into a nightmare
 [Sophie]
Why so late?
 [Ludovika]
It was so terrible out
We wanted to take a nap
 [Sophie]
No way, you're crazy
He awaits you at 4 o'clock
 [Helene]
What?
 [Sophie]
What does Helene look like?
 [Ludovika]
Max thanks you for excusing him
But, well, I've brought Sisi
 [Sophie]
The dress is not suitable
And the hairdo is worse
 [Helene]
I'll change
 [Sophie]
No, it's too late
One does not make the Emperor wait!
 [Lucheni]
All our projects
And even the most cunning
Are only built on wind
And one can never count on anything
Except if it's to end up
Still losing
 Ah, what a beautiful project1
Would be a beautiful thing, but 1
Attention, ladies and gentlemen1
Except if it's to end up
Still losing
Ah-ha! Asshole! But what the fuck are you doing? 1

The young Emperor is quiet

 [Sophie]

 [Sophie]

Like a fresh almond

 [Sophie]

I'll only dance...
 [Ludovika]

... at the ball ...
 [Sophie]
Yes?

With her

She pleases him
 [Sophie]
Go ask her
Get up
Go towards her
Take her in your arms!
 [Ludovika]
What?!

Her?!
 [Lucheni]
All our projects
And even the most cunning
Are only built on wind
And one can never count on anything
Except if it's to end up
Still losing
 [Helene]
Three years of work
Infinite detail
Three years that I fought
 [Helene, Sophie and Ludovika]
Three years of complaints
Of efforts and obligation
For nothing
All that for nothing
 [Lucheni, Helene, Sophie and Ludovika]
All our projects
And even the most cunning
Are only built on wind

Still losing
 [Lucheni]
And one can never count on anything

translated_poem:
It's a love song, written in France
A melody on which I met you
You spoke to me of English records
I taught you "Speak to Me of Love"
Since then, girl from France, you've understood
That not everything from across the Channel is gold
Since that day, Autumn falls and white roses are love songs
You are the sun of Midi,
the scent of Normandy
The taste of good wine, the taste of life
 You are beautiful and kindly like a French song
You are simple and gentle like a French song
Drop-dead slender and romantic
You sing when everything's going badly
You always find a tune
That says in life you shouldn't worry
 Yes, you are proud and tender like a French song
You have the good sense and heart of a French song
Yes, most as beautiful and faithful
As traditional
As an evergreen song
You make love like in French songs
 Fog and rain, one winter night
I see ourselves in a car, a-racing toward Paris
You keep me warm
And to drive
I cut on the radio so's not to fall asleep
But close to Senlis
The road is slick
It's a downpour, quick, we need to find shelter
I had barreled
Under the lightning
Suddenly, we were all alone on Earth
Under an Italian poplar
That served as a lightning rod
You became my most beautiful chorus
 You are beautiful and kindly like a French song
You are simple and gentle like a French song
Drop-dead slender and romantic
You sing when everything's going badly
You always find a tune
That says in life you shouldn't worry
 Yes,
You are proud and tender like a French song
You have the good sense and heart of a French song
Yes, most as beautiful and faithful
As traditional
As an evergreen song
You make love like in French songs

translated_poem:
I do know the sound of each stone
I love (the things) from what others run away
From this dazzling kingdom, I threw away the key
And only my kinds are admitted here
 Nature sings in the same chord
For me it's life, for others death
Everything has been planned out, balanced
In my fascinating kingdom
 Like the oak grows into the soil
To stay alive, me, I live alone
My universe is lonely
On this earth, me, I live alone
 I have seen your world with my own eyes
Everything is way too dangerous, too hurtful
I have known pain, the true false friends
But here, I live without concession
 Like the oak grows into the soil
To stay alive, me, I live alone
My universe is lonely
On this earth, me, I live alone
 On this earth, me, I live alone
On this earth, me, I live alone

translated_poem:
Stay, stay with me
I need you, just like you need me
Stay, stay, dontcha leave
You'd almost regret it as much as I would
 When I hear the door close behind you
When I hear your footsteps fade away in the distance
I suddenly feel completely lost
My mind's empty, and my heart's heavy
 I know pretty well, I got my fault
I don't always know how to say the right things
I'm hardly attentive
Maybe you're afraid of not bein' loved
 But I love you, yes, I love you
Even if I don't admit it
Except when I'm alone and thinkin' of you
 Stay, stay with me
I need you, just like you need me
Stay, stay, dontcha leave
You'd almost regret it as much as I would
 Often, I see you with that sorry look
And I'm dyin' to comfort you
To open my arms, to take your hand
But it's my pride that holds me back
 Livin' together is difficult
It feels like we're walkin' on a tightrope
It only takes a tiny thing
And a smile can turn into sadness
 But I love you, yeah, I love you
Even if I don't admit it
Except when I'm alone and thinkin' of you
 Stay, stay with me
I need you, just like you need me
Stay, stay, dontcha leave
You'd almost regret it as much as I would
 Stay, stay with me
I need you, just like you need me
Stay, stay, dontcha leave

It's been quite many seasons since we saw each other last

Months and weeks went by, and I had lost hope of seeing you again

As true as I love you and we'll love each other
As true as time slips away from our grasp
As true as rain draws lines through my life
Yes, my love, never anything will ever separate us again
As true as I love you and we'll love each other
As true as tonight, you'll be close to me, close to me
 I've relived all the moments of past days through memories
With emptiness in my heart and your absence at my fingertips
I thought back to our love, and all the words we exchanged
Misunderstandings are over‚Äîtonight, everything will start again

As true as time slips away from our grasp
As true as rain draws lines through my life

As true as I love you and we'll love each other
As true as time slips away from our grasp
As true as rain draws lines through my life

As true as I love you and we'll love each other
As true as tonight, you'll be close to me, close to me

translated_poem:
I met her in the street
Like half-naked
She's not the kind of woman
To let people walk all over her
I said: ''Buy me a whisky''
She answered: ''Yes''
But to be in her bed
She said no
 I lack the vocabulary needed
For this kind of stuff
Grandpa's smooth talk
Gets up my nose
I asked her to be part of my life
She said yes
But to be in my bed
She said no
 One evening, she had drunk
A little too much
I ended up naked
She was on the top
She said: ''Let's get married''
I said yes being in her bed
But at the town hall
I said no
 I said no

Being the plaything of a handful of rich folk

What‚Äôs making dresses for ambassadors‚Äô wives‚Äô dresses,

translated_poem:
August and consoling image,
Liberty, descends from the skies;
Show us, as in the earliest age.
A calm and radiant brow.
Liberty, holy Liberty,
Watch forever over our homeland,
And be, down here, all of our gods. (repeat)
 Come, let your beauty console us
From an odious sight;
Reign in place of the idol
That dishonored this places.
Liberty, holy Liberty
Watch forever over this enclosure
And be, down here, all of our gods. (repeat)
 False flashes of light that surround
The kings to deceive our eyes
Imposing pomp, splendor of the throne
Goodbye, shameful memories!
Liberty, holy Liberty,
Watch forever over this enclosure
And be, down here, all of our gods. (repeat)

original_poem:
Dieu du peuple et des rois, des cit√©s, des campagnes,
De Luther, de Calvin, des enfants d'Isra√´l,
Dieu que le gu√®bre honore au pied de ses montagnes,

 Ici sont rassembl√©s sous ton regard immense
De l'empire fran√ßais les fils et les soutiens,

√âgaux √† leurs yeux comme aux tiens.
 Soleil qui parcourant ta route accoutum√©e,

Qui versant des torrents de lumi√®re enflamm√©e,
M√ªris nos fertiles moissons.
 Feu pur, ≈ìil √©ternel, √¢me et ressort du monde,

translated_poem:
God of the people and the kings, of the cities and the fields,
Of Luther, of Calvin, of the children of Israel,
God whom the Zoroastrian honor at the foot of his mountains
By invoking the star of the sky!
 Here they are gathered under your immense gaze
From the French Empire, his sons and supporters,
Celebrating before you their nascent happiness,
Equal in their eyes as in yours.
 Sun that follows your accustomed route,
Gives, takes away the day, and rule the seasons:
Who, pouring torrents of fiery light,
Ripens our fertile harvests.
 Pure fire, eternal eye, soul and spring of the world,
May you admire from the French their splendor!
May you see nothing, in your fecund course;
That is equal to their greatness!

But my heart
Is nothing but an empty house

translated_poem:
Your parents left you all alone, not even a tear to dedicate to them
In the dorm, the others yell, already a trimester passed
The others go out on Sundays, much too far to be able to return
You're already on the board, you take your momentum to jump
To jump
To jump
 Your parents left you all alone, child too hard to support
You're crazy that the others are screaming, you've learned to isolate yourself
But you don't think about Sundays anymore, the pool is not finished
You already see yourself on the board, no water but you're going to jump
You're going to jump
You're going to jump
Jump
 You left your parents all alone with their tears to cry
To finish their life in a pool where I want to swim for fun
I want to swim for fun
For fun
For fun
For fun
For fun
For fun
For fun
For fun
I want to swim for fun
Swim for fun

translated_poem:
A train ticket crumpled in a pocket
With, in a hand, a pocketbook
She's only eighteen, a big suitcase
Blue eyes on a train that approaches
A train that leaves is a little like a home
A train that leaves
For those who have never known home
A train that leaves
 A train that leaves is a little like a song
A train that leaves
For those who have never heard songs sung
Upon it's departure
 The train beats the countryside taking it to Paris
What can she do to earn her living?
She doesn't know much, she has never done much
Except from leaving what she loved
 A train that leaves is a little like a home
A train that leaves
For those who have never known home
A train that leaves
 A train that leaves is a little like a song
A train that leaves
For those who have never heard songs sung
Upon it's departure
 A train that leaves is also the train of hope
A train that leaves
For those who are going to find another
Who is waiting for them in front of the train station
 A train that leaves is a little like their song
A train that leaves
Where everything stops and starts, like romance
In a train station

translated_poem:
As if a wondrous voice from afar is calling me,
Gardens, mountain stones, greenery, water, and ride the rainbow
 Get there and take it!
Call by waving your hand
Believe in the magic land and I will believe with you
I will stay
I will be by your side
If your imagination is free, don't back down and follow me
 On this path, we are lucky
We don't need to ever give up
I found strength in myself believing in fairy tales
And there is a place for you
Take my hand if you like!
 I need you
You will show me the way
I see a shelter in you
We will go hand in hand
I will follow you
You will show me the way
To this magic land
You will show me the way
 Get there and take it!
Call by waving your hand
Believe in the magic land and I will believe with you
I will stay
I will be by your side
If your imagination is free, don't back down and follow me

translated_poem:
(I would have never thought)
You and I, we're like chalk and cheese
In our hearts, in our eyes
I would have never thought
I'd be losing you slowly
You and I, we're like chalk and cheese
In joy and fire
But sometimes we get lost
And then farewell to light
 I have been thinking for some time now how
We create distance between each other
Tick tock, start the countdown
See what of love is left for us
 Look at that face
Your black look that is killing me
We used to love each other, what a pity
No, don't be disappointed
When the rain and storm come
Our words are stray bullets
Never will I forget the image of you
And everything we've lived together
 How we attract each other, we oppose each other
How to say all these things to each other
Just like in the first silent films, unwillingly
Only tantrums, it is customary
See the brakes screeching to damage
The shouting, the cries, in pain,
Hit us like uppercuts
 I have been thinking for some time now how
We create distance between each other
Tick tock, start the countdown
See what of love is left for us
 Look at that face
Your black look that is killing me
We used to love each other, what a pity
No, don't be disappointed
When the rain and storm come
Our words are stray bullets
Lead us in the end to wreck
Though we fought well
 I never saw, I never saw...
And I am dancing on that hope that is collapsing
I never saw, I never ever saw
That we used to be a whole world
 You and I, we're like chalk and cheese
In our hearts, in our eyes
I never saw
The goodbyes coming
 Look at that face
Your black look that is killing me
We used to love each other, what a pity
No, don't be disappointed
When the rain and storm come
Our words are stray bullets
Never will I forget the image of you
And everything we've lived together (don't be disappointed)
 No, don't be disappointed.

I don't have a heart in my body
I don't have a heart in my
I don't have a heart in my body

You can't tell the sun to let up
Nor the waves of the ocean to freeze
Like the harvest fly that sings but doesn't work
I can't be both a wolf and a dog
 Hey! Ho! That's not how the ball bounces
If you want to call the tune, you hafta pay the piper
Hey! Ho! That's not how the ball bounces
If you want to love, first things first agree to the terms
 Like the orange whose peel is tossed into the water
Take my qualities and forget all of my faults
If you pick the flowers to make a bouquet
You'll never reap the fruit in the summer
 Hey! Ho! That's not how the ball bounces
If you want to call the tune, you hafta pay the piper
Hey! Ho! That's not how the ball bounces
If you want to love, first things first agree to the terms
 But you know I only live for you
You know I only live to love you
I'd sell my soul without regret
For a cracked smile from ya
 Like the bird that sings best when it's loose,
I need to live without doubts or regrets
Give me time to learn to love only you
No, I won't be both a wolf and a dog

translated_poem:
By the time I arrive in Lyon, she'll be waking up
She'll find the words I left on the door
She'll laugh when she reads that I walked out on her again
Because I already left her so many times before
 By the time I arrive in Valence, she'll be working
She'll undoubtedly start to worry about my silence
And she'll call me up
But all she'll hear
Will be the sound of the phone ringing, ringing, ringing again
 By the time I arrive in Marseilles, she'll be sleeping
She'll toss and turn in bed, searching for sleep
And she'll call me up again, she'll shout, she'll even cry
As she realizes that I truly left her
Even though sometimes I tried to make her understand,
often
She didn't believe that one day I'd truly walk away
I'd truly walk away
I'd truly walk away
I'd truly walk away

translated_poem:
A li'l backwater a ways out from the city
A wild road beneath a peaceful sky
And at the end of this path, a big gateway
I push the gate and suddenly
A big house at the end of an alley
A big abandoned house
And then on the door, a small sign
Where "For rent" is written
 Even if you came back
I don't think it'd change anything
Our love is dead forever
I'd suffer too much if you came back
 The wind has risen, and upstairs on second floor
This shutter that's banging still won't close
This creaky shutter was hiding our love
You promised me, but one day
One day like any other, I waited for you
'Til the morning light, but you never came
Months have gone by, and
against my will, I keep on waiting
I'm still waiting for you, and yet
 Even if you came back
I don't think it'd change anything
Our love is dead forever
I'd suffer too much if you came back
 Even if you came back
I don't think it'd change anything
Our love is dead forever
I'd suffer too much if you came back
 Even if you came back
I don't think it'd change anything
Our love is dead forever
I'd suffer too much if you came back

translated_poem:
The curtain has fallen for the hundredth time
In my deserted dressing room, it's only me left
Just me who's looking at myself in front of this mirror
Like a tired clown, a child in the dark
 And I listen to the crowd leaving into the night
These girls and boys who go back to their lives
They take their stock of dreams with them
Without knowing that it's a little of me dying
 Loneliness comes after, yes, after
When the artificial suns have faded
When everything cuts off
In the morning
And that the spotlights
Die
Loneliness comes after, yes, after
Loneliness comes after, yes, after
 This cold bar where we meet up
With all my friends there on my tab
This girl who swears we met
In Dover, where I'm sure I've never been
 And the deserted house, and then the last glass
Where I see the images of yesterday go by
Lying in the dark
I listen to the silence
I don't know why I think about my childhood
 Loneliness comes after, yes, after
When the artificial suns have faded
When everything cuts off
In the morning
And that the spotlights
Die
 Loneliness comes after, yes, after
Loneliness comes after, yes, after
When everything cuts off
In the morning
And that the spotlights
Die
Loneliness comes after, yes, after
Loneliness comes after, always after
 Loneliness comes after, yes, after
Loneliness comes after, always after

original_poem:
Combien faut-il de rivi√®res et de montagnes

 Plus je t'appelle, et moins je te vois,

Et plus je t'aime chaque fois
 Mon c≈ìur s'arr√™te maintenant
Devant un mur de ciment
Devant ton c≈ìur indiff√©rent
Et je me demande,
Et je te demande :
 Combien faut-il de rivi√®res et de montagnes
Pour une nuit, pour un matin?
Combien faut-il d'Angleterre ou bien d'Espagne
Pour un seul geste de tes mains?
 Plus je t'appelle, et moins je te vois,
Plus tu es belle, et moins tu me crois
Et plus je t'aime chaque fois
 Je veux me battre comme un fou
Contre ton c≈ìur et pour nous
Malgr√© ces rivi√®res entre nous
Il faut que je gagne
Contre des montagnes
 Oui, je veux te prendre comme la fleur au printemps
Et je veux t'entendre crier mon nom dans le vent
Mais comment faire ? Combien faudra-t-il de temps ?
Combien de rivi√®res, et combien de torrents ? Oh oui... oh...oh.. oh...
 Mon c≈ìur s'arr√™te maintenant
Devant un mur de ciment
Malgr√© ces rivi√®res entre nous
Il faut que je gagne contre des montagnes
translated_poem:
How many rivers and mountains does it take
To get into your arms?
How much of England or Spain does it take
To fall asleep next to you?
 The more I call you, the less I see you,
The more beautiful you are, the less you believe me
The more I love you every time
 My heart stops now
In front of a cement wall
In front of your indifferent heart
And I ask you,
I ask you:
 How many rivers and mountains
For a night, for a day?
How much of England or Spain does it take
For a single move of your hand?
 The more I call you, the less I see you,
The more beautiful you are, the less you believe me
And the more I love you every time
 I want to fight like a madman
against your heart and for us
Despite those rivers between us
I must win out
Over the mountains
 Yes, I want to take you
Like a flower in spring
I want to hear you cry
My name in the wind
But how to do it? How much time would it take?
How many rivers, and how many torrents? Oh yes... oh... oh... oh...
 My heart stops now
In front of a cement wall
In front of your indifferent heart
I must win out
Over the mountains

original_poem:
Ravale tes mots, toutes tes syllabes sonnent faux
Car mentir, quoi qu'on en dise, √ßa s'apprend plus que √ßa ne s'improvise
√îtes ton masque, ta cr√©dibilit√© se d√©traque
Ton attitude respire l'hypocrisie
 Tu t'es disqualifi√© d'avance au milieu de ton inconsistance
Travestir son apparence c'est p√©rilleux, il faut avoir de l'assurance
Il n'est pas si √©vident d'avoir l'air
 Ne soit pas fier, tu ne poss√®des rien de sinc√®re
Ton personnage est fictif, il n'√©voque rien d'autre que l'artifice
Tes mises en sc√®ne n'en valent pas la peine
A aucun succ√®s tu n'aspires, fais le deuil de tes d√©sirs
 Tu t'es disqualifi√© d'avance au milieu de ton inconsistance
Cultiver les dissonances, jeu dangereux demandant de l'assurance
Car perdre toutes ses chances c'est douloureux, tu en fais l'exp√®rience
Travestir son apparence c'est p√©rilleux, en soi il faut avoir confiance
 Il n'est pas si √©vident d'avoir l'air
D'√™tre en accord avec ce que l'on v√©hicule
Para√Ætre fort gommer toute trace de calcul

translated_poem:
Debase your words, all your syllables sound fake
Because lying, whatever one may say, can be learned more than improvised
Take off your mask, your credibility detracts
Your attitude breaths hypocrisy
 You disqualify yourself from advancing to the medium of your inconstancy
To disguise its appearance is perilous, it is necessary to have assurance
It is not so evident to appear
 Don't be proud, you possess nothing sincere
Your character is fictional, it does not evoke nothing other than artifice
Your stage productions1 are not worth it
To no success you aspire, mourn of your desires
 You disqualify yourself from advancing to the medium of your inconstancy
To cultivate the dissonances, a dangerous game asking of assurance
Because losing all of your chances, it's dangerous, You make the experience of it
To disguise its appearance, its perilous, its necessary to have confidence in one's self
 It is not so evident to appear
To be in agreement with what one conveys
To appear strong, to erase all trace of calculations
But one can not save a very natural air
Without conserving a part of their self
 Don't try to appear
  1.
"mises en sc√®ne" = plays; stage productions

translated_poem:
You can't tell the sun not to shine
Nor the waves of the sea not to roll
Like the grasshopper who sings and doesn't work
I can't be both a wolf and a dog
 Hey! ho! it can't be done
If you want to dance, you have to pay the piper
Hey! ho! it can't be done
If you want to love, know the terms of the deal
 Like the orange whose peel is discarded
Take my good points, forget all my faults
If you pick the flowers to make a bouquet

translated_poem:
Erase the word "Impossible" from your vocabulary and don't give up
On your objective, don't stray from it
Nothing is certain, the wheel turns and that's when
The situation can change
 Overcome the challenges, break down the doors
Sneak out or go out the hard way
Go to the front, step up, alone or with an escort
Reach your goal before the Grim Reaper takes you away
Unlock the padlocks, break the chains
It's not really a big deal to dive into the arena
It's not enough to triumph in one battle to win the war
But, if it's worth it and if every work deserves a pay
Travel a lot because a rolling stone gathers no moss
Be reliable, fight your fears or run if you're scared to death
Openly or on the sly, come back in the race
Beware the vultures who count their chickens before they hatch
A well organized charity often starts with oneself
So, if the tide turns, don't hesitate, reap what you sowed
Because when the rats leave the ship, it often means trouble
Even alone in the world, remember that light sometimes stems from the shadows
Look at yourself in a mirror, the truth is in the back of the eyes
You don't believe me? It's alright, forewarned is forearmed
Anyways, you can't teach an old dog new tricks
It's natural to dedicate this chorus to the bottom of the class
 Erase the word "Impossible" from your vocabulary and don't give up
On your objective, don't stray from it
Nothing is certain, the wheel turns and that's when
The situation can change
(x2)
 You dream of becoming an astronaut or a paleontologist
Of fishing on the Amazon River on a boat
Of rapping better than Snoop Doggy Dogg
Of working as a gynecologist or just of having a job
You like, that lets you dream
You would like to be amazed, to enjoy your nights and days
You confide in your bed pillow, you learned
To walk, what stops you from flying?
The treasure lies inside you, not in the banks
Even if you live on unearned income, put some work in your life
Focused, explore enchanted trails
In danger, it will only create
Passions to share, questions without answers
To ask oneself, the opportunity to think with a clear head
You are not obligated to take what was given to you
To adhere to the routine that was suggested to you
 Erase the word "Impossible" from your vocabulary and don't give up
On your objective, don't stray from it
Nothing is certain, the wheel turns and that's when
The situation can change
(x2)

translated_poem:
And I love you so much
They ask me how
I could live alone
I tell them : I don't know
Time has passed
Things have changed
And I don't really know
Where I'm at today.
 I do know how cruel life is
Your shadow chases me
The hours are endless
Even nights
Don't leave me alone
Since they saw you in town
 And you don't love me anymore
And you don't think about it anymore
And you forgot about me
Dead and buried
You turned the page
The book has closed
No, I don't really know
Where I'm at today.
 I do know how cruel life is
Your shadow chases me
The hours are endless
Even nights
Don't leave me alone
Since they saw you in town
 And I love you so much
They ask me how
I could live alone
I tell them : I don't know

translated_poem:
A noise opens my eyes, the telephone rings
We need ya, says the buzzin' voice
With heavy eyelids, I jump outta bed (Ah!)
 I have my coffee, take a shower and leave,
I look at the time, I'm already late
In the icy wind, I flag down a cab,
And I hustle, hustle
 And I'm hustlin', hustlin'
What am I hustlin' for?
I'd sure like to be told one day
What I'm hustlin' for
Yeah, I'm hustlin', hustlin'
Yeah, I'm always/still hustlin'
I'd sure like to be told one day
What I'm hustlin' for
 Noon at a restaurant, I'd like to sit
but there's so many folks that I gotta park myself at the bar
They take my order and keep me waitin' three quarters of an hour (Ah!)
 When I'm finally waited on, I've only just started than
A meeting's a-waitin' for me, and I gotta go
I finish my glass and call out for the tab
Hustlin', 'cause I hustle, hustle
 And I'm hustlin', hustlin'
What am I hustlin' for?
I'd sure like to be told one day
What I'm hustlin' for
Yeah, I'm hustlin', hustlin'
Yeah, I'm always hustlin'
I'd sure like to be told one day
What I'm hustlin' for
 Tonight at home, there's some friends over
You told me, for once, please be specific,
You gotta be ballistic that I'm not here yet (Oh boy!)
I leave the office nervous and tired,
Y'all will be at dessert when I arrive,
I got a hunch, you're gonna gimme hell when I get home!!
And I hustle, hustle
 And I'm hustlin', hustlin'
What am I hustlin' for?
I'd sure like to be told one day
What I'm hustlin' for
Yeah, I'm hustlin', hustlin',
Yeah, I'm always hustlin'
I'd sure like to be told one day
What I'm hustlin' for
 Oh, I'm hustlin', hustlin'
What I'm hustlin' for?
I'd sure like to be told one day
What am I hustlin' for
Oh, I'm hustlin, hustlin'
What am I hustlin' for?

translated_poem:
I never had a red ball
When I was a kid in my neighborhood
In those provinces where nothing happens
All my ball were busted
I never had a real vacation
Alone, face to face with the sea
When the heart beats the rhythm
Of seagulls swimming in the air
 I asked for nothing, I got nothing
I gave nothing, I received nothing
 I never shot marbles
When I was a kid in my neighborhood
I was stuck in my family
Like a martyr to their stake
I never went on a walk
Alone, face to face with the wind
I read Marquis de Sade
And I already liked couches
 I asked for nothing, I got nothing
I gave nothing, I received nothing
 The fairies didn't come along
When I was a kid in my neighborhood
They lived off of their advantages
They were all unionized
I didn't see in the stars
Cinderella's carriage
My Cinderella had a dirty dress
But she didn't have vair heels
 I asked for nothing, I got nothing
I gave nothing, I received nothing
 Yet I already had the luck,
As a kid in my neighborhood,
To not attach importance
To what others thunk
And I didn't see in history
Any warrior or any king
Thirsty for power or glory
Who was more proud than me
 I asked for nothing, I got.nothing
But I did... what I wanted..

translated_poem:
Your sweet melody wakes me up every morning
Even before I kiss my wife, I hold you in my hand
I touch your screen to check if everything's good
We're inseparable, even when I go to the commode
We share my coffee and orange juice with my friends
When I drive, I look into your screen, so I run a few stoplights
At work, we talk so much that I forget some files
During supper, my family loves you, baby, 'cause there's silence when you're around
 I share my life with you instead of living it
You share others' lives with me to entertain me
Since your apps have hogged my eyes, baby, I don't look at the sky anymore
I don't know how to live without you by my side
Your pixelated screen has captivated me, you, my precious, my precious, my precious
My precious, my precious, my precious
When you ring or start vibrating
I lose my mind, how could I ever leave you?
You, my precious, my precious, my precious
My precious, my precious, my precious
 You have a new message.
You're my secretary, you manage my schedule
You lighten up my brain with your notifications.
I don't need to physically check up on my family since I can follow them on you
To show them that I love them, I just have to like their photos
Why go to concerts when you have everything on YouTube?
You help me consume by only talking to me through ads
I don't pay attention to spelling since I talk to you with my fingers
My kids prefer playing with you, baby, over sliding on the playground
 I share my life with you instead of living it
You share others' lives with me to entertain me
Since your apps have hogged my eyes, baby, I don't look at the sky anymore
I don't know how to live without you by my side
Your pixelated screen has captivated me, you, my precious, my precious, my precious
My precious, my precious, my precious
When you ring or start vibrating
I lose my mind, how could I ever leave you?
You, my precious, my precious, my precious
My precious, my precious, my precious
 But now I'm going crazy
I feel like my heart rate slows down
I have no more reference points, I'm lost
Since you ran out of battery
Oh oh
Oh oh
Oh oh
Oh oh
 My precious, my precious, my precious
My precious, my precious, my precious
My precious, my precious, my precious
My precious, my precious, my precious

translated_poem:
I rise
And I jostle you
You don't wake at all
Just as usual
 Over you
I pull up the sheet
Afraid that you'll be cold
Just as usual
 My hand
Strokes across your hair
Almost against my will
Just as usual
 But you
You turn your back to me
Just as usual
 And then
I dress as fast as I can
I go out of the room
Just as usual
 Alone
I drink my coffee black
Already running late
Just as usual
 Noiseless
I go out of the house
Everything's gray outside
Just as usual
 I'm cold
I turn my collar up
Just as usual
 Just as usual
All throughout the day
I'll play the game
Of making things look good
 Just as usual
I'll find a smile
Yes, just as usual
I'll even laugh
Just as usual
In short, I'll live on
Yes, just as usual
 And then
The day will end at last
I'll go home again
Just as usual
 You
You will have gone out
And not be back yet
Just as usual
 Alone
I will go lie down
In that big, cold bed
Just as usual
 My tears
I won't let them show
Just as usual
 Just as usual
Even at night
I'll play the game
Of making things look good
 Just as usual
You will come home
Just as usual
I will be there
Just as usual
You will smile at me
Yes, just as usual
 Just as usual
You'll take off your clothes
Just as usual
You'll get into bed
Yes, just as usual
We'll exchange a kiss
Just as usual
 Just as usual
We'll make things look good
Yes, just as usual
We will still make love
Yes, just as usual
We'll make things look good
Yes, just as usual...

translated_poem:
Lost love, lost love
Will come.back to us like spring
Lost love, lost love
Will come back to us stronger than before
 I challenge the old proverb
Which says that lost love never returns
We can say, maintaining the verb
Lost love will return to us bigger
 I hope wholeheartedly that poets
Won't exclude me from their ring
But soon our hearts will be rejoicing
When our love returns to us bigger
 Lost love, lost love
Will come back to us like spring
Lost love, lost love
Will come back to us stronger than before
 For me, the rule proves the exception
But grammar sees some disadvantages in it
So I made a wise decision
I use the verb "to love" in all tenses
 Maybe I'm unforgivable
Among the disappointed and resigned lovers
But I'm not comforted
By a love found again on the street
 Lost love, lost love
Will return to us like spring
Lost love, lost love
Will come back to us stronger than before

translated_poem:
I live in my era, now free
In charge, a woman of today
I see a man that I like
I tell him, I want to know him and then that's it
And I cry out, man, I love you, I love you, man
And I cry out, man, I want to know you
I want to know you only one night
 Come into my era
My mysterious, mysterious era
Come into my era
My era as a free woman, free woman
Come into my era
My era as a woman in charge, hey hey
Come into my era
 If I call don't be afraid of me, I'm a rebellious woman
If I call don't be afraid of me, I'm a woman
I'm in my era here so come dance with me
I'm in my era now so let me love you, man
 Come into my era
My mysterious, mysterious era
Come into my era
My era as a woman in charge, hey hey
Come into my era
 Hey, I don't want the 1950s, I close the door on those years
I broke the barriers, I don't wanna go back
You shouted sir, I shouted madam, answer me
The tables are clean between us
In my era there is no memory
I'm afraid to go back and you need love
In your era and my intimacy, hey hey
 If I call out don't be afraid of me, I'm a rebellious woman
If I call out don't be afraid of me, I'm a woman that's all
 Come into my era
I'm afraid to go back and you need love
In your time and my intimacy, hey hey
Come into my era
I'm afraid to go back and you need love
In your time and my intimacy, hey hey
 Come into my era
My mysterious, mysterious era
Come into my era
My era as a woman in charge, hey hey
Come into my era

Le reste fait partie de mes choix

translated_poem:
The words are the liar's weapon
My ego likes so much that we flatter it
The details are sometimes on the rise1
Our flaws are long-standing friends2
 And yet I am called, Rock Rock Rock
It's the name that one gives me, Rock Rock Rock
 I would like to free the mind
From all which hides my view
From all which conditions my life
I will know to find my way out
 That's why one calls me, Rock Rock Rock
In my head it resonates, Rock Rock Rock
 Two things that I did not choose
My name and the background3 of where I am
The rest is part of my choices
The rest must leave in fragments
 To finally feel myself live
Finally to feel myself free
 Be proud of this name, Rock Rock Rock
And raise your forehead high, Rock Rock Rock
  1.
"prendre de l'ampleur" = to be on the rise; increase; gather pace
2.
"de longue date" = long-standing
3.
"milieu" can be translated as environment,setting,medium, or background, but refers to more of a social context

translated_poem:
When you start missing me
I can see it, I can see it
When you feel good in my arms
I can see it, I can see it
I can see it on your face
And believe me, believe me
When you try and control me
I can see it, I can see it
 When you laugh at my quirks
I can see it, I can see it
When you want something trifling
I can see it, I can see it
I can see it on your face
And believe me, believe me
When your head is in the clouds
I can see it, I can see it
 Just like a newborn bird That instinctively knows where the wind comes from
Love always knows when to grasp
Even the slightest feeling
 When you worry about me
I can see it, I can see it
When you share my joys
I can see it, I can see it
I can see it on your face
And believe me, believe me
When your eyes are stormy
I can see it, I can see it
 Just like flowers
That awaken before sunrise
Love can anticipate
The end of every thought
 When you need me
I can see it, I can see it
Everything you don't say
I can see it, I can see it
I can see it on your face
And believe me, believe me
When your heart goes on a trip
I can see it, I can see it

translated_poem:
You scream from the rooftops, he's mine
You are possessive and suffocating
You call him all the time out of jealousy
You spend all your time watching him
 Your love for him makes you blind
You've lost your friends for fear they would take him from you
He feels squeezed, pressured
You might lose him if you keep going like this
 Jealous, jealous, jealous, breathe a little
Jealous, jealous, jealous, sit down for a bit
Jealous, jealous, jealous, breathe a little
Jealous, jealous, jealous, sit down for a bit
 Make yourself love more instead of suffocating him
Be an independent woman, occupy your day
Cultivate yourself, be modern and a model
Behind a great man is a great woman
 He will never tell you, he will just leave
Stop being afraid, stop with your jealousy
Being in love is magic
Be careful, you will lose him
 Jealous, jealous, jealous, breathe a little
Jealous, jealous, jealous, sit down for a bit
Jealous, jealous, jealous, breathe a little
Jealous, jealous, jealous, sit down for a bit

translated_poem:
A noise opens my eyes, the telephone rings
We need you, says the voice that buzzes
Heavy eyelids, I jump out of bed (Ah!)
 I have my coffee, a shower and I leave,
I look at the time, I'm already late
In the icy wind, I stop a taxi
And I run, I run
 And I run, I run
What am I running after?
But I would like to be told one day
What I'm running after;
Yes, and I run, I run,
Yes, I'm still running
I would like to be told one day
What I'm running after.
 Noon at a restaurant, I'd like to sit
but there are so many people that I sit at the bar
They take my order and I wait fourty-five minutes (Ah!)
 When I'm finally served, time to start
A meeting is waiting for me, and I need to go there
I finish my glass, I call to pay
Running, because I run, I run
 And I run, I run
What am I running after?
But I would like to be told one day
What I'm running after;
Yes, and I run, I run,
Yes, I'm still running
I would like to be told one day
What I'm running after.
 Tonight at home, there are some friends
You told me once, please be specific,
You must be crazy that I'm not here, (trouble uh!)
I leave the office nervous and tired,
They will be serving dessert when I'm going to arrive,
I think while coming back, you're going to set me on fire!!
And I run, I run
 And I run, I run
What am I running after?
But I would like to be told one day
What I'm running after;
Yes, and I run, I run,
Yes, I'm still running
I would like to be told one day
What I'm running after.
 Oh, and I run, I run, I run, I run
Yes, I'm still running
But I would like to be told one day,
What I'm running after
Oh, and I run, I run, I run, I run
What am I running after?

Hou-oh, hou-oh-oh, hee hi ya
Hou-oh, hou-oh-oh, hee hi ya
 In front of my house, a rooted tree
My father carries within him the love of our lineage
 My family is my source of life
Our hearts are in harmony
My family resonates within me
Our hearts beat in emotion
This rhythm is my joy

It's love on the horizon
It is the peace that unites us
We are there without jealousy
 Hee, I'll dance my joy
Hee, I'll sing my faith

It's a moment of sweetness

Running running running running running
Running running running running running
Running running running running running
Running running running running running
 I run in the rain, breathless but determined to join her
I run in the rain, I saw the moon in the distance
 Running running running running running

To clean up around me

translated_poem:
And I love you so
When people ask me how
I've managed to live alone
I tell them I don't know
Time has passed
Things have changed
I'm not sure any more
Where my life's at now
 Life can be cruel, I know
Your shadow follows me
The endless hours stretch on
Even at night
I get no rest
Since you've come back to town
 And you don't love me now
I never cross your mind
You've forgotten me
Buried with the dead
You've turned the page
The book is shut
No, I'm not sure any more
Where my life's at now
 Life can be cruel, I know
Your shadow follows me
The endless hours stretch on
Even at night
I get no rest
Since you've come back to town
 And I love you so
When people ask me how
I've managed to live alone
I tell them I don't know

translated_poem:
Even if it is difficult, come on, come on, ooh, get up
God is strong, you will make it, get up
Nothing comes without effort, get up
Even in the hard times, get up

Tomorrow will be fine, get up

Tomorrow will be fine, get up
 Please, don't give up

 Tomorrow will be fine, tomorrow will be fine

 Please, don't give up

 If you don't get up, you'll get nothing

The mother of children, come see, the procreator, come see

Tomorrow is yours, but it's up to you to do well
 It will be fine
You have to listen when I call you
Get up, you go to work
You have to listen when I call you
Get up, you go to work
 Even if it is difficult, come on, come on, hoo, get up

Nothing comes without effort, get up

translated_poem:
I have a little dog whose name is Fred
He's the most unfortunate of quadrupeds
'Cause I'm a little flea
That nips him cunningly
 Fred spends his time scratching
This, for me, is the great peril
I quickly run and hide
'Til he's relieved himself
 I know I'm doing a dirty job
But that's my life, I can't help that (yeah)
I have got to bite
Sure 'nough, if you want him to scratch
Scratch, Fred
When I nip you
Scratch, Fred
It makes lovely music
Chicka chicka chicka cchhhh!
Chicka chicka chicka chhhhh!
 Fred came out winner of a dog show
They adopted us into a tony home
I'm a fancy flea anymore*
I no longer bite, but I savor
 Fred's covered in long ribbons
He outclassed all of his competitors
But as soon as we're between us
I quickly nip him everywhere
 I know he got all the qualities
But that's my life, I can't help that (yeah)
I have got to bite
Sure 'nough, if you want him to scratch
Scratch, Fred
When I nip you
Scratch, Fred
It makes lovely music
Chicka chicka chicka cchhhh!
Chicka chicka chicka chhhhh!
 Fred got older, that's the sad law of nature
It feels funny when your glory goes
As retirees on the Croisette
We only think of holidays
It's good and hot during the day
And Fred gets sleepy after lunch
And when I want to go home
I just need to nip him
 I know he's old and tired,
But that's my life, I can't help that (yeah)
I have got to bite
Since you want for him to scratch
Scratch, Fred
When I nip you
Scratch, Fred
It makes lovely music
Chicka chicka chicka cchhhh!
Chicka chicka chicka chhhhh!
Chicka chicka chicka cchhhh!
Chicka chicka chicka chhhhh!

translated_poem:
What, already? We were doing so fine
I don't understand anything
in your heart
What, already? Nothing more to say
You couldn't lie to my heart
Especially you, who I was seeing
as often as we see the sun
You, who I spent
my finest hours with everywhere

Too soft-hearted, too
Too young at age seventeen
 I tried to not be a child anymore

Too soft-hearted, too

Sad

Moving on from you

and no longer thinking about you
or pretending to smile
I wouldn't know

Too soft-hearted, too
Too young at age seventeen
Sad, so sad
Sad, so sad
Tonight

Literally "I played/performed no longer being a child / But you, you weren't playing
