translated_poem:
The wheat has never been As golden as this year
And I no longer think of you
Sometimes
 It often rains
But not always
How quick the days go by
And I no longer think of you at all
From time to time
 Why have regrets?
It's over, believe me
I forget about you
What's become of you?
 The ros√© wine will be good
And will you come and taste it?
And I no longer think of you
Sometimes
 I constantly reread your New Year card
And I no longer think of you at all
From time to time
 The absent ones, all the absent ones are wrong
But no, no remorse (I forget about you)
Ma said at noon (I forget about you)
She was no longer your friend (I forget about you)
She blushed, and then fell mum (I forget about you)
Indifferent, I responded
Well, it's true
And even smiled
 We have a new dog
Yes, you would like it
And I no longer think of you
Sometimes
 The walk that you loved
I do it alone now
And I no longer think of you at all
From time to time
 The yard, the big blooming yard
So many flowers, so many flowers for whom? (I forget about you)
I don't live in the past (I forget about you)
My life is good like it is (I forget about you)
When it's over, it's over (I forget about you)
I have come to terms
I understood
Come without warning

translated_poem:
I saw many monuments collapse
And beneath their stones, snakes live
But my love defied time
Like an old silver coin

Hides in the shadow of Khufu
You hid behind my love

Even if I have to suffer
Aida, it is time to leave

Even if I have to suffer
Aida, it is time to leave
It is time
 Yes, even if I have to cry
Even if I have to suffer
Aida, it is time to leave
It is time
Even, even, even!

translated_poem:
I lost my chance, I lost my song
And I know in advance that the time will be long
If you're no longer here to live with me
And if I can't even say no anymore
 You were my chance, you were my song
The bouquet of flowers in the middle of my home
The winter sun, the bird on the sea
My spring on earth for all four seasons
 I'll never hear your footsteps on the gravel again
Or the cry of the dog who was waiting for you
I no longer see your purple dress dancing in summer
And the boat's bored near the pond that's waiting for you
 I lost my chance, I lost my song
And I know in advance that the time will be long
If you're no longer here to live with me
And if I can't even say no anymore
 You were my chance, you were my song
The bouquet of flowers in the middle of my home
The winter sun, the bird on the sea
My spring on earth for all four seasons
 I sold everything, gave everything
There is nothing left of all the things that you loved
I can never have before my eyes again
Those familiar objects that only existed for us two
 I lost my chance, I lost my song
And I know in advance that the time will be long
If you're no longer here to live with me
And if I can't even say no anymore
 You were my chance, you were my song
The bouquet of flowers in the middle of my home
The winter sun, the bird on the sea
My spring on earth for all four seasons
 I lost my chance, I lost my song
And I know in advance that the time will be long
If you're no longer here to live with me
And if I can't even say no anymore
 You were my chance, you were my song
The bouquet of flowers in the middle of my home
The winter sun, the bird on the sea
My spring on earth for all four seasons

But it's not the same thing
When you wake up out
In the country

 If you feel like you're too hemmed in
Smothered by this big city
There, you'll forget quick
There, you'll be peaceful
Yeah, there, out in the country
In the country
Yeah, out in the country

 In this beautimous nature The air is always pure
The days are longer
And the grass smells good
You see the sun
When you wake up
Out in the country
In the country
 Life passes quick
One must know how to enjoy
Stay, little one
There's no need to back and fill
And come out to the country
To the country

To the country
I said, out to the country
To the country

translated_poem:
What would you do, what would you do
What would you do, if you were me
You wouldn't do any better
If you were me, if you were me
 What would you do, what would you do
What would you do, if you were me
You wouldn't do any better
If you were me, if you were me
 It's simple to look down on people
To move your lips, to chew on your pen
To shake my dreams like a rodeo
It's simple to say the words
It's easy to look at the time
And to make fun of my many mistakes
It's easy to belittle my values
It's easy to break my heart
 What would you do, what would you do
What would you do, if you were me
You wouldn't do any better
If you were me, if you were me
If you were me, if you were me
 It's easy to sit back
With your fake hardworking attitude
Have you ever aimed that straight
Without trembling up and down
It's convenient to laugh so loudly
And to blame my clumsy attempts
It's convenient to act as a mentor
While I'm struggling hard
 What would you do, what would you do
What would you do, if you were me
You wouldn't do any better
If you were me, if you were me
If you were me, if you were me
 It's easy to judge from afar
With a very confident tone
And to constantly mock
My wishes reduced to nothingness, but
 What would you do, what would you do
If you were me
You wouldn't do any better
If you were me, if you were me
 What would you do, what would you do
If you were me
What would you do, if you were me
If you were me
You wouldn't do any better

If you were me, if you were me
 What would you do, if you were me
What would you do, if you were me
If you were me
What would you do, what would you do
 What would you do, what would you do
What would you do, if you were me
You wouldn't do any better
If you were me

translated_poem:
The statue gazes at the wandering sea
Under the blue sky without winter at the end of the world
And the mother carrying the child has a tender heart
To the prayers of the peasants who ask her
 Full of rain on our plains
Santa Maria
Full of wheat on our lands
In our houses full of flowers
Protect those I love
Santa Maria
Give them the light
Of a smile in their hearts
 The statue has lovers full of promises
And sometimes I pray to it with my eyes when you hurt me
 And the mother carrying the child has only one story
And it‚Äôs that of all these people who came to believe.
 Full of rain on our plains
Santa Maria
Full of wheat on our lands
In our houses full of flowers
Protect those I love
Santa Maria
Give them the light
Of a smile in their hearts
Give them the light
Of a smile in their hearts

translated_poem:
Finally
I'm watching people live
and I'm no longer shutting myself in at my place
I'm no longer afraid of being alone
 Finally
This morning, I'm listening to a record
I get the feeling that I exist
and I'm no longer looking for you with sadness in the empty house
 For the months I have been living
without even opening my window blinds
I pulled myself along like a poor man
I forgot how to breathe without you
And suddenly, I'm well
 Yes, finally
I'm finding new girls
I'm meting new friends
I'm regaining confidence in myself
 Finally
I'm clinging onto smiles
and I'm finding things to say
I was a shell of your heart1
Finally, I'm becoming myself again
 I drew you on the walls
to get a better look at my wounds
But tonight, I shut my door
and I went to live my life outdoors
And suddenly, I'm fine
 Yes, finally
I'm finding new girls
I'm meeting new friends
But I'm talking to them about you
 Yes, finally
I'm clinging onto smiles
But I notice that each time they happen
they remind me of yours
 Oh, oh, finally
I'm finding new girls
I'm meeting new friends
But I'm talking to them about you
  1.
Likely a reference to the French idiom "√™tre l‚Äôombre de soi-m√™me", roughly translating to being "being a shell/shadow of one's former self". This idiom refers to cases where an individual has declined drastically in health/greatness/happiness/etc. In this case, however, he seems to be saying that he feels like he was like a shell of his lover's heart as if it were an extension of his own.

original_poem:
Dans un baiser, l‚Äôonde au rivage

Pour consoler la fleur sauvage

La tourterelle au t√©r√©binthe
Ses longs regrets.
 Aux flots dormants, quand tout repose,
Hors la douleur,
La lune parle, et dit la cause
De sa p√¢leur.
Ton d√¥me blanc, Sainte-Sophie,
Parle au ciel bleu,
Et, tout r√™veur, le ciel confie

 Arbre ou tombeau, colombe ou rose,
Onde ou rocher,

Pour s‚Äô√©pancher‚Ä¶
Moi, je suis seul, et rien au monde

 (1845)
translated_poem:
In a kiss, the swell tells the shore
Its pain and fears ;
To console the wild flower more,
The Dawn has tears;
The old cypress hears the evening
Wind's suffering,
The turtle-dove the long regrets
Of the privet.
 To the sleeping waves, when all reposes,
Except Soreness,
The Moon speaks, exposing the cause
Of its wanness.
Your whitish dome speaks, High Sophia,
To the blue sky,
And the so dreamy sky confides
Its dream to God.
 Whether tree, grave, dove or rosebud
Waves so wanton,
Everything down here has a thing
To pour out on.
But I -am alone, nothing in the world
To me responds.
- Only your voice, profound and dull,
Dark Hellespont !

translated_poem:
[Lucheni]
But what the hell do you want! 1 The world is collapsing, indubitably.1 At Court, it has not yet been noticed. But in the Viennese Caf√©s, everyone knows it!
 [Professor]
Is the flyer to be had?
 [Journalist]
What's in the broth?
 [Student]
Does anyone want to play rummy?
 [Bohemian]
There, it is done, I'm getting bored!
 [Poet]
Our young Empress cries and cries and cries
She barely feeds herself because of her grief
 [Bohemian]
Another coffee!
 [Lucheni]
Another coffee!
 [Professor]
No one's seen her outside!
 [Journalist]
She's pregnant again
 [Poet]
Will she give us the alms
Of an heir to the throne
 [Journalist]
At the Renz Circus, she was seen waving
 [Professor]
Madam her mother-in-law looked like she was going to choke
 [All]
In the caf√© we
Pass the time, day after day
Waiting for the day of the apocalypse
 [Lucheni]
And they talk, and they talk, they know everything, they know nothing. They sit there, to ignore time,1 to kill time. Day after day.
 [Poet]
One year spent!
 [Bohemian]
Spent being bored
 [Professor]
The concordat is ended
 [Student]
Somebody, I'm distributing
 [Journalist]
The young Emperor has made measurable effort
But his politics aren't strong
 [Bohemian]
Another cognac!
 [Professor]
The last Crimean War leaves us in second place
 [Journalist]
And now Austria is alone politically
 [Professor]
France and Russia are joining England
And Piedmont is declaring war on us
 [All]
In the caf√© we
Pass the time, day after day
Waiting for the day of the apocalypse
 [Student]
This time it's a boy, we didn't believe it anymore
 [Man]
Finally!
 [Poet]
He was taken from his mother, as soon as he appeared
 [Journalist]
Sometimes it is said that she likes Hungarians
 [Bohemian]
Is she a radical?
 [Professor]
Is she a liberal?
 [All]
My God, this woman is weird
In the caf√© we
Dream of the apocalypse
 [Lucheni]
When Rodolphe was born
She had, in the child-pain bed, the most scary of visions
She sees red flags and a crowd in the streets of Vienna
Which is screaming its indignation
On top of all the barricades her sin is seen
As leader of the revolution
 [Poet]
That's very baroque
 [Bohemian]
And decadent!
 [Student & Professor]
We need a real Parliament, quick!
 [All]
In the caf√© we
Pass the time, day after day
Waiting for the day of the apocalypse
In the caf√© we
Pass the time, day after day
Waiting for the day of the apocalypse
 [1st group]
What a shame, what a shame
All the wise ones, we share
Our messages
 [2nd group (at the same time)]
[?]
It is wise that we share
We are sages
 [All]
In this little caf√©

a. b. c. Italian

translated_poem:
Everybody needs love
Everybody needs love
Even if it's short-lived
Whether it's up there
Way, way out there
Whether it's present or past
We love too much or not enough
Everybody needs love
 Everybody needs love
Even if you got to suffer someday
Everybody needs love
Even if it don't last forever
 They say that hate often meets up with love
Whether we're single or in couple
Whether we're happy or not
Everybody needs love
 Everybody needs love
Even if you got to suffer someday
Everybody needs love
Even if it don't last forever
 In the night, I shout "I love you"
Sometimes, I'm wonderin' if I'll always be the same
When I smile sometimes
I'm wonderin' if I'm happy
But can you imagine if I was alone?
Nobody to share my joy with anymore
Nobody with whom I can share my sorrows, my loneliness, and my torments,
And my nights so cold for a humongous heart
These nights that feel so long in a too big bed
 Everybody needs love
Even if you got to suffer someday
Everybody needs love
Even if it don't last forever
Everybody needs love
Even if you got to suffer someday
Everybody needs love
Even if it don't last forever

translated_poem:
I leave my dressing room and hustle to my car
As I pass by, I kiss a gal and sign a couple autographs
Sorry if I'm in a hurry, it's just that I've just finished
Six days on the road, and I'm a-gonna make it home tonight
 From town to town I ran like crazy, barely restin'
But it feels so good to be on stage and sing for those who love you
Soon, I'll be off again, but I can't do anymore after
Six days on the road, and
I'm a-gonna make it home tonight
 As I drive in the night, things swarm in my mind
I need new songs and a new step for the Claudettes
This dang vocation again, enough I've had it
I'm a-gonna make it home tonight
 Suddenly, I think of that gal a-sittin' in the front row
I was a little bit in love with her at the end of my show
I would've liked to see her again, but I bid her good night
I'm a-gonna make it home tonight
 I'm happy to see the gal of my heart again soon
Suddenly, I feel the urge to step on the gas
I dream of kissin' her, without her it's hard to get through
Six days on the road, and
I'm a-gonna make it home tonight
 Six days on the road, and
I'm a-gonna make it home tonight
Yeah, tonight

translated_poem:
It's a truly amazing story that Imma tell y'all now
An old gentleman hadn't smiled since he was a little child
But one day, as he was walking down a very dark street with his back bent, brooding over his sorrow,
A big guy suddenly appeared to him and said: ‚ÄúTry and sing this refrain!‚Äù
 Boom boom, boom boom
It's enchantin' music
Boom boom, boom boom
Your eyes ain't made for cryin'
 Ever since that day, the old man really only thought about having fun
The big guy no longer appeared to him, but he left his secret with him
I who am speaking to you, I have sung a lot, but I've never felt, I believe, such a desire to laugh nor felt this strong of a strange effect as when singing this refrain again
 Boom boom, boom boom
It's enchantin' music
Boom boom, boom boom
Your eyes ain't made for cryin'
 Boom boom, boom boom
Sing this enchantin' tune instead
Boom boom, boom boom
Life's too short for cryin'
 Boom boom, boom boom
It's enchantin' music...

translated_poem:
Bernadette,
Don't push me away 'cause without you I wouldn't know where to go
Bernadette,
Don't push me away, or I'll go and love others to forget you
 But if I have to leave,
I'd like for you to know beforehand
That I've always been walked out on
That I've always been abandoned

translated_poem:
My little one, don't go looking around for
your slice of heaven
It patiently awaits you
just two stone's throws away1
 A shower of music rains down

in a corner of your dreams

Your friend Superman
will lead you there by hand
just two stone's throws away1

has balls of the planets around you2
It's not in the north of China
In some corner of Carolina?
No, no, it's really
in a corner of your dreams
 Run towards the sun, my little one
In a red and golden sky
A smiling Captain Kidd
is on his treasure island
just two stone's throws away1
 It's your journey, your adventure
No clouds, no winters
 Run towards the sun, my little one
In a red and golden sky
A smiling Captain Kidd
is on his treasure island
just two stone's throws away1
just two stone's throws away1
 Run towards the sun, my little one
You'll become a Native American chief
Your friend Superman
will lead you there by hand
just two stone's throws away1 (x3)
  1.
a. b. c. d. e. f. "√Ä quatre pas d'ici" (literally "at four steps from here") is likely a reference to the French idiom "√† deux pas d'ici" (literally "at two steps from here"), which can be translated into English as "(just) a stone's throw away" (i.e. something within a very short distance of something or someone). As 4 √∑ 2 = 2, "√† quatre pas d'ici" is translated here as "just two stone's throws away".
2.
Literally "has placed balls (as in formal dance events) of planets around you". The grammar of this sentence makes its exact meaning unclear unclear, and it is hard to tell whether it is referring to something along the lines of "balls from the planets that are around you" or something like "balls from the planets, which have been placed around you".

It's done, alright, we'll start it
Let's go for the new life

We smoke just one cigarette

We smoke just one cigarette

translated_poem:
We often talk of mamas
We sometimes forget the papas
Who came from the very depths of Italy
From Pescara, from Napoli
They were often masons
Who became underground miners
They put heart and soul to use
To the end of this long journey
 We grew up with love
There never were any bad days
The end of the months were fragile
And it was sometimes hard
But when we have in the bottom of our hearts
Gardens perfumed with flowers
They brought us the sun
A new country of wonders
 Papa, papa, papa
If you hadn't been there
Tell me, what would I have done without you?
Papa, papa
If you hadn't been there
What would I have made with my ten fingers?
 Black hair turned white
With rain, with time
They haven't lost their accent
And their hands talk still
The hour finally came
To not tire the heart
To rest with family
The papas have shining eyes
 We don't all have the same story
No, but they all look a little alike
Who hasn't wanted, one night
To say : "Papa, I'm happy
I am happy, I owe it to you
If I am here it is because of you
I can't find the words to thank you
You and mama too"
 Papa, papa, papa
If you hadn't been there
Tell me, what would I have done without you?
Papa, papa
If you hadn't been there
What would I have made with my ten fingers?
 You gave me music
The romantic heart and the soul
With those moment so magical
Of your nostalgic memories
 Papa, papa, papa
If one day you aren't here anymore
How will I live without you?

The dark flees

Alas, why does

translated_poem:
Even on her knees, even in prayer
She remembers Italy
Jesus, Mary and our Father
To say she forgets you is an understatement
On the other side of hell
She remembers saying, "yes"
To passion, to light
To wild love, to infinity
And praying to this man on the cross
Is still giving yourself to him
And when these thoughts come to her
She hardly even blushes
The religious woman has like me
Nostalgic nights of love
The religious woman has sometimes
Long sobs of jealousy
Even on her knees, even in prayer
She hears his voice calling her
She sees boats on the sea
She revisits hotel rooms
On the other side of this wall
There is the sun of life
There are lips whispering
To lips starved with envy
And praying to this man on the cross
Is still giving yourself to him
And when these thoughts come to her
She hardly even blushes
The religious woman has like me
Nostalgic nights of love
The religious woman has sometimes
Long sobs of jealousy
Even on her knees, even in prayer
She shivers with want
So many sorcerers bewitch her
That the devil takes pleasure in it
Even if she tucks her hair
Under an anonymous cornet
She doesn't know to lower her eyes
The fear of evil weakens her
And praying to that man on the cross
Is still giving yourself over to him
And when these thoughts come to her
She hardly even blushes
The religious woman has like me
Nostalgic nights of love
The religious woman sometimes has
Long sobs of jealousy

translated_poem:
How the heck long does it take
To remake two strangers Of two strangers who've loved each other?
How the heck long does it take
To repaint a world in blue
And to forget that one can be happy?
 Sometime joys seduce me
I take them like balloons
Whether they bust or fly away, it's all the same to me
I don't have many illusions anymore
The gals pass by, and I look at myself
I don't move forward
I'd like to put a smile on my face
And to quit thinking 'bout you
 How the heck long does it take
To remake two strangers
Of two strangers who've loved each other?
How the heck long does it take
To repaint a world in blue And to forget that one can be happy?
 Empty bottles and overflowing ashtrays
Pile up in my room
When the morning sun comes 'round, pallid
Without even warming my hands
I shoulda kept my distance
I got burned in the heart Oh, it hurts when in life You've known and lost happiness!
 How the heck long does it take
To remake two strangers
Of two strangers who've loved each other, oh-oh-oh?
How the heck long does it take
To repaint a world in blue And to forget that one can be happy, oh-oh-oh?
 How the heck long does it take
To remake two strangers
Of two strangers who've loved each other?
How the heck long does it take
To repaint a world in blue And to forget that one can be happy?

translated_poem:
This is the story of a girl beautiful enough to eat
who fell for every beautiful nutcase.
The lost ones, the searched for ones, in short, all the freaks
who hung in the not-so beutiful neighbourhoods
 All of her little girl dreams were sweet,
Who knows why everything soured
Everything has a weird taste, who cares, nothing to see.
What could she have possibly done?
 And the girl dances
and between two dances
a girl for sale.
Eyes closed to not see anything.
 And the whole town dances
and between two dances
no one cares.
Eyes closed to not see anything.
 This is the story of a girl mad as a hatter,
Crazy for a madman who doesn't care about being born.
Who tells her "Good news, come, heaven
is sold in powder at my shop".
 And the girl dances
and between two dances
a girl for sale.
 This girl there, it's me, it's you
Disillusioned, already out of breath.
Where have the angels gone?
Why are they leaving us?
How strange.
 This girl there dancing here,
is she a bit you or a lot me?
Where have all our angels gone?
Why do they grow away with childhood?
 And the girl dances
and between two dances
a girl for sale.
 This girl there, it's me, it's you
Disillusioned, already out of breath.
Where have the angels gone?
Why are they leaving us?
How strange.
 This girl there dancing here,
is she a bit you or a lot me?
Where have all our angels gone?
Why do they grow away with childhood?
 Three little turns and off they go.

translated_poem:
I should've told you
Instead of writing to you
Words are meaningless
You are my suffering
One hour of your absence
And I no longer have stories.

For your shape
And for your appearance
Slave to a smile

My nights of love are fading

 The wildest passions

 In a discreet manner

When the music stops
We tell ourselves maybe
I didn't dare.
 The wildest passions
Hearing nothing of the words
When the music stops
We find ourselves out of words
I didn't dare.

translated_poem:
Deborah-ah-ah
Ah, Deborah!!
I'm calling you
Listen to me
Do you remember?
It was yesterday
I don't remember anymore
Oh, it's been so long
 The wind slapped at the waves
The waves scratched the beach
My God, how I loved you
I was trembling, I was cold
You were making fun of me
My God, how I loved you
We were holding each other close
You were laughing, how pretty you were
My God, how I loved you

Everything's changed
What happened
Do you remember?
I've forgotten
I don't remember anymore
Oh, it's been so long
 Why did this great wave

Why these running people

 I don't know anymore, why all this crowd
I can't see anymore, why is everything dark
I don't remember anymore
Why are all these faces

They don't answer
I don't know anymore
I'm cold and I'm scared
I don't know anymore
I scream and I cry

Why is the sand red

Why am I alone?
Why this livid sky
Why is my head empty?

translated_poem:
How many rivers and mountains does it take
To arrive in your arms?
How much of England or Spain does it take
To fall asleep next to you ?
 The more I call you, the less I see you
The more beautiful you are, The less you believe me
The more I love you every time
 My heart stops now
In front of a wall of cement
In front of your indifferent heart
And I ask you,
I ask you:
 How many rivers and mountains
For a night, for a day ?
How much of of England or Spain does it take
For a single touch of your hands
 The more I call you, the les I see you
The more beautiful you are, The less you believe me
And the more I love you every time
 I want to fight like a madman
against your heart and for us
despite those rivers between us
I must win
against the mountains
 Yes, I want to take you like a flower in spring
I want to hear you cry my name in the wind
But how to do it ? how much time would it take ?
How many rivers, and how many torrents ? oh yes...oh..oh..oh..
 My heart stops now
In front of a wall of cement
In front of your indifferent heart
I must win against the mountains

Au moins vingt-cinq chansons de Lennon-McCartney

translated_poem:
She played the piano every evening at seven o'clock
Waltzes by Chopin, military marches
Tunes that made her heart pound one day
Her repertoire dated back to the first war1
 We never saw her, except in the morning
when she came out looking for her newspaper and bread
She lived in the apartment above me
But she never greeted her neighbours
 During winter, it was like there was a ghost in the house
But when the warmer months came along
she opened her window like one opens up their heart
to play the piano in the evening at seven o'clock
 But one fine summer evening, when it was very hot
She suddenly stopped while playing a tango piece
She didn't fall victim to a mood swing
She died of a heart attack
 And since she had no will to leave behind
One day, we sold her belongings to be auctioned off
I don't know why, as someone who hardly played it at all,
I bought the old instrument for myself
 I already wasn't bad at playing, I already knew by heart
at least 25 songs by Lennon and McCartney
And when I'm old, alone and abandoned,
I'll play them every evening at seven o'clock
 I'll play them every evening at seven o'clock
  1.
Context makes it difficult to guess which specific war this is referring to. One might guess that it refers to the First World War (1914-1918), but this would be anachronistic as Chopin actually died in 1849 - well before WWI even began.

translated_poem:
One of those days when all seems troubled
The weight of the world mirrors my thoughts
I seek a way not to fall apart
Oh, I need a purpose to move forward
An inner voice suddenly arises
Reminds me of the emotion lurking inside
It is there, so close, within my reach
I always forget, but it‚Äôs never out of reach
So much love in the air

What tenderness is captive?
So much love, so much light
Swinging from storms to a cloudless sky
And so it is for all eternity
Peace is negotiated, war conquers
What to do today with our contrary instincts?
Make a choice and embrace the risks
You are not the only one who cares, the only one
I also want to try to be better
Not to blame myself too much for my mistakes
So much love, I know it

I just know I must find my way
So much love for your friends

Feel this love, this truth
So much love is what we are
In moments when all seems troubled
The weight of the world reveals my thoughts
So much love in the air
So much love always around
How much love, I cannot say
I just know I must find my way
Keep an open mind
Stay curious
Stay adventurous
As much as a wild child
What love are you seeking?
Sometimes silent, sometimes veiled
How much love do you want?
It raises its voice, even when broken
So much love, I feel it
So much love, it‚Äôs always there
What tenderness is captive?
So much love, so much light

translated_poem:
Children are born for music
Magical pianos
Enchanted flutes
And we give them
Practical work
Electric trains
In lieu of loving them
That's what Mozart
That's what Mozart
That's what Mozart
would say
 Children are made to
listen
What the trees say
What time thinks
And we give them
Plastic flowers
A mechanical world
Whose heart is absent
That's what Mozart
That's what Mozart
That's what Mozart
would say
 Give them some wild horses
Set free like laughter above the clouds
And you'll see their eyes show you the future
And you'll find God at the corner of their smiles
Children don't question
They are the truth that we don't listen to
 They would do, if they led the dance,
Cities of crystal
Houses of sun
Let them do
They are musicians
They are magicians
Rainbow makers
That's what Mozart
That's what Mozart
That's what Mozart
would say
 You have cut off all the paths
That others like me
Have opened with their hands
Your dreams are now only in a few songs
That shatter from the cold
On concrete walls
 Turn to the side of the prophets
To the side of the poets
To the side of the children
Children are born for music
Magical pianos
Fountain jets in the park Let them live
On the side of love
And one day you will have
Thousands of Mozarts
That's what Mozart
That's what Mozart
That's what Mozart
would say

translated_poem:
How hot the sun is when you come too close to me
I feel warmth in my heart when you lean in toward me
 I feel warmth in my heart like on a summer day
I feel warmth in your arms that I must leave
The fire that comes from you is too strong
As soon as I try and distance myself from you
 The desire that burns our hands feels hot
It feels warm to think how well we are together
I should leave but I can not
Oh yes, I should, but I don't want to
 I tear myself away from everything that awaits me without you
I hide, so much so I forget time within the happiness of being with you
 I love you, yes, I love you and I will stay with you
Too bad for the one who is waiting for me there
You are all that I want and I want you
 I feel warmth in my heart like on a summer day
How hot the sun is when you come too close to me
I feel warmth in my heart when you lean in toward me
How hot the sun is

Fifteen years old tomorrow, these big boys

No more chocolate

They have some girls on their mind

To stick with daddy-o

translated_poem:
My grocer kept it in his stand
The collector kept it in his drawer
The flower, so beautiful, of our hopes
The pharmacist pampered1 it in a jar
The ex-caporal2 was talking about it with the ex-general
For it was her, our ideal

Of the ancient Paris, who smiles
For it's the flower of the return
Of the return of the beautiful days
For four years in our hearts
She guarded her colors
Blue, white, red, with the hope that she had bloomed
Flower of Paris
 The farmer saw her blooming in his fields
The old priest treasured her in an all-white sky
Flower of expectation
Flower of happiness
All those who fought for our freedoms
At dawn, they saw it shine before their eyes
The flower of France
To the three colors
 It's a flower of Paris
Of the ancient Paris, who smiles
For it's the flower of the return
Of the return of the beautiful days
For four years in our hearts
She guarded her colors
Blue, white, red, with the hope that she had bloomed
Flower of Paris
 It's a flower from us
She grew from everywhere
For it's the flower of return
Of the return to the beautiful days
For four years in our hearts
She guarded her colors
Blue, white, red, she was truly above all
Flower from us
 It's a flower from us
She grew from everywhere
For it's the flower of return
Of the return to the beautiful days
For four years in our hearts
She guarded her colors
Blue, white, red, she was truly above all
Flower from us

translated_poem:
In times past, castles had fun in the sky
Defying the insults of time
In times past, ships conquered the seas
Singing as they sailed
In times past, merchants brought back
Stars and blood-red roses
From the Levant
And mists from the North with golden edges still sewn in
In times past, armies marched far away from time
Without knowing where time was taking them
In times past, lords passed away
Under dying trees
In.times past, lovers waited for each other
And their vows were sung
And poets died for the sake of a rhyme
 In times past, every king wanted to laugh at a fool
And fools, thinking themselves as kings, dreamed that a queen was dying of pleasure
In their arms
In times past, princesses, By giving themselves away for a night
To one who had no right,
Accepted death by burning at the stake
Rather than being cured
And yet, if we had to go back to those times
When love gave itself lovers
Like in Heaven or here below
Our eyes will never see more
I would choose this night.
And this morning of my life
My life begins today
Because you love me
 Because you love me

translated_poem:
A day will dawn
On three lilac branches
That a child will look at
Like a picture book
 The world around him
Will be empty, and that is how he will invent life
On his first page
 By drawing the shape
of an orange
He will give the sky
Its first sun
By drawing a bird
He will invent the flower
By searching for the sound of water
He will hear the cry of the heart
 By drawing the branches of a star
The child will find the path of the grown-ups
Grown-ups who have kept
A wonder-filled gaze
For the fruits of each day
And for the roses of love

translated_poem:
At first, life is nothing
Barely a cry
Before opening our hands, one day, we live
And the curtain rises and we step forward under it
And then we make gestures
And then we say words
Where does the day go? Where does the night come from?
Why the sky?
How is life?
By the time we know, it's too late
And when the heart starts to leave us to go settle somewhere else, to burn with other hearts
We believe that the time has come to conquer the heart of the world
 We run and we can barely walk
We confuse taking with loving
And we get lost
And then one day, falling from the clouds, we have only a few wrinkles as baggage
So, we must fight, and the important thing is not to lose or win
It's to choose between wanting and quitting
But we talk first, and then afterward we think
We build a wall with irrationality
And we make our own prison
We hide on the horizon to dream of freedom
Or of a forgotten swallow in the heart of a song
We make a mountain or a bird as we would make a Camargue or a reed
And time passes and the leaf blushes too soon
 Before December, we still want to gain a few seconds
It is then that we love,
that we relive our bohemian life
While watching the curtain that awaits us up there
And we run before the time and the day
But
At first, life is nothing
Barely a cry
Before opening our hands, one day, we live

translated_poem:
Just think how lucky you are
To be a child of France,
It's a beautiful country.
 Think that all those who come here
From their distant land Have children too.
 Tell yourself that all the words
They hear at school
Mark them for life.
 Think that in the face of distress
In the heart of tenderness One makes friends.
 Think that it's not easy
For all those who go into exile
To find happiness.
 Think that they're ready to build
With you an empire
Of all colors.
 Tell yourself that every second
A sweet angel
Dies around the world.
 Think how lucky you are
To be a child of France, And let your heart go.

translated_poem:
Too young or too old
This world is divided into two
But not for those who understand each other with their eyes
Too young or too old
It never meant anything
We're alive as long as we're old enough to smile
Too gray or too blue

Jerusalem is fashionable
and that's good

And it's been two or three hundred thousand years... (since we've been wearing it)

translated_poem:
He said, "Don't expect sunny days
I don't see anything
But an uncertain future
But an uncertain future
Ahead of me
And yours will be the same."
He said, "More than once
I lived like a thief
With dogs chasing after me
And men following close behind
I was afraid of them men and not the dogs."
So I took his hand and said, "Listen to me. I'll follow you anywhere
I'll follow you anywhere
I want to live with your fear and beat with your heart.
Tell me where your fear comes from
Tell me about your heart."
 He said, "Where I was born
People live in herds
If you want to escape
You have to be the bull
You have to face death
And be the strongest
Because they will run after you
Make your body bleed
And never stop
And keep hitting
They keep advancing
But it's up to you not to fall Because the one who has walked
Farther than his misery Sings for his brothers
And his brothers want to follow him
And if people are free
They can't hit them anymore."
 He said, "Don't expect sunny days
The person who lives like me
Falls asleep every night Between life and death
And your nights will be the same."
So I took his hand and said, "Listen to me. I'll follow you anywhere
I'll follow you anywhere
I want to live with your fear and beat with your heart
I want to sleep with your fear and love your heart."
He said, "Where I was born
People live in herds
And you have to escape
You have to be the bull
You have to face death
And be the strongest
And you have to escape
You have to be the bull
You have to face death
And be the strongest!"

translated_poem:
There was a simple and nice young girl
who never asked anything of anybody
One evening in the subway, there was
a young man who dared to - I confess -
put his hand...on her hair1
How nice she was,
She moved a bit closer to him
 But as if fearing for her dresses
she evades his attacks
Feeling someone who was tickling her
behind her back, she fiddles her hand
and comes across a lovely pair...of gloves2
that the young man, in his hand,
was carelessly holding.
 Seeing how emotional the woman was
He got a lil' bit closer to her
And suddenly, like in every man,
the demon living inside him rose up
The young man flashed his...business card to her3
and told her "My name's Jules
and I live on Descartes Road".
 The subway continued along its journey
She told herself that this young man isn't wise
I feel something sharp
that feels hard and confident
looking to penetrate...my heart4
Ah, how sweet love is
What a thrill of delight!
 Likewise, when we're in love in Paris
We can tell each other without any problems
The vehicle doesn't matter
Don't be afraid of ridicule
Just tell them..."Let me invite you5
to my home to eat spaghetti."

Audience might have expected the word "fesse", meaning buttocks
2.
Audience might have expected the word "couilles", a vulgar slang word for testicles.
3.
Audiences might have expected the word "bite", meaning dick (vulgar slang term for penis).
4.
Audiences might have expected the phrase "mon cul", meaning "my ass".
5.
Audiences might have expected the phrase "Je t'encule", literally meaning "I sodomize you" but more frequently used as an insult roughly meaning "F-ck you".

Carrying a suitcase, on the pavement
Some memories in my mind
My taxi is late
 Today, Paris has become empty

They'll lock my heart up
Double-lock
 The keys to my new life
Will condemn me
To the fear of silence
Of tears and absence
Until I forget you

I leave my roses covered in buds

Until I forget you

Will free me from
This infernal burden
Which hurts me so much

Until I forget you

To live with someone, one needs to know how to love
And not take anything they haven't given
Two lovers in the night and two friends during the day

To live with someone, one needs to open their heart

I look at you and I keep you, and everything becomes clear
The shadow turns into light
I see you live and I feel free, and I sing it
The rest is unimportant
To live with someone, one needs to know how to love
And not take anything they haven't given
Two lovers in the night and two friends during the day
That's how one loves each other for keeps
To live with
someone, one needs to find the port
Where boats come and pour gold
They need to get married every last May
To live with someone, one needs to love each other
They need to get married every last May
To live together, one needs to love each other!

The green hills of our summer days

Our love is a cry more alive than life

However far you go, no horizon

The green hills will wed us
Tonight, the orange trees are in our hearts
Our laughter has tears of happiness
My love, this is where life begins

Through the ages we have played
You have often knocked at my door

I give back to you my breath and my skin

At the steeples of Jerusalem

They had met each other

They fell in love dearly

We'll never forget that day

translated_poem:
On the streets of Rio, a child marvels
At the sight of the gold and blue procession of the sun-dressed brass bands in their liveries.
Forgetting his clothes, his bare feet,
In his lost dreams
He envisions himself as a king leading the Sabbath. [Chorus]:
Amidst the cymbals,
The Bengal lights,
The starry skies,
The flower-filled eyes,
In the heart of the celebration he pours out his heart.
On the streets of Rio, a child reaches out his hands while singing
And becomes friends with all the musicians.
[Chorus]
On the streets of Rio, a child lives his dream.
As he walks, he envisions himself as a king leading the Sabbath.
And soon, one child, ten children, a thousand children, accompany him Playing the cymbals, Entering the dance,
Dancing under two arches of flowers.
And the child, beaming with joy, feeds on songs Like do all the forgotten angels of God.
[Chorus]
On the streets of Rio, a child disappears into the night
And soon he falls asleep on a bench, dreaming of a million cymbals,
Bengal lights,
Flowers and stars,
Stars and flowers,
It's the heart of the celebration sleeping in his heart.
On the streets of Rio, a child marvels while dreaming
Like a flower from the suburbs in the sunshine of love.

I said these words a hundred times
These words that others had been writing
With all my voice, with all my soul
With all the soul that I can
The blues the way I was taught
I woke up this morning, baby

that I imagined from inside my bubble of comfort1
Beatings, blood, muddy conditions
It was painful to close my eyes
 His baby's far away
I've got things to forgive, I've got prayers
But the Blues are not just empty sentences

But this morning, you were really cold
You understand from the depths of your chest
All these blues were written for you
 Oh, oh I feel, the blues in me
Nobody knows how I really feel
Nobody knows, nobody cares
The words burn you one by one like they-
Like they finally belonged to you
(I woke up this morning, baby
Blues pouring out of me...)
These blues were yours
(I woke up this morning, baby
Blues deep inside me...)
 With all my voice, with all my soul
With all the soul that I can
The blues that I'd never been taught before
 I woke up this morning, baby
(Blues pouring out of me...)
The blues was pouring deep inside of me baby
(The blues deep inside me...)
Nobody
(Nobody, nobody, nobody knows the blues in me...)
The blues was pouring out of me baby
(Nobody, nobody, nobody knows the blues in me...)
Nobody knows, nobody cares
(Blues was pouring out of me...)
Nobody, nobody, nobody
(Nobody, nobody, nobody knows the blues in me...)

translated_poem:
The world's spinning out of control, love in parenthesis
I see fallen men in the churchyard drowning in their bottles
Demons dance in the comments, our minds become withdrawn
Hope is life, when we search for it too hard, sometimes we end up dying from it
I thought I was still a teen, but I took my 'A' levels six years ago
I used to hope to look at life through rose-tinted glasses, the Paris streets are paved with vaginas
 Unease in the eyes of the passerbys
Tearing each other apart is a hobby
Ignorning others, however you gotta tell them their mom's a dirty whore
I'm in control, I have neuroses, oversized kids
My body on the sly, the nerves explode, I've got no ill intentions
 Then I console my mom, I ignore what my brother's doing
My dad up there should ask himself why I'm offing myself
I trace the parlor with a heavy heart, my love's captive
Everyone could lose their health if our words are ignored
'Cause silence destroyed souls
If you say too much, you'll end up betrayed
Blame drugs on their Snapchat
They're fucked up on dope and they scroll
 Fuck, what a shitty time
I regret how gullible I was in my youth
Tomorrow will be harder than the day before
I don't blame people who put a bullet in their-
I don't know why I'm getting all worked up, hmm, hmm
I don't know why I'm getting all worked up
The present is calling me, when nothing worries me anymore
 Your voice is just giving me a headache
When I'm scared, I take my pulse
I'm in a bad mood, I'm gonna piss somebody off
I've got to put down some sage, I order a coffee
Put some milk and ice cubes in it
I talk to my friends about my doubts, but in modesty
I hid my curves outside, it's the fair, many have bored me
Both boys and girls 7 a.m., I'm in the subway

Hey, I'm gonna be late
I'm crazy, sentimental, in a Sunday night (shh)

Forget it, I'm in my mood, yeah, I've got to move to L.A. (L.A., L.A., L.A., L.A.)
 Years pass by, they go by too fast, I'm so, so, so proud
We didn't do it for the money, but you need money, I'll work 'til I'm dead
It's a good thing we took risks, it's funda, funda, fundamental
I don't have 200 friends on my list, but I've got the real ones, my family, I love 'em so much
Exhausted by the noxiousness, the clouds of gasoline but I've increased my life
It's my little heart that's fragile, in April, we launch hostilities, in fly in December
All we've done is magic, there's still more things to experience
 Forget it, I'm in my mood, yeah, I've got to move to L.A. (L.A., L.A.)

translated_poem:
We loved each other tenderly
And it was summer
That was dying
When you left me
That year when Piccoli played "Les choses de la vie."
 For the rest of my life
I will remember it
On August fifteenth, in Paris
We invented
For ourselves
Rainy Brittanys
Near the Pantheon
At five in the morning
We took over the Latin Quarter
With laughter
With violins
We loved each other tenderly
And it was our hearts
That an airplane drew
In a blooming sky
And the audience was sad When our hands united
On the screen, we saw Piccoli die
It's always for others
That everything must end For us, the world was young
And Paris was ours
In the sky, a plane
was dancing
Yet, these words
From elsewhere
I love you
I love you
Scared me
And September, September
Counted our hours
 We loved each other tenderly
And it was summer
That was dying
When you left me
That year when Piccoli played "Les choses de la vie."
 For the rest of my life
I will remember it
And I have since been wearing
Like a great necklace
This infinite love
That you gave me
Above all, do not regret anything
Because, by walking out of my way,
You left me
A necklace of love

translated_poem:
You need to make a decision, my pretty shepherdess,
I believe you need to make a decision,
Roland wants to marry you, but you love Pierre,
I believe you need to make a decision.
Pick one or the other,
If you don't want to lose, because of your own fault,
Pierre and Roland, the crown prince or the shepherd.
Yes, you need to make a decision.
Roland wants to marry you, but you love Pierre,
I believe you need to make a decision.
Roland is a shepherd, and you are a shepherdess,
A king will never want you.
Between the one who loves you,
And the other who hasn't even seen or talked to you,
Pierre or Roland, the dream or the reality,
You must not back and fill.
Roland is a shepherd, and you are a shepherdess,
So, you need to go dance.
When you have danced all night,
You will know how to make the right decision.
Through the circle dance,
You will see that he's worth better than all the kings together in the world,
The one who has kingdoms to give to you,
A crown to keep.
You need to make a decision, my pretty shepherdess,
I believe you need to make a decision.
Roland wants to marry you, you will forget Pierre,
Love is here to decide.

translated_poem:
Way out there
Where the sea doesn't sing
The bird turns on my roof at the mercy of the four winds
 Weathercock, when the bird turns to the north, then I cry because your heart leaves me again
And then I go away and I'm afraid of never finding again the springs that the boat of time flooded our white shores with
 Weathercock, when you show the rising sun
the one I love today loves me just as much
since he opens his arms to me
since he stays close to me
since he doesn't think that there are other arms
that there are other girls than me
 Weathercock, every day, you give me a new love
but it's always the same love that weathervanes from east to west, like a sail
 When you show the rising sun, the one I love today loves me just as much since he opens his arms to me
since he stays close to me
since he doesn't think that there are other arms
that there are other girls than me

translated_poem:
A thousand fountains make the night sing,
a thousand fountains shrouded in rain,
and my heart counts the stones of the city.
A thousand fountains make love to life,
and I'm alone.
 A thousand fountains and a thousand yards in my hands,
and a thousand flowers
in the depths of my heart,
a thousand fountains make love to my heart, and I'm alone.
 Was life beautiful!
Were the nights ever tender!
Was the rain ever sweet! Was life beautiful!
I didn't know how to keep you,
and time passes
and time passes
and I do without love.
 A thousand fountains make the night sing,
a thousand fountains shrouded in rain,
and my heart counts the stones of the city.
A thousand fountains make love to my heart, and I'm alone.

translated_poem:
At first, I saw nothing but his gaze
Where all the oceans swayed
And in the crowd the door of the bar
Where he was leading me with a nonchalant air
 At first, I saw nothing but his sweater
With the white dancing name of a boat
And his two bare hands around my waist
As he smiled while searching for his words
 He was babbling in a funny French
I didn't understand what he meant
but I didn't needa be a genius
To guess that he wanted me
 At first, I saw nothing but the narrow room
With its window overlooking the courtyard And with a passionate heart, I fell asleep
Against his sweaty skin,
overwhelmed with love
 At first, I saw nothing but a big sun
That splashed the whole sky with joy
And suddenly I knew that
since the day before
Happiness had the eyes of a sailor
 At first, I saw nothing at the end of the pier
But a sad cargo ship swaying
And my cheek lost against his shoulder
As at each step we kissed
 As he said goodbye, his eyes
Were filled with sea spray
And I, poor girl, like
a fool
Who was sad,
I thought he was crying
 I should have seen that in those eyes
There was no room for sentiment
But when I saw that, it was too late
All my beautiful love had drowned in them

translated_poem:
When Cherbourg saw us
Walking toward the port
Your hand clenching mine
Seeing our dreamy stares
It must've thunk again
Here's two who love each other
Here's two who love each other
Two more lovebirds joining the world

Who will burn their hearts
In the fires of St. John
Once this insolent happiness
That makes people smirk

As they walk the streets
Has disappeared
 But Cherbourg still broke out
Its big blue umbrella
To celebrate us anyways
And the sea wind
Slapping the hatches
Collected vanilla scents for the two of us

Walking toward the port
Your hand clenching mine
Seeing our dreamy stares
It must've thunk again
Here's two who love each other

Two more lovebirds joining the world

The sun shone
On all the facades
A global accordion melody
Greeted us with a serenade

Like to newlyweds

Taking their love to the white sails
To set sail

Of a hundred thousand Sundays

That make eternity

Our love remained all alone at the end of the dock
Afraid of embarking
And I still cry about it

Cherbourg was right
To celebrate us anyways
With its shiploads

And accordion beats
It doesn't have so many loves

translated_poem:
A crew, a bottle of Jack, a suite and some pussies
A tower block and some weapons, a war and some gunshots
You keep yapping but you don't do anything, your word isn't worth shit
I'm a rat, I'm no hero, I'll carve your name on a bullet
Two-number sentences handed down in the courtroom
For some fucking bucks, a hundred K went in my watch
I'm angry for my old man, I'm angry for my hater
Nike boxes under the bed, my mother freaks out (Oh)
Counterfeits in the back of a cellar, an organisation of wrongdoers
A car and two false plates, I know every inch of my territory
Ten bullets deep in the skull (Scoundrel), ten liters in the ship's hold
We don't mix tracksuits and formal wear, in the tower like OG Maco
Kid, I have the Widow, fire under my raincoat
I'd rather overshadow them than hurt those bitches
I make this sweet bitch twerk on the knees of a conscious rapper (Yeah)
I'm like an enraged Cerberus that was taken out of his cage (Motherfucker)
 I pull up to the party (Oh), everything is illegal (Oh), fuck the hitmaker, bitch, fuck the lyricist (Motherfucker)
I won't save the Earth, fuck that, I can't leave my gang, I can't leave my business, no
I pull up to the party (Bang, bang), everything is illegal, cocain and hash in the documentary (Wrah)
I won't save the Earth (nineteen), fuck that, I can't leave my gang, I can't leave my business, no
 Italy, Chicago side, even the most righteous people can be bought
There are glass shards on your lithium watch when the aluminum shatters the windows
I go back home late, when the sky is black, I don't wake up for work
Bowler hat like Al Capone, I don't get big-headed like my friends
I'm here if we need to rob the State, I write it in italics, Agathe Amel, Ma√´lle or Rachel, really, I don't know which one I'm gonna bring, true shit, mate
Everything for the income, I don't do anything at a loss, iron between the belt and the tank top
I'm at the front, I only feel sorrow for those who don't respond to the call anymore
 The last thing you'll see is a helmet (Vroom), do you see it? And a man styled like Jimi Hendrix, do you see it?
My head sticks to the headrest, Sex Pistols, here comes the crooks
I leave the dressing room, she puts on lip gloss and mascara, motherfucker
 I pull up to the party (Oh), everything is illegal (Oh), fuck the hitmaker, bitch, fuck the lyricist (Motherfucker)
I won't save the Earth, fuck that, I can't leave my gang, I can't leave my business, no
I pull up to the party (Motherfucker), everything is illegal, cocain and hash in the documentary
I won't save the Earth (nineteen), fuck that, I can't leave my gang, I can't leave my business

translated_poem:
You were a child, men were needed
When the earth gives birth, it needs arms
 At the age of learning the names of the stars
Bent over the earth, you did not see them
 You built your home at the foot of this tree
Where the bird comes and sleeps but does not sing
 To keep your name alive, you chose the one
Who worked the earth next to you
 Your children, like you, have hands harder than the wood of the pitchfork and the grinding wheel
 Today, as before, you go to the earth
But this time it will be to rest
You didn't even know the man who made you
Earn your handful of wheat every day
 Maybe your children will know his
He did not pay a high price for your hands
And all he gave you, I'll tell you
Is this old plot of land where you will sleep

translated_poem:
Morning, bring forth the rising sun
Morning, at the moment of awakening
Come gently lay
Your dewy pearls
On the blooming nature
Dear to my heart
The sky has chosen my land
To create a new paradise
Where, far from troubles Dances an eternal spring
For lovers
 Sing, sing, my heart
The morning song
In the joy of life returning
 Morning, bring forth the rising sun
Morning, at the moment of awakening
Place in the beating heart
Of the one I'm waiting for
A gentle ray of love
Beautiful as the day
So that her first sigh
Responds to my first desire
Yes, the time has come
Where each lost kiss never returns
 Sing, sing, my heart
In the splendor of the day
Bring forth the sun of love

A hundred thousand horizons in front of us
Shared in happiness
All spread out from our hearts
And insane castles
And starry boats
And forgotten stars
And your eyes and my eyes
In an ocean of love

When comes the time of the hundred thousand seasons
A hundred thousand houses
Engraved with your name
Among the harvests of the Earth
A hundred thousand songs just for us
A hundred thousand horizons in front of us
Shared in happiness
All spread out from our hearts
And recognized countries
And overwhelmed forests
And protected sorrows
And your eyes and my eyes
In an ocean of love

translated_poem:
I have known passels of boys
Who had a passion only for drinking,
But Brandy is the one I love.
There actually was another one, I called him Gin, he was pale complected and green around the gills.
But oh, Brandy is the one I love.
There was a third one
named Sherry. He was pink and blond and soft like a girlie.
Oh, Brandy is the one I love.
And then a fourth one, I called him Bourbon. He was a little too dry for my taste, he brought the hell down on me.
No, Brandy is the one I love.
Brandy is wise and wild, dark and bright,
strong and gentle.
Brandy is the one I want.
I have known passels of boys who got drunk on Gin or Bourbon,
But Brandy is the one I love.
Too much Rum makes your head hot,
But too much Brandy gets your heart excited.
Hey, Brandy is the one I love.
There was a fifth one, I called him Rum.
When summer kicked in, he was one devil of a man.
Yes, Brandy is the one I love.
Then there was a sixth one, I called him Port.
He played some not very nice tricks on me.
Oh, Brandy is the one I love.
Finally, there was a seventh one, named Scotch.
All the girls had eyes only for him.
Yes, Brandy is the one I love.
Brandy is wise and wild, dark and bright,
strong and gentle.
Brandy is the one I want.
I have known passels of boys who got drunk on Gin or Bourbon,
But Brandy is the one I love.
Too much Rum makes your head hot,
But too much Brandy gets your heart excited.
Yes, Brandy is the one I love,
Brandy is the one I love
Brandy is the one I love.

original_poem:

translated_poem:
Near Luxembourg Gardens,
Passes by every day
A girl lost in love.
She has the color
Of heartaches,
The fragility of flowers,
Lovely, she is so lovely,
So fragile that next to her,
One might imagine
A tender swallow
Opening its wings,
The one they call
Morning glory,
Near Luxembourg Gardens,
Among the running children.
She saw him during the day, picking the fruit
That others pick at night.
In searching for love,
Ah, she lost herself,
Her heart has no resting place.
Lovely, she is so lovely,
From passes
To hanging bridges,
How can one imagine
An angel closer to an angel,
Farther from an angel,
Than this Beauty,
Beauty of the day, near Luxembourg Gardens,
Beauty, beauty has killed
Love.

et j'en ai bien du mal √† mon c≈ìur, mon c≈ìur,

translated_poem:
Love likes the spring creeks,
The dormant summer snow.
Love likes a child's cradle,
But love will never ever love me
Love will never love me.
 Like a blue bird, prisoner of the sun,
It was called the firebird
Like a blue bird, prisoner of the sun,
I made my prison in his eyes, his eyes,
I made my prison in his eyes.
 He loves another who does not love him,
And his eyes are lost in tears.
He loves another who does not love him,
And it hurts my heart, my heart,
 It hurts my heart.
 Love likes the spring creeks,
The dormant summer snow.
Love likes a child's cradle,
But love will never ever love me
Love will never love me.

translated_poem:
From town to town, from town to town
This is a long, longsome journey
From town to town, from town to town
I sing a long, long, long refrain
 I sleep here and there
Never in the same bed twice
I only sleep home every three months
As it happens, I hardly sleep at all
But I feel my fatigue fall away
Anytime I see a kind smile
Or a little wave hello
Everything's better, even the next day
 From town to town, from town to town
This is a long, longsome journey
From town to town, from town to town
I sing a long, long, long refrain
 If all I got in my head are songs
It's because these songs are meant
To brighten up your life a bit
And make you forget your worries
 From town to town, from town to town
This is a long, longsome journey
From town to town, from town to town
I sing a long, long, long refrain
 I drive day and night on the roads
The gals are beautiful, beautiful, beautiful like love
And when the time comes, I'll find one to love
I'm certain of it, so I keep goin'
 From town to town, from town town
Doin' this long, longsome journey
From town to town, from town to town
This is a long, longsome journey
From town to town, from town to town
This is a long, longsome journey
From town to town, from town to town
This is a long, longsome journey

translated_poem:
John Brown went to war to fight in Virginia
John Brown went to war to fight in Virginia
He sleeps deep in the ground in Virginia,
But his name will live forever.
 Glory, glory, hallelujah
Glory, glory, hallelujah
Glory, glory, hallelujah
His name will live forever.
 Down there, the black man was dyin' for cotton
Down there, the black man was dyin' for cotton
John Brown wanted to get him out of his prison
And raised a thousand drums.
 Glory, glory, hallelujah
Glory, glory, hallelujah
Glory, glory, hallelujah
His name will live forever.
 When he took the arsenal at dawn, he thought
That a whole army of slaves would come fight by his side,
But when a man's not ready, he's afraid of freedom,
And nobody moved.
 Glory, glory, hallelujah
Glory, glory, hallelujah
Glory, glory, hallelujah
His name will live forever.
 They hanged Johnny Brown in Virginia
They hanged Johnny Brown in Virginia,
But the flower he sowed is a-growin' today,
And his name will live forever.
 Glory, glory, hallelujah
Glory, glory, hallelujah
Glory, glory, hallelujah
His name will live forever.
 Mmm... (etc.)

translated_poem:
When Johnny goes to see his beloved H√©l√®ne, hooray, hooray,
He walks like a king to see his queen, hooray.
He can swallow up the world over
From the baker to the pastry chef
Gangway for Johnny when he goes to see his love
When Johnny sees his buddies at night, hooray, hooray,
They'll get drunk on wine and guitar, hooray.
What's more beautiful, I ask you,
Than three boys standing on their legs.
Watch out, gals, when Johnny sees his buddies.
When Johnny goes off to war far away, hooray, hooray,
Against people he knows little or nothing about, hooray.
On the day of glory, on his way back,
He walks a little less well than before
On his peg leg when Johnny goes off to war.
When Johnny married me not so long ago, hooray, hooray
There was no prouder girl than me in the whole world, hooray.
He built me a beautiful house,
And then he gave me three boys
Who will leave us when love calls them.
I taught them how to dance good, hooray, hooray,
How to jump over their fianc√©es' walls, hooray.
They have their hearts so close to their calves
That I'm sure forever

translated_poem:
Sleep, my love
The sun is still far from the day
We have all the time to love
And the night understands us
 Sleep, my love
Protected by my arms that surround
Your sleep with a curtain of happiness
Sleep onto my heart
 You are a king
Who holds his whole kingdom in his fingers
And who shivers of seeing
This enchanted kingdom fall down

I am here, forever by your side
To keep an eye, throughout
Each of your night, on your life, when you are asleep

Step by step on its way to happiness
And I amuse myself

Of your life that is beating so close to me
And I am feeling like a very gentle breath
Caressing my cheeks

I am here, forever by your side
But here comes the smile of the morning

translated_poem:
Come into my life
I hope to be loved by you
Come into my life
Do with me what ever you want
I have understood
I was wrong to search somewhere else
On my way
I didn't find happiness

You will be the fire in my heart
Come into my life
I understand, I need you

I want to wrap myself around your arms

 Come into my life

You will be the fire in my heart
 We will be fine
Let's not waste time

I was wrong to search somewhere else

I didn't find happiness

I hope to be loved by you

Do with me whatever you want

Now that there is no one there
Your photo on the mantelpiece
Which says that everything is over
 You used to say that we would grow into grown-ups
But now I realize
That each of us carries on their back
All their journey like a burden
 Memories of my childhood
Trials and hopes
And this flower that blooms
In the silence...
Your absence
 I sleep cuddled up in your smile
Between the past and the future
And the present that keeps me
From joining you, one fine morning
 In this journey with no return
I gave you all my love
Even when wearing out our body and soul
We can still love much more
 Of course, up there, somewhere
You must hear or see me
But speaking was even more tender
We could still understand each other
 My childhood has faded
Already, those are the gestures of another time
On films and on photos
You left much too early
 I remained on the path
With my life in my hands
No longer knowing what to do
To move forward toward the light
 All that remains for me in the course of days
In memory of your love
Is this flower that blooms
In the silence...
Your absence

When one is in the water?

Were deeply in love
But how to go about it

Were deeply in love
But how to go about it
When one is up high?

When one is up high?

But how to go about it
When one is up high?

Were deeply in love

translated_poem:
I don't dare sleep anymore
When I close my eyes
All I see is your body breathing
If you wanted me like you said you wanted me
Don't you think I'd be in your arms?
 I don't even think I dare lie to myself anymore
My heart wants to feel you when my head wants to run away
I'm scared to love, I'm scared that you love me
You're scared to love, you're scared to lose it all
 I'm still searching for myself in the backgorund of your love
I eat you up in the illusion of a deaf stare
Everyday I write you then I erase it
But I see your reflection in the mirror again
 I'm down in the dumps, I'm drinking red
I see everyhthing in black and I'm jealous
I can see it in your eyes
Yeah, you're my love
Babe, don't lie to yourself
 Just a sign from you
Make me cry
I don't care as long as it's from you
Scared to suffer, we'd rather not
But, away from us, we don't know what to hold on to
 I'm still searching for myself in the backgorund of your love
I eat you up in the illusion of a deaf stare
Everyday I write you then I erase it
But I see your reflection in the mirror again
 I'm down in the dumps, I'm drinking red
I see everyhthing in black and I'm jealous
I can see it in your eyes
Yeah, you're my love

I can see it in your eyes

translated_poem:
I was naive and single way back when.
I was studying algebra and Latin.
I didn't flirt, I woke up early,
I listened to Bach, Mozart, and read Voltaire.
 Gentle, she came to me in her panther skin...
She wore long satin pajamas...
As soon as I spoke, I sounded like a jerk.
I don't know why, I preferred to remain silent.
 I still confused fashion designers and fortune tellers.
I didn't give a dead rat about Lanvin
And the need for false eyelashes escaped me...
 But after two years of effort, I can claim to match from memory, with perfect taste, the blue of a necktie to the gray of her tender eyes...

translated_poem:
You and me, one last time
Would you have regrets if tonight
Reason goes out the window and our bodies attach?
The presence of our absence
Makes zero sense to me
 A mix of passion, sadness and poison
It's like a potion that I could drink with no moderation
Our bodies in harmony, our hearts hypnotized
It's a secret that the moon guards well
The sun won't find out
 Forbidden
Tonight is forbidden
The moon has a power that the sun's jealous of
Forbidden
Tonight is forbidden
The moon has a power when our lips meet

If I leave you, will you forget about me?
Skin to skin
I feel your pulse and it's telling me you're scared
Put a spell on me again
Forget about our mistakes
Guide our bodies
 A mix of passion, sadness and poison
It's like a potion that I could drink with no moderation
Our bodies in harmony, our hearts hypnotized
It's a secret that the moon guards well
The sun won't find out
 Forbidden

Il a fallu qu'un jour un b√ªcheron se l√®ve,

 Il a fallu qu'un jour un bateau le transporte
Et qu'un vieil artisan le pr√©f√®re au sapin,

 Voil√† comment, ce soir, je joue sur ma guitare

D'une graine emport√©e par un vent d√©risoire

 C'est la cha√Æne sans fin des d√©tails innombrables

Et s'√©panouir les fleurs au c≈ìur de mon jardin.
 Chacun n'est qu'un maillon de cette cha√Æne immense
Et ma vie n'est qu'un point perdu sur l'horizon
Mais il fallait l'amour de toute une existence
Pour qu'un arbre qui meurt devienne une chanson
 Dont les mots, par hasard, par des sentiers bizarres
Vont trouver leur bonheur au bout de nos chagrins
Et le temps, peu √† peu, s'endort dans nos m√©moires
Pour nous faire oublier qu'au d√©but du chemin
 C'est la cha√Æne sans fin des d√©tails innombrables
Qui fabrique nos jours et ressemble au destin,

Et jaillir la musique aux doigts des musiciens.
 Je n'√©tais qu'un maillon dans cette cha√Æne immense
Et ma vie n'est qu'un point perdu sur l'horizon
Mais il fallait l'amour de toute une existence

translated_poem:
It was necessary for a lumberjack to wake up one day
To fell a beautiful cypress tree to sell at the sawmill,
For a wood buff to wait patiently half of his life
To see the sap dry
 It was necessary for a boat to haul it one day,
For an old craftsman to prefer it over spruce,
For me to finally stop at his doorstep
And that, with a smile, he greeted me and shook my hand.
 That's how tonight, I play on my guitar
The incredible journey through the years
Of a seed carried by a trivial wind
To become a guitar in the back of a workshop.
 It is the never-ending chain of countless details,
Which shapes our days and resembles fate,
Causing rain to fall on sandy deserts
And flowers to bloom in the heart of my yard.
 Each person is just a link in this immense chain,
And my life is just a point lost on the horizon,
But it took the love of an entire lifetime
For a dying tree to become a song
 Whose words, by chance, through bizarre paths,
Will find their happiness at the end of our sorrows,
And time gradually falls asleep in our memories
To make us forget that, at the beginning of the journey
 It is the never-ending chain of countless details
Which shapes our days and resembles fate,
Causing rain to fall on sandy deserts,
And music to spurt out of the fingers of musicians.
 I was just a link in this immense chain
And my life is just a point lost on the horizon,
But it took the love of an entire lifetime
For a dying tree to become a song.
 But it took the love of an entire lifetime
For a dying tree to become a song.
 But it took the love of an entire lifetime
For a dying tree to become a song.

translated_poem:
Bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
Songs are like love
Oh bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
We believe that we're really going to be in love forever
And yet, one day we break up
 So... bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in the pan
Where did Pierre, Jacques, and all my friends go?
Bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in the pan
We were together on Sunday, and on Monday
they took the plane towards life and drifted away1
 You walk by my side
and it looks easy to love you
My heart is the same. But I no longer find
the music and choir of the streets
and all those that I knew yesterday
Did James Dean or Eddie Cochran
always have the same women?
Loves at first sight swept away, the world changed
 So... bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
You know that songs are like love
Bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
We believe that we're really going to be in love forever
And yet, one day we break up
 This world belongs to children:
They always want to love forever and ever
but never for a long time
They may still burn
those that they adored yesterday
The next day, when they'll have broken
their cars and their dolls
these children may then still tell us
- as they leave their games -
that everything turned out fine in the end
Yes, for the both of us
 I said bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
You know that songs are like love
Bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
We believe that we're really going to be in love forever
And yet, one day we break up
 Bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
You know that songs are like love
Oh bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
We believe that we're really going to be in love forever
And yet, one day we break up
 Oh yes bye bye...
It's nothing but a fire of ... ouch
 Oh bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
Songs are like love
Yes bye bye...
It's nothing but a flash in a pan
  1.
Literally "They took the airplane for life". Metaphor for people drifting apart from relationships.

I know it's lame and it drives you crazy
But what do you want?

I grit my teeth and rinse my front asphalt

translated_poem:
It's an amazing story that I'm going to tell you now
An old gentleman hadn't smiled since he was a little child
But one day, when he was walking down a very dark street with a hunchback wallowing in his misery,
a large fellow suddenly appeared to him, telling him: "Why don't you try singing this refrain?"
 Boom boom, boom boom
It's an enchanting song
Boom boom, boom boom
Your eyes weren't made for crying
 Every since that day, the old gentleman no longer really thought about anything other than having a good time
The large fellow never appeared to him again, but he left his secret with him
I, as the one talking to you, have sung a lot, but I do believe that I've neither ever
felt such a desire to laugh nor felt this strong of a strange impact, except when singing this refrain again
 Boom boom, boom boom
It's an enchanting song
Boom boom, boom boom
Your eyes weren't made for crying
 Boom boom, boom boom
is what this enchanting tune rather sings
Boom boom, boom boom
Life is too short for crying
 Boom boom, boom boom
It's an enchanting song...

translated_poem:

 I'm going to tell you something, If it's important to you
On a Saturday night in Paris, I was getting ready to go out
I was getting ready to go out
I'm going to tell you something, If it's important to you
On a Saturday night in Paris, I was getting ready to go out
I felt free, I felt myself breathing

Of everything that doesn't go smoothly
I could have moved the world for you, you know that
 But I am fallen in a dream
Together, we could see the sea
But everything around me have disappeared

Together, we could drink the sea
But there's nothing around me

But I am always running and it turns him mad
That there are all these people around us

Together, we could see the sea

But I am fallen in a dream
Together, we could drink the sea
But there's nothing around me

Even the ground has failed me
The water is running till our legs
Very slowly, I have counted
The minutes before my heart stops
All the cocktails that one made through this party
What did you feel when I lost my head ?
 Were you holding me?
were you holding me ?
were you ...

translated_poem:
Bernadette,
Don't push me away because without you I wouldn't know where to go
Bernadette
Don't push me away or I'll have to go love others to forget you
 But, if I must leave
I'd like you to know beforehand
That I've always been left, I've laways been abandoned
And that I've always thought for two, lived for two
And that I've never learned how to say farewell
But you know that I've always, always known how to be unhappy

Don't push me away because without you I wouldn't know where to go

Don't push me away or I'll have to go love others to forget you
 You are right, I have everything a man wants
But if you're not here, it's as though my eyes are closed
I've lived for an ideal, oh my Bernadette (Oh Bernadette)
I've dismissed all my friends for Bernadette (pour Bernadette)

Don't push me away because without you I wouldn't know where to go

Don't push me away or I'll have to go love others to forget you

Then, look at me
Yes, if you've never seen a man cry
Then, look at me,
And if I must leave, I want you to know one more time
That life is too short, that we don't have the time
To cheat, to fight, to listen to people
When they tell you that I'm not good enough for you
Oh, tell them that I know how to love
And I'm not waiting for them for this

Remember
Have mercy on me
Don't push me away

Remember, when you sing a song
Remember me when you drink wine
Oh, remember
When you make love
Remember me
Oh Bernadette
Don't push me away

Wandering heart, leaving day to day,
Today you must choose,
You counted on my love too much,
And on your smile,
Being together, is sharing everything,

Your eyes admit it to me
So say it to me or scream it,

But love me above all

translated_poem:
Staring into space
You wander the streets and the cobblestone
A reminder of past beauty
You're proud to be born in this century
Yet, it's not so great
Your grandparents keep telling you
Because despair is big
As much as loneliness
Communication is spreading*
No one left in isolation anymore
Yet, on this corner of earth
You're wandering all alone
Time to reflect on the situation
To wake up all these people
Agitated by their routine
They can't see they're heading for ruin
 Decline, decline, decline
France declines
Decline, decline, decline
France declines
 The golden century of abortion
The golden century of euthanasia
We murder the most inconveniencing
Babies and grandparents
They make you believe that your ballot paper
Gives you some power
That everything's going to change tonight
But right-wing or left-wing, they're all friends
You walk, you move on
A drug dealer on every corner
From time to time an ambulance to
Break the silence
We told you, the golden century
A failing society
Persecuted infants
Perverted spirits

translated_poem:
I have experienced Christmases away from the city
Where we would happily set off with torches in our hands
It was before airplanes and automobiles
And the cold would bite us as we walked along the small paths
The whole church, illuminated with candles,
Trembled through its walls during the midnight mass
As we all came to pray to the holy virgin
It was better than going to the theatre, and it didn't cost anything
 Christmas of old
You had a soul
A certain je ne sais quoi
Christmas of old
 On our way back, we would have a real holiday meal
My mother would cook, and I was the kitchen help
My father would knead the dough for the cake
We would skewer a hog and five or six capons
In the room where a magnificent Christmas tree stood
Trimmed with candles and silver paper
In order to reach the table's height,
A messy bunch of children would climb on the benches
 Christmas of old
You had a soul
A certain je ne sais quoi
Christmas of old
 Anymore, we have plastic Christmas trees
Snow is made by a sprayer
Candles have been replaced by electric bulbs
The Yule log comes straight from the pastry shop
No need to go out, the mass is broadcast
By all the radios and televisions
We have Monsignor live from the church
And when we're sleepy, we simply cut the set off
 Christmas of old
My entire childhood
Is contained within those words
Christmas of old

translated_poem:
The moon, with her distracted hands,
Dropped down from up above - lo', see !
Her big-sized silver-speckled fan
On the blue carpet of the sea.
 To get it back, leans and extends
Her beautiful silvery arm;
But the fan escapes her white hand,
By the soft flow carried afar.
 To give it back to you, O Moon,
I could into the Abyss jump,
If you could from the sky go down,
If I could to the sky go up.

a knife's edge1pale-faced

and I used to say it wrong
