translated_poem:
Words fly away
Without leaving any other trace
Than a ray of light
A bit of air
 Words fly away
And constantly return
To their birthplace
The silence

translated_poem:
Working is good for one's health
Doing nothing leads to maintaining health
Wheelhorses and workhorses
Do not make old bones.
 Those who rush around hurriedly
By car, subway or bike
Are they going to catch a funny movie?
Nah, they're going to their workplace.
 Working is good for one's health
Doing nothing leads to maintaining health
Wheelhorses and workhorses
Do not make old bones.
 They work for eleven months to take a vacation
They are already tired when vacation starts
After a month's rest, they become strong
But then it's time to go back to work.
 Working is good for one's health
Doing nothing leads to maintaining health
Wheelhorses and workhorses
Do not make old bones.
 To think that there's passels of people
Who run after work non-stop
For me, work runs after me
It's not likely to soon catch up to me.
 Working is good for one's health
Doing nothing leads to maintaining health
Wheelhorses and workhorses
Do not make old bones.
 Now, even in the smallest of villages
People slave away like monkeys
To afford all the comforts
When they have everything, well, they're already dead.
 Working is good for one's health
Doing nothing leads to maintaining health
Wheelhorses and workhorses
Do not make old bones.
 Working is good for one's health
Doing nothing leads to maintaining health
Wheelhorses and workhorses
Do not make old bones.

translated_poem:
Say, how long's it been since you saw a poplar tree
And a wildflower last?
If you have any sorrows
To forget them, there's always a train station and a train
Change skies, come see the world
Come see the sun and the rivers...
 Come over to my place, it's springtime and birds are singin'
Come over to my place, all the birds are waitin' for you!
Apple trees are bloomin'
They will soothe your heart
You who are all in tears
Don't stay in the city...
 Come over to my place, it's springtime and birds are singin'
Come over to my place, all the birds are waitin' for you!
Near the big blue ponds
And in the hollow paths
We'll both go
‚ÄîForgetting will be easy
 The first morning breeze will be your friend
When you go and sit in the yard
And then time will pass by, and you'll say to me,
"All my past is far away already."
You will open a window
One fine morning, you'll be reborn
 Oh, come over to my place, it's springtime and birds are singin'
Come over to my place, all the birds are waitin' for you!
Apple trees are bloomin'
They will soothe your heart
You who are all in tears
Don't stay in the city...
 Come over to my place, it's springtime and birds are singin'
Come over to my place, all the birds are waitin' for you!
Near the big blue ponds
And in the hollow paths

translated_poem:
I fluttered slowly through the dark
Looking like a funeral procession
I breathed in the night air
I rowed without making a sound
 In the depths of silence
Right while I was overcome
By the incandescent heat
Of the lovely fruit which it came from
 My mother warned me
Watch out for naked light bulbs
Stay far back from those globes
That set fire to your dress
 The insomniac butterflies
Find an aphrodisiac there
Death is on its way
At best you'll go mad
 Don't let yourself be consumed
By one of these fools
My mother told me, Pegasus
Love is nothing but hot air
 You're a nocturnal being
Admirer of the moon
And the pale brilliance
Of the stars
 But upon seeing this whiteness
And the drawing of her hips
Within a golden halo
I said farewell to this world
 To the wandering moon
Beautiful as a woman in love
To my reason that berates me
The grave you dig is your own
 I fluttered slowly through the dark
Looking like a funeral procession
I breathed in the night air
I rowed without making a sound
 In the depths of silence
I saw my life march past
Up to the day of my birth
As the light bulb blew out

If I were you I would choose

translated_poem:
There are times when a man has to say certain things,
Even when he knows it's gonna make someone unhappy.
Before I say another word, let me tell you I love you,
Let me say these words as gently as I can.
 "There's been another woman in my life,
But that doesn't mean I've stopped loving you.
I've never slept with her, and I probably never will,
But there's just this empty place inside of me that only she
can fill."
 Drama between two loves,
I'm torn between them,
Between you and her
My heart is unhappy
Drama between two loves,
I'm torn apart,
Loving both of you is breaking all the rules
 You mustn't think you failed me just because there's someone else,
You're the only first love that ever really mattered
And all the things I ever said, I swear they still are true,
No one else will ever have the part of me I gave to you.
 Drama between two loves,
I'm torn between them,
Between you and her
My heart is unhappy.
Drama between two loves,
I'm torn apart,
Loving both of you is breaking all the rules
 Couldn't really blame you if you decided to walk away
But deep down, with everything I feel inside, I'm asking you to stay.
 Drama between two loves,
I'm torn between them,
Between you and her
My heart is unhappy.
Drama between two loves,
I'm torn apart,
Loving both of you is breaking all the rules
 Drama between two loves,
I'm torn between them,
Between you and her
My heart is unhappy.
Drama between two loves...

translated_poem:
Once upon a time, there was a king's daughter
Whose heart was full of sadness.
Locked away day and night
At the top of a tower
She cried all the time
One day, taking flight,
A genial nightingale
Came and told the princess
"I bring you hope"
And it's to see it again
That she sang at night
 Nightingale, nightingale of my love
As soon as midnight strikes
When the moon shines
Come sing under my window
Nightingale, nightingale of my love
When your song rises
My sorrow will fly away
And love may come
Tonight, under my window
Come back, genial nightingale
 The nightingale returned, landed
On the hand of the beautiful princess
She petted it, then kissed it
And it transformed
Into a charming prince
Who became the beau
Of his lovely mistress
And that's why since then
The girls of the land
Sing every night
 Nightingale, nightingale of my love
As soon as midnight strikes
When the moon shines,
Come sing under my window
Nightingale, nightingale of my love
When your song rises
My sorrow will fly away
And love may come
Tonight, under my window
Come back, genial nightingale
 Nightingale, nightingale!

translated_poem:
If someone's left you on an island without a shore
If love has detached from you
If you're looking for a light in the gray of the city
Remember that I kept for you
 A garden in my heart where you can come if you cry
Where I wait, I wait to meet you again
A garden in my heart where I kept only one flower
A flower the color of friendship
 I know those moments when the sky's in tears
When the heart gets lost in that old north wind
Talk to me, if you want, or don't talk at all
That day, you'll still find
 A garden in my heart Where you can come if you cry
Where I wait, I wait to meet you again
This garden is wide open in summer, fall, or even in winter
In the bright sun of friendship
 The sun's waiting for you at the corner of my street
Yeah, even if your heart's cold,
Yeah, you'll come and you'll find
Yeah, you'll always find
 A garden in my heart where you can come if you cry
Where I wait to meet you again
A garden in my heart where I kept only one flower
A flower the color of friendship
 This garden is wide open in summer, fall, and even in winter...

In a corner of England
Have you met
An old lonely lady named
Miss Felicity Gray?
She lives with her maid
In a discreet cottage
She associates with no one

Every Sunday at eleven o'clock sharp

Would disappear at her place, mysteriously
Like Miss Felicity Gray

Everybody laughs at a clown, so why don't you? Everybody loves a clown, so why don't you?
They all laugh when they see me coming
But you don't laugh, you just stand up and leave
But do you know how much this clown has hurt seeing you leave?
 Everybody laughs at a clown, so why don't you? Everybody loves a clown, so why don't you?
Under my mask, people think I'm happy, but come a little closer
And read in my eyes
There, you'll see that this clown cries silently
Because you don't love him

I only want a look from you

If ever, one day

You would know how much this clown has hurt, and you would make him laugh
 But as of right now, you don't love this clown
Everybody laughs at a clown, so why don't you?
Everybody laughs at a clown, so why don'tyou?
Everybody laughs at a clown, so why don't you?

original_poem:
Debout les damnes de la terre!

Eteindre l'ardente lumiere
Que verse le nouveau soleil
 Debout, debout, les damnes de la terre!
Ceux qu'on ecrase en les charniers humains
Debout, debout, les forcats de misere!
Unissons-nous, Latins, Slaves, Germains
 Que la troisieme Republique
Se prostitue au tsar pendeur
Qu'une foule extralunatique
Adore l'exterminateur!
Puisqu'il faut que tout disparaisse
Peu nous importe! C'est la fin
Partout les peuples en detresse
S'eveillent se donnant la main
 Debout, debout, les damnes de la terre!
Ceux qu'on ecrase en les charniers humains
Debout, debout, les forcats de misere!
Unissons-nous, Latins, Slaves, Germains
 Bons bourgeois que Cesar vous garde
Cesar aux grands ou petits bras:
Pape, Republique batarde
Les tocsins sonnent votre glas
Rois de l'or hideux et feroces

Demain auront de rouges noces

Ceux qu'on ecrase en les charniers humains

Unissons-nous, Latins, Slaves, Germains

Mais il vient le temps d'Anarchie
Ou, dans l'immense apaisement
Loups de France et de Siberie
Loups humains jeuneront de sang
 Debout, debout, les damnes de la terre!
Ceux qu'on ecrase en les charniers humains
Debout, debout, les forcats de misere!

translated_poem:
Rise up!Wretched of the Earth!
The terrified despots
Feeling a crater under their step
In the past are trapped
Their mad and murderous league
Would want to from the scarlet horizon
Extinguish the fiery light
The new sun pours
 Rise up,rise up,wretched of the Earth!
Those crushed in the charnel house
Rise up,rise up,the convicts of misery!
Unite,Latins,Slavs,Germans
 The Third Republic
She's a prostitute to the tsar hangman
An extralunatic crowd
Adores the exterminator!
Since everything must disappear
We do not care!It is the end
Everywhere people in distress
Waking up,shaking hands
 Rise up,rise up,wretched of the Earth!
Those crushed in the charnel house
Rise up,rise up,the convicts of misery!
Unite,Latins,Slavs,Germans
 You protect bourgeois like Caeser
"Caeser"s hide into big or little arms:
Behind Pope,or in the bastard Republic
The toscins are alarming your end
You gold kings hideous and ferocious
The fianc√©s you kill
Will have a red wedding tomorrow
Let the tocsins,ring, ring, ring
 Rise up,rise up,wretched of the Earth!
Those crushed in the charnel house
Rise up,rise up,the convicts of misery!
Unite,Latins,Slavs,Germans
 The despots want the war
To slit the herd's throat
To cement every border
As we consecrate the graves
But the time of anarchy comes
When in a great calm
Wolves of France and Siberia
Human wolves will fast with blood
 Rise up,rise up,wretched of the Earth!
Those crushed in the charnel house
Rise up,rise up,the convicts of misery!
Unite,Latins,Slavs,Germans

translated_poem:
When I was eight, I was in love with my school teacher
I would have married her and we could have been happy together
But now, I want to get married only after I turn thirty
Yeah, I want to get married, but only after experiencing everything
 When I was seventeen, I was madly in love with a sweet blonde with blue eyes
I told her she was the woman of my life, and begged for her to wait for me
You see, I want to get married, but only after I turn thirty
Yeah, I want to get married, but only after experiencing everything
 As time goes by, I see all my friends happy to leave their bachelor life behind
But if soon I'm the only one left, then so be it
However, time will pass, and I will probably meet a girl and fall in love
I will marry her, and like in romantic novels, we will have many children
But as of now, I don't want to get married, not before I turn thirty
No, I don't want to get married because I want to experience everything first

translated_poem:
[Sophie]
Where's the Empress?
 [Lady in waiting]
She's still sleeping, your highness
 [Sophie]
So it is high time she is woken!
 The Empress is still young
We should all make an effort
She should be inculcated with sense
Etiquette and discipline
She is the child of country folk
 [Court lady]
Really, what?
 [Sophie]
She doesn't care about her duty
 [Lady of the Court]
What an embarrassment
 [Sophie]
She's never had to obey, has never submitted herself and only loves herself too much
An empress shines, her duty is to be worthy
Thinking only of the crown, she resigns herself
 [Ladies of the Court]
Indeed!
 [Elisabeth]
What's happening?
 [Sophie]
No one here lazes about in bed
 [Elisabeth]
Why?
 [Sophie]
Idleness, I banned it
 [Elisabeth]
I was so tired
 [Sophie]
The day starts at 5 o'clock
As soon as the clock sounds, the palace gets up
 [Elisabeth]
Fran√ßois-Joseph really insisted
He wanted me to rest
 [Sophie]
Oh, but from what
I questioned him
You conserved yourself last night
 [Elisabeth]
It couldn't be!
 [Sophie]
I certainly agree!
 [Elisabeth]
I can't believe that he'd betray me
 [Sophie]
He has no secrets from me
 [Elisabeth]
Not true!
 [Sophie]
Ask him yourself
 [Elisabeth]
Oh, but yes I will
 [Sophie]
He is with me
Believe me, I want only the good for him
 [Elisabeth]
Yes, of course!
 [Sophie]
And to argue isn't useful
 [Elisabeth]
I know!
 [Sophie]
Adapt yourself to the ceremonial
Take pains, you'll make me happy
 [Elisabeth]
I want to ride horses -
 [Sophie]
My God!
 [Lady of the Court]
That's too risky
 [Sophie]
The Empress doesn't trot!
 [Lady in waiting]
That's repugnant!
 [Elisabeth]
And why not?
 [Sophie]
Protocol, seeing that one doesn't
Flit around in any way
 [Sophie & Ladies of the Court]
An empress shines
Her duty is to be worthy
Thinking only of the crown
She resigns herself
 [Sophie]
And now let us see your teeth!
 [Ladies of the Court]
Prudent!
 [Elisabeth]
My what?
 [Lady of the Court]
Normal
 [Sophie]
What's the problem?
 [Lady of the Court]
Open your mouth wide
 [Sophie]
They are very yellow, it's distressing
 [Elisabeth]
Am I a horse?
 [Sophie]
No, you are an ideal!
 [Elisabeth]
You never stop criticising me
I have the right to do nothing!
 [Sophie]
I want to see you as empress
But for that, you must be trained
 [Elisabeth]
I believe, at heart, you are jealous
 [Sophie]
Jealous, of you
Come on then, make me laugh!
 [Elisabeth]
I want...
 [Sophie]
First learn humility!
 [Elisabeth]
I would like...
 [Sophie]
No!
 [Elisabeth]
Fran√ßois-Joseph, help me
I am too unhappy!
 [Ladies of the Court]
An empress shines
Her duty is to be worthy
Thinking only of the crown
She resigns herself
 [Sophie]
Let me do it, [?]
Let me see, let me [?]
Let me do it, [?]
Let me see, I will train her
 [Elisabeth]
She imprisons me, it's torture
Help me, don't leave me alone!
 [Fran√ßois-Joseph]
Pride doesn't do anything in this place
Believe me, it would be better for both of us
If you do what my mother tells you
 [Sophie]
Be strict!
Be hard!

translated_poem:
Take them by surprise
Knock them out
Make them invalid
The awful speeches
From the sowers of chaos
Whom are nitpicking
With the whipping boy
 Those whose wrongdoing
In the eyes of these madmen
Is not to be wearing
The right complexion
And whom we want to kick out
Which by the way is what
Quietly work at
Already Mr Pasqua
 The political phoney
Serving it as a pedestal
The nationalism
Vociferates and settles in
And perched like a rooster
On the back of fascism
The beast at bay
Dreams of giving birth
 To get babies
And makes a call
To the vox populi
In need of a despot
In the democracies
Ready to come apart
Where the beast is hard at it
To which only misses the fuse
To set things on fire
 The foul beast
that rises, that rises, that rises, that rises ...
 To the shame ladder
Where nasty cunts climb
With foreheads so narrow
And so much national
That a little more head
On the shoulders
Wouldn't do them any harm
 In this amnesiac age
Where some hysterics
Are still talking about
Of the final solution
Where Adolf Butogaz
And his hideous burners
Point back to his dull ideas
And get red hot
 Of all the mourners
bitter and sectarian
With a reactionary mind
Who turn back the clock
And still haven't understood
That we all live
Iin the same country
And that it's called Earth

translated_poem:
I may not be very old indeed
But I know love
When a girl makes you unhappy
Don't cry every day
If you want for her to pay attention to you
And attach herself to you
If you want for her to be
Truly only yours
 Oh, tell her you love her like mad
Tell her you'll love her for life
Tell her, tell her, oh tell her, yeah, tell her
 I may not be very old indeed
But I know love
If you want to finally be happy
Come on out into the daylight
Don't wait until tomorrow
To shout out this love
Take her by the hand
Without further ado
 And...
Tell her you love her like mad
Tell her you'll love her for life
Tell her, tell her, oh tell her, yeah, tell her
 Me too, just like you
I hesitated for a long time
But love won
'Cause my heart didn't know
Until this fine day
When, yeah! Yeah, someone told me: oh, you!
 I may not be very old indeed
But I know love
If a girl makes you unhappy
Don't cry every day
If you want for her to pay attention to you
And attach herself to you
If you want for her to be
Yours, only yours
 Oh, tell her you love her like mad
Tell her you'll love her for life
Tell her, tell her, oh tell her, yeah, tell her
 Oh, take her by the hand
And tell her nice and loud
And say it to her
Oh, it's up to you girls to shout now
Oh, shout on out!
 Oh, shout to her!
Oh, take her by the hand now!

translated_poem:
When I left you last night
The whole city was asleep.
Walking on the street, I yawned alone, feeling lonely and blue
 On Bench 21 at Republic Metro Station, I laid down
I just wanted to be left alone
To dream of you, to dream of you, to dream of you
 The air was damp, the night freezing
I closed my eyes
I didn't want to cause any trouble
I was miserable
 But on Bench 21 at Republic Metro Station
I was being watched
I was being watched from Bench 21
By a man in, by a man in, by a man in blue
 With a suspicious look
He questioned me
For a whole hour
Then he confiscated my ID
With an authoritative air
 Now I'm on the bench at the police station
Finally nice and warm
Finally, I'll have the whole night to dream of you, to dream of you, to dream of you
 But on Bench 21 at Republic Metro Station, I laid down
I just wanted to be left alone
To dream of you, to dream of you, to dream of you

translated_poem:
[Voce of the Judge]

Why did you kill Empress Elisabeth?
 [Lucheni]
Go to hell1
 [Judge's Voice]
Answer, Lucheni!
 [Lucheni]
Why, why?
Night, after night, after night the same question for 120 years.
Why this examination?
Shit.1 I am dead!
 [Judge's Voice]
The cruel attempt targeting the Empress of Austria...
 [Lucheni]
Go fuck yourself!1
 [Judge's Voice]
Will you finally tell us why!
 [Lucheni]
Why?
I assassinated her because she wanted it.
 [Judge's Voice]
Don't speak nonsense!
 [Lucheni]
She wanted it.
I have honourable witnesses.
 [Judge's Voice]
Who are these witnesses?
 [Lucheni]
Her contemporaries, nothing but that.
None of them has found peace...
And they have only one subject of conversation.... Elisabeth!
 [The Dead]
The old world no longer exists
Flesh rots, the heart goes to sleep

From our condemned world
We know no issue

And virtue makes us sick
We know very well that they curse us
All those who erect the barricades
 Our souls are in decrepitude
We don't have anything do do, good or evil
We don't fear baseness any longer
And beauty is banal to us
 No further age of man will come again
We have destroyed all the borders
Before our eyes, we have seen
The entire monarchy sink
 And all the questions have been asked
And we waver on the edge of the void
We are all prisoners
Who are contemplating suicide

And we are surviving one more day
We will be there, oh fresh rose
When destiny will have conquered you
Elisabeth!

translated_poem:
I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you
What are you doing?
 I emptied out my dresser, threw away my old packages
My binders full of dark thoughts and failed pictures
Hunted down in every corner, the waste paper and the grime
The weekly newspapers, the books, I made room for you
Room, room, space, what to do, once you love one another?
Whatever we do, we get attached, we eat away at each other, we suffocate each other, we extinguish each other.
 I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you
What are you doing?
 I left everything open, aired out the rugs
And I beat my bed, this great dust nest
Chased the spiders, vacuumed the grubby beasts
Cleaned inside my head, swept away the past
Past, past, past, why don't you pass, it's spring, I've got all the time in the world
All of the future, hobbies, all of my time, I wait for you.
 I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you
What are you doing?
 I've soaped up the walls, gotten the old wallpaper off
Filled in all the fissures, plastered, scraped, sanded
Redid all of the painting, off white, egg shell
Six layers so that it lasts, oh, it smells new
New, new, new, it's so beautiful it's lacquered, it's pretty
It smells good, hang on, it's not dry, it's still so fresh.
 I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you, I wait for you
What are you doing? I'm waiting for you.

translated_poem:
Sweet, my Candy, Candy
Like your name, you know your skin is too sweet
Candy, my sweet, sweet
When one tastes you
They can no longer do without you
 Like the river glides gently toward the sea
I glide toward your arms
Like birds are attracted to the sun
I am attracted to you
 Ah, Sweet! Ah, Candy, Candy!
Under the midday sky
You are truly too beautiful, Candy, ah, sweet, sweet!
A candy in my mouth
Melts slower than I do when you touch me
 And don't smile when I lay down at your feet the withered petals
Of my enamored heart
For you, I want to pluck
Much longer than a summer
 Ah-ah-ah, you know that you have soft skin!
Yeah, you know that your mouth is sweet, yeah!
And you make your kisses sweet, eh eh eh!
Yeah, you really have soft skin
Yeah, truly your mouth is sweet
And you make your love sweet, eh eh eh!
I could never do without it anymore, oh no!
 Ah, sweet, ah-ah, Candy, Candy!
Like your name, you know your skin is too sweet
Ah-ah-ah, Candy! Ah, sweet, sweet!
You make your kisses sweet, yeah yeah yeah!
Yeah, you really have soft... Oh yeah!
Yeah, you really have soft skin
Yeah, truly your mouth is sweet, yeah!

translated_poem:
Lulu sold his paintings
Jacquot washed dishes in a bar
D√©d√© tasted wines
I was a stock handler at the Halles
And G√©g√© washed windows
Pierrot did nothing
 We emptied our pockets
To buy an old junker of a car
With a rusty hood
That dreamed of Provence
And died in Fontainebleau
 We lit a cigarette and everything lit up
And it was a party, on the fourteenth of July
There was never a pal too many
In Jojo's bunch
There were fewer nights without a guitar than days without bread
We shared everything and had nothing
Were we ever wild!
Did we little care!
Did we have a good time!
 We rented for peanuts
The four walls of an old attic
About to collapse
But for a whole fortune
We wouldn't have moved
 We lit a cigarette and everything lit up
And it was a party, on the fourteenth of July
There was never a pal too many
In Jojo's bunch
There were fewer nights without a guitar than days without bread
We shared everything and had nothing
Were we ever wild!
Did we little care!
Did we have a good time!
 Lucienne set sail
And Jacques bought a bar
Where Andr√© drinks water
I'm not a stock handler at the Halles anymore
Roger audits taxes
Pierre's looking for a job
 I changed my guitar
But I kept like a gift
This tune that warms me up
From the depths of my memory
The one from Jojo's bunch
 We lit a cigarette and everything lit up
And it was a party, on the fourteenth of July
There was never a pal too many
In Jojo's bunch
There were fewer nights without a guitar than days without bread
We shared everything and had nothing
Were we ever wild!
Did we little care!
Did we have a good time!

translated_poem:
I liked the school teacher
He read us poetry
But today, the city is mad :
Even the children have rifles.
 Where is Pr√©vert's song?
All the birds have disappeared.
There is no wood for the winter
And not a tree in the streets.
 Far is the cherry season
And the ways of lovers.
Girls give themselves for currency
And boys fight with each other.
 I liked the school teacher.
He made us sing standing
And now we hide in basements.
The whole country at its knees.
 He left without his briefcase.
We couldn't tell him goodbye.
They go pray in churches
And make war in God's name.
 I liked the school teacher,
His kind smile and his gentle eyes.
He spoke freely
And made us believe in ourselves.
 What do you want me to tell you?
He fell before my eyes.
I saw the blood on his shirt.
I am fourteen years old and I am old.

Mais tu es l√† pourtant, sur les chemins perdus de ma m√©moire, tu es toujours si douce √† mon souvenir
 Je ne me tiens pas √† toi comme le lierre qui s'accroche autour des rochers
Et surtout pas parce que les gens disent que nous sommes fait pour nous aimer
Ce ne sont pas les promesses, les contrats ni les mots d'amour qui chaque fois me poussent √† te revenir
C'est pourquoi toujours, sur les chemins perdus de ma m√©moire, je te retrouve si douce √† mon souvenir
 Et malgr√© les distances et les oc√©ans et les champs de bl√© qui toujours nous s√©parent
Malgr√© quelques filles toujours un peu tristes, lorsqu'au matin je leur dis "au revoir"
Je peux encore courir le monde, la pluie peut me mouiller et le soleil me br√ªler jusqu'√† en mourir
Je n'irai pas sur les chemins o√π je ne peux te voir te promener si douce √† mon souvenir
 Je ne sais pas si j'arriverai jamais un jour au bout de mon voyage
Ni si jamais je me lasserai de changer tous les jours de paysage
Mais je sais qu'un jour je reviendrai quand je n'aurai plus la force de courir
Vers ta maison sur les chemins perdus de ma m√©moire et tu seras l√† si douce √† mon souvenir...
translated_poem:
Your home is known to be open to anybody who's grievin'
Whenever I'm sad, I find myself searchin' for its path
Everybody knows that nothing and nobody's ever been able to hold me back
Yet, you're still there on the lost paths of my memory
You're always so gentle on my mind
 I don't cling to you like ivy on a rock
And certainly not because people say that we're meant to love each other
It's not the promises, contracts, or words of love
That always drive me to come back to you
That's why, always, on the lost paths of my memory
I find you so gentle on my mind
 Despite the distances and oceans and wheat fields that always separate us
Despite a few girls who are always a bit sad when I kiss them goodbye in the morning
I can still run the world, rain may soak me, and the sun may burn me 'til death
I won't go on paths where I can't see you walking
So gentle on my mind
 I don't know if I'll ever reach the end of my journey
Nor if I'll ever tire of changing my surroundings every day
But I know that one day I'll come back
When I no longer have the strength to run to your home on the lost paths of my memory
And you'll be there, so gentle on my mind...

translated_poem:
I told my children, my baby elephants
"Look at the white man, there, that's a president
He's the one smiling and holding a rifle
He leads a country where there are no elephants
- Then what do they have over there?"
"They don't have elephants but they have sheep
Herds of sheep and then a president
- What do they do, these sheep?
- They never have the time
- And him, what's he doing here?
- He comes to kill time
- Does he have children, this mister President?
Asked my children in their elephant tongue
"Yes, of course, he does and when they grow up
They'll go to the ENA, they'll be presidents
- Where is the ENA?
"Where is the ENA? Is it far from here?
Is it in Kenya?
- Oh no, it's in Paris
- And Paris, where is that?
- It's behind the meadow
Come on now, that's enough, he's starting to shoot!"
They've gotten old Paul who couldn't run anymore
Mauricette and Fredo who were scratching their backs
They were defenseless, I'm not kidding
It could have been worse, we were lucky
What do they have there then?
We're nice and warm, in the deep end of the wilderness
We push each other to the edge of the water, we splash each other
We make the flies in our ears flee
Afterwards, we take naps naked in the sunlight
We're not really savages, just a little stout
All rounded eyes, not mean, head in the clouds
We travel with slow steps, that's why we're wise
We come from the heart of time, before presidents
"Where is the ENA?"

translated_poem:
The wind comes from the sea
The wave follows its course
A woman with green eyes laughed at my loves
And my shoes will never stop traveling
 The days go by the same
And I have nothing on
But a little sun
That has tanned my skin
And my shoes will never stop traveling
 Time wears out life
Time wears out love
It's never coming back
And if I don't take anything with me
It's because on the last morning
I will leave naked
As I came
How many cities I have seen that led to suburbs
To people so docile
that they're still working
And my shoes will never stop traveling
 We carry cotton
We carry wheat
When the season returns
We have to start over again
And my shoes will never stop traveling
will never stop traveling

translated_poem:
The riveted glance on their eyelids
Waiting for a signal
I become pale
All their questions have made me feel ill at ease
Will I be strong
To retort again
 But to serve as a shield to my innocence
I would confront, without hesitating, their cruel offences
That stun me, make me doubt my competencies
But I believe that I would give myself one more chance
 To be present, over the years1
To be living, to defy the times
To be present, over the years
Life still gives me the need to defend myself
 Sometimes I don't trust my body anymore
I don't want to see anyone anymore
I don't deserve this fate
I don't reduce myself to sordid prayers
I have faith in my mind
I will leave strengthened2
 To deliver all my gaiety, I would open my belly
And I would break, forever, this state of urgency
That stuns me, makes me doubt my competencies
And I believe that I would give myself one more chance
 To be present, over the years
To be living, to defy the times
To be present, over the years
Life still gives me the need to defend myself
 To be present
To be living
To be present
To be living
  1.
"au fil des ans" = over time, over the years
2.
"en sortir" = to leave, manage, overcome; "sortir grandi" = to come out with increased stature, to gain in significance, to be strengthened

translated_poem:
Today, I'm okay, I've done all of this, the laughs, the joy
Tomorrow, I don't know, I'm already thinking about it, I'm scared of myself
Don't be sad, don't cry like that
It's the great circus of life, it'll be okay
 One day, I made a wish, to change the view
Everytime my heart bleeds, I feed the piranhas

 When I'm in your arms, the world stops spinning

It's the sky that guides me, it's a star that shows me the way
 Don't be sad, don't cry like that

 I do my best to embellish my life (my life)
Destiny takes us, disarms us

It's not a sad song, it's a way to keep myself from losing my mind

translated_poem:
Ah shit
Tonight
My brain's doing backflips
It's easy
I'll find a way to deal with the bad trip
I revolve
Around you
Like a parasite
On the edge of sliding into the void
New girl, new life
 I don't know what's waiting for me but
It's definitely not as beautiful as what they promised
We made noise all over the city
Burning passion, we saw hell
 I feel like myself
On this immense plain
I made a mess
It was the real thing
I'd give anything to do it again
 Boy with no counterfeit
I don't feel bad or good
I spent the night underneath bridges
Feeling good in their shadows
 Fuck the whole world
I'd rather you hate me
At least it's the real thing
 Fuck the whole world
I'd rather you hate me
At least it's the real thing
 People are pathetic
On the street
I'd rather them look at me through the
Keyhole
Live this life as if I only had one
 Poster of myself in Caroline's room
I didn't know what to do so I became a songwriter
I know some many people who lock themselves away in parodies
Waiting for a sign to agree to leave
 With a cigarette butt in their mouth
It's always the same thing
I love you, too
It's always the same thing
Go around in circles like DiCaprio's spinning-top
Between love, lies
 Dreaming your live isn't much of a solution
I spent mine thinking I was better than everybody else
Day after day in doubt and confusion
 Boy with no counterfeit
I don't feel bad or good
I spent the night underneath bridges
Feeling good in their shadows
 Fuck the whole world
